For an optimal gastronomic experience, it is advisable to visit Wazuzu at the Encore, where the quality of the fare and the attentiveness of the staff will render the expense worthwhile."

I have been checking on this place for the last couple weeks, first there was a sign on the door, \"Temporarily closed, come back later\"  Not a good sign.  Stopped again today, letter from the city showing is is shut down.  What a shame, were did my favorite waitresses go???

"It is utterly perplexing to observe how individuals residing in affluent neighborhoods will unquestioningly purchase, consume, and effusively praise any edible item that happens to be located within their perceived territorial boundaries, without regard for its actual quality or value. Let us establish a sense of reality here. The pizza served at this establishment was not merely mediocre, but it was also exorbitantly priced. The crust, supposedly crafted with water from New York, was unjustifiably burnt and charred, rendering it inedible. The sauce, if present, was seemingly devoid of any discernible flavor profile. The cheese, what little there was, had been cooked to an unfortunate state of desiccation, resulting in a texture akin to paper. The pepperoni slices, measuring a paltry dime in size, were applied with an heavy hand, defying any semblance of authentic Italian cuisine. Furthermore, the solitary basil leaf, dried to a crisp, situated in the center of the pizza, served no apparent purpose other than to accentuate the overall lackluster quality of the dish. In fact, a hastily prepared Pillsbury biscuit, topped with ketchup and Kraft cheese, would likely prove more satisfying when subjected to a makeshift cooking method involving a fire pit. Additionally, this restaurant's absence of ranch dressing as a condiment option only serves to further underscore its shortcomings. People, let us not be deceived by such transparent gimmicks. Instead, we should seek out genuine culinary experiences, such as those offered by Montesanos, Villa on Sahara and Valley View, or even Metro. The cacophonous ambiance and excessive illumination within this establishment should be sufficient deterrents against patronizing it, not to mention the challenges posed by the parking situation, which borders on the absurd."

$14 per individual left me utterly disillusioned. Out of my numerous excursions to Las Vegas, I had consistently yearned to experience the roller coaster at NYNY due to its perceived coolness, which unfortunately did not live up to my expectations. In fact, it was as enjoyable as inserting 50 cents into an arcade game at Chuck E. Cheese's and occupying one of those diminutive vehicles designed for young children that oscillate back and forth in a mundane manner. Needless to say, I am now thoroughly disheartened. A daylong admission pass cost a whopping $25, and if one desires to partake in the ride again, an additional fee of $7 is required after the initial experience. Following such an egregious act of exploitation, it is bewildering why anyone would opt to indulge in this subpar attraction once more. Instead, it is advisable to preserve your financial resources and contribute them to a more worthy cause, such as the destitute individual situated on the sky bridge.

"The experience I had at this establishment was utterly disappointing and frustrating. The staff member who assisted me was curt and displayed an uncooperative demeanor when I sought clarification regarding the products I was interested in purchasing. Notwithstanding the fact that I was the sole patron in the store at the time, my queries were met with brevity and an air of impatience. Moreover, I was taken aback by the fact that the liquid chlorine I purchased failed to produce any noticeable impact on my tested levels, despite my having followed the recommended dosage instructions. Perplexed and disconcerted by this anomaly, I opted to contact the store via telephone, only to be met with a dismissive and discourteous response from the representative who answered my call. It is worth noting that my usual place of business for such necessities is a different store, and my decision to visit Leslie's on this particular occasion was purely out of convenience; however, in light of the subpar service I received, I shall resume my patronage of the aforementioned familiar establishment henceforth."

"I am thoroughly exasperated with Sprint's subpar service, characterized by unreliable coverage, frequent app malfunctions, dropped calls, and payment issues. Furthermore, I am currently experiencing extreme frustration due to my iPhone's sudden demise and the ineptitude of a certain Sprint employee. Specifically, after my phone died, I attempted to charge it with three different chargers, but to no avail. Consequently, I brought it to the store, whereupon a male employee with light-colored hair and dark-rimmed glasses displayed visible annoyance at having to assist me. Following my explanation of the issue, he curtly informed me that the phone was functioning properly and that I could either purchase a new charger or wait; his tone conveyed a lack of concern for my inconvenience. Upon returning home, I discovered that the phone remained lifeless despite being charged for an extended period. In light of this experience, it appears that Sprint may benefit from training their staff on Apple products, particularly since they will likely encounter a high volume of iPhone users. Therefore, I shall seek assistance at the Apple Store tomorrow, as Sprint's employees have proven themselves to be incompetent."

This establishment appears to implement discriminatory practices against patrons who may encounter difficulties transporting merchandise beyond the premises, as evidenced by the restriction on utilizing carts outside. It is intriguing to ponder the rationale behind such a policy, particularly when considering that neighboring retailers, such as Target, permit customers to convey their purchases to their vehicles without any apparent qualms. One cannot help but wonder if this disparity in treatment stems from an inherent prejudice against the clientele frequenting this particular store, which has been described by some as "ghetto." A cursory examination of the customer base at Target, Fry's, and Ross fails to reveal any appreciable distinctions, rendering the rationale behind this discrepancy in policy all the more enigmatic. Personal experience has confirmed the veracity of this phenomenon, as a friend had acquired a satisfactory bargain on a decorative item for furniture, only to be thwarted by physical limitations in transporting it to our vehicle. In response, a courteous security personnel suggested driving up to the entrance, while a sympathetic cashier listened to our plight and a kind-hearted individual overheard our conversation and gallantly offered his assistance in conveying the item to our automobile. Furthermore, it is worth noting that a significant delay ensued due to the closure of a register, purportedly to enable the cashier to organize hangers, thereby prioritizing the arrangement of apparel above the expedient servicing of customers. Pervading the store were signs of neglect, evident in the absence of price tags, general disarray, and unkempt appearance, further contributing to an unsettling ambiance that discourages future visits.

We experienced an unfortunate dining episode at this establishment during our recent visit on a Tuesday evening. Specifically, we encountered an uncooperative and unfriendly server who presented us with an altered bill, surreptitiously augmenting the gratuity by $20. This dubious action, which we perceive as unethical and potentially illegal, prompted our attempt to communicate with the manager. However, our efforts were thwarted by an unresponsive staff member who claimed the manager was indisposed, despite our prolonged wait on hold. It is worth mentioning that our previous visits to this restaurant, which occurred with some regularity prior to our relocation, did not yield such unfavorable outcomes. Consequently, it appears that a decline in quality has transpired within the intervening period.

"Upon initial inspection, the exterior faÃ§ade of the hotel appeared rather appealing; however, upon check-in and entry into our assigned lodgings, certain aspects of the establishment's ambiance underwent a marked transformation. Specifically, an unpleasant odor reminiscent of hydrogen sulfide permeated the atmospheric surroundings adjacent to the aquatic recreational area, which fortunately did not permeate the interior of our room. Nonetheless, various deficiencies became apparent within the room itself, including non-functional lighting fixtures and a broken shower curtain rod, contributing to an overall cacophony of noise that reverberated throughout the premises, particularly emanating from the overhead quarters of other guests. Furthermore, the plumbing system's audible operations and the air conditioning unit's intermittent functioning throughout the nocturnal hours detracted from our potential slumber. Disappointingly, the room service we ordered on one occasion remained unclaimed and uncollected for an extended period, with the dishes remaining stationed outside our doorway for an entire subsequent day. However, certain members of the hotel staff exhibited cordiality and accommodated our requests, including the retrieval of forgotten meal trays and the provision of additional bath towels."

"A cursory examination revealed that the pizza was merely adequate, hardly deserving of extensive correspondence. The establishment boasts a few outdoor tables, which are quite pleasant during favorable meteorological conditions. However, a considerable drawback exists in the form of sluggish service. A walk-up ordering system is implemented, and on each occasion I have visited, an inordinate amount of time has elapsed before anyone has bothered to acknowledge my presence, let alone take my order. I have yet to witness the establishment bustling with activity. During my most recent visit, numerous employees were present, yet a strange phenomenon transpired; the staff persistently disregarded their patrons. The experience was so unpleasant that I could no longer tolerate the prolonged waiting period and opted to depart. When the restaurant initially opened in the plaza, I harbored high hopes for a novel dining experience nearby. Unfortunately, the frustrating process of securing the attention of staff to place an order has led me to abandon this establishment in favor of more hospitable venues where the entire transaction is agreeable."

Went climbing here about 4 months ago and used their rented shoes.... Left with a minor blister-like object on my 2nd toe and to this day I still have it.... if you can, BRING YOUR OWN SHOES... unless you want some nasty looking growth on your toe :/

Definitely did not experience a positive sentiment towards this bar, as my companion and I visited the establishment for lunch. Although the location was advantageous, situated within the Harrah's casino, the ambiance and culinary offerings failed to meet our expectations. Our server, while cordial, recommended several menu items, which upon consumption, proved to be disappointing. Specifically, the #1 recommendation, a fried bologna sandwich accompanied by French fries, was excessively saturated with grease, rendering it inedible. Similarly, my companion's selection of fish and chips was also overwhelmed by an abundance of oil, making it impossible to consume without adverse gastrointestinal consequences. Considering the substantial cost, we did not receive adequate value for our expenditure, and thus, we shall not revisit this establishment. If compelled to proffer a suggestion, it would be to avoid this bar and instead, opt for the more satisfactory dining option of the deli located within Harrah's.

"My spouse and I indulged in an evening out at Luke's on January 3rd, 2015, marking our second visit to the establishment. Unfortunately, the service we received during both instances left much to be desired, with the latter experience being particularly underwhelming. Upon being seated, a server approached our table to take our beverage orders, and a separate individual brought our drinks shortly thereafter. Our designated server made two brief appearances to collect our appetizer and entree orders before disappearing for an extended period, only to resurface midway through my meal. Not only did she neglect to offer a replenishment of my water or an additional glass of wine, but her lack of attentiveness also resulted in a ten-minute delay in processing our check using a gift card. To add insult to injury, the server failed to express any gratitude or cordiality upon presenting us with the bill. Despite the culinary delights offered by Luke's, my wife and I are disinclined to return due to the subpar service we endured."

"The utter dearth of hospitable hostesses (can you seriously expect a six-year-old child to be accommodated within the confines of an adult beverage establishment?), further exacerbated by the unfriendly and inattentive demeanor of the waiting staff, coupled with the decidedly subpar culinary offerings vis-Ã -vis their other establishments, engendered an unmitigated sense of disillusionment. This unfortunate concatenation of events precludes any future patronage of this particular venue, much to my profound chagrin, given my erstwhile enthusiasm for the advent of an Arriba's outlet in close proximity to my domicile. My personal experience with the 'white sands chimi,' typically a reliable stalwart, proved to be an uncharacteristic letdown, owing to an absence of porcine protein and an unfortunate surfeit of mediocre rice; meanwhile, my offspring, a devoted devotee of bean burritos, roundly rejected the 'yucky tortilla and spicy beans,' thereby prompting an expedited departure from the premises."

"Fraudulent activities pertaining to timeshare scams, characterized by deceitful and dubious business practices, are reprehensible and should be held accountable for their unethical conduct. My significant other is currently engaged in a telephonic conversation with the aforementioned company, endeavoring to retrieve his financial investment due to their failure to disclose the restrictive nature of the timeshare agreement, specifically the unavailability of the desired dates, which coincides with a popular multisport tournament event that attracts numerous athletes and spectators alike, thereby rendering the reservation process futile. It is truly astounding that such questionable enterprises continue to operate despite the abundance of complaints and adverse publicity surrounding their dubious methods. Furthermore, it is quite disconcerting that a reputable establishment such as Hilton Honors would engage in such deceptive practices, thereby tarnishing their reputation and eroding consumer trust. A word of caution to prospective clients: be wary of offers that appear too good to be true, as they often are, and exercise extreme diligence prior to making any financial commitments."

I had arranged for an appointment for my inaugural massage, which was slated to transpire at 7 pm last week. Prior to the scheduled time, I was advised to arrive at 6:45 pm to complete certain documents. I complied with their request and arrived promptly at the designated time. Subsequently, I was instructed to await the massage therapist in the Relaxation Room until she was prepared to attend to me. Thus, I waited patiently... and waited... and waited... until 7:25 pm, at which point the woman stationed at the front desk approached me and expressed her regret that they would be unable to accommodate me for the entire duration of the massage session. It was patently obvious that they had forgotten to register my arrival, and the therapist remained oblivious to my presence. In response to this blunder, they offered to incorporate a scrub or aromatherapy into my subsequent scheduled massage. Furthermore, they suggested that another individual could tend to me from 7:30-8:30 pm. However, I emphasized that I needed to vacate the premises by 8 pm, which coincided with the appointed time of my initial massage. Ultimately, I departed without receiving the massage, and while they displayed some remorse, I do not intend to return.

"There exist superior lodging alternatives within the Marriott franchise that vastly excel this particular establishment. It is highly recommended to avoid this hotel and instead opt for a more satisfactory experience. The premises boasts an array of unsanitary conditions, including grimy towels and a pool area undergoing restoration, which management failed to disclose prior to our arrival. Furthermore, various items within the room were dysfunctional, and the narratives presented by the managers, specifically Grace and Saul, were contradictory and lacking coherence. Additionally, the absence of a card-scanning system for elevator operation raises significant safety concerns, as it enables unrestricted access to all floors, potentially compromising the wellbeing of guests. Renaissance Hotels typically uphold a standard of excellence; regrettably, this location falls short in multiple aspects. Numerous preferable options lie within close proximity of the convention center, making it advisable to select alternative accommodations and thus avoid potential inconvenience."

I have never had the displeasure of experiencing such an interminable wait in a drive-thru, only to be surpassed by two patrons behind us who received their order before us, despite our relatively simple order consisting of merely two shakes and a dozen wings. Furthermore, upon finally receiving our wings, they were inundated with an excessive amount of sauce, rendering them unpalatable. To exacerbate matters further, we were neglected our requested ranch accompaniment. Upon entering the establishment to address these issues, we were greeted by a manager whose demeanor and appearance suggested he may have been under the influence of controlled substances. He offered us our ranch, albeit begrudgingly, and proffered a feeble excuse regarding the workers' failure to inform us of the extensive delay. No apologies were tendered, leaving us feeling utterly dissatisfied and disinclined to ever return to this purported eatery again. The service we received was truly abysmal.

Food is good, but customer service should be just as good. Very rude, not friendly makes you feel un welcome. Don't know how he stays in business. Will tell all people I know to never go there. Vegas is full of good markets and this is not one of them.

I harbored lofty expectations for an exceptional culinary experience, which were unfortunately unmet. We arrived during the morning hours, opting to be seated in the bar area. Upon observing the dishes served to the adjacent patrons, our anticipation heightened, thus prompting us to place our orders. My acquaintance selected the chicken eggs benedict, while I chose a fried chicken dish accompanied by a biscuit. Unfortunately, neither of us was particularly impressed with the flavors or presentation, leading us to feel disappointed, especially considering the substantial cost of our meal, which amounted to $48. Additionally, we each consumed a Bloody Mary, which my companion deemed palatable, although I found it rather unpleasant, necessitating the remainder of the day to eliminate the lingering aftertaste. Despite this unsatisfactory encounter, I may consider giving the establishment another opportunity on a future occasion, provided that all other dining options are unavailable.

This unequivocally does not constitute a Fry's Marketplace, as Fry's Marketplaces typically offer an extensive array of domestic items and this particular establishment manifestly does not conform to that criteria; upon entering the premises, it becomes readily apparent that the floor surfaces have been left in a state of disrepair, thereby creating an environment that is not only unsanitary but also aesthetically unpleasing, with dim lighting and cramped spatial constraints further contributing to an overall ambiance that is utterly uninviting.

When I ventured onto the website with the intention of becoming a connoisseur of fortified beverages, specifically those that are often associated with a certain degree of stigma, such as Night Train, Thunderbird, MD 20/20, and Cisco, I was anticipating an experiential excursion that would allow me to indulge in samples of these beverages. However, much to my dismay, the website had other plans in store for me, as instead of providing me with the opportunity to taste these libations, I was taken on a virtual tour of various vineyards, where I was forced to sample wines that were far more expensive than the ones I had originally intended to try, with price tags exceeding $20 per bottle. Furthermore, I was not even afforded the luxury of taking a brief respite under a bridge in Phoenix, Arizona, which I had been led to believe would be part of the overall experience. In conclusion, I must say that my foray into the world of wine was a complete and utter disappointment, and a waste of both my time and money, not to mention a significant portion of my welfare check.

"In regards to the Flamingo, there are both advantageous and disadvantageous aspects that must be taken into consideration. To begin with, the location of the establishment is situated on the central strip, thereby facilitating proximity to numerous other hotels, thereby rendering it an ideal venue for various shows and conferences. Additionally, the presence of Margaritaville, a restaurant boasting an upper deck offering a picturesque view, serves as another benefit. Furthermore, the serene ambiance of the garden, complete with flamingos, provides a tranquil atmosphere. It is worth mentioning that the staff members exhibit exceptional politeness and courtesy. However, there are certain drawbacks associated with this hotel, specifically the pervasive odor of smoke that permeates every area, despite requests for non-smoking accommodations. This resulted in an unpleasant stay for me, owing to my susceptibility to allergies. Moreover, guests who rely on airport shuttles will be required to traverse a block on foot, accompanied by their luggage, prior to arriving at the hotel's rear entrance. Another issue worthy of mention is the sighting of a roach in the vicinity of the ice machine, which may be attributed to the fact that a salad was discarded on the floor and remained there for two days, providing sustenance for the roach. In essence, this highlights the principle of natural selection. Furthermore, upon booking a room equipped with a refrigerator, I was furnished with a Styrofoam cooler instead. Unfortunately, a leak was discovered in the initial room, stemming from a problem originating from above, resulting in the room being declared out of order. Consequently, this necessitated the transportation of baggage and personal items to an alternative room."

"The dining experience at this establishment was utterly disappointing, ranking among the worst culinary encounters in recent memory. The server's nonchalant demeanor and seeming disinterest in ensuring our satisfaction with the food quality and presentation left much to be desired. Furthermore, the prices were exorbitant, making it a poor value proposition compared to other, superior Mexican restaurants in the vicinity. It is perplexing how this eatery earned the moniker 'tex-mex,' as the fare served bore little resemblance to authentic Texan-Mexican cuisine. Upon expressing my dissatisfaction through an online complaint to Cactus Jack, their lack of response spoke volumes about their apparent apathy towards customer feedback. In light of these factors, it is strongly advised to avoid this restaurant and instead opt for one of the numerous superior dining options in the surrounding area."

"I recently had my windshield replaced, only to discover that the new installation was defective, as water began seeping through the seal and compromising the integrity of the dashboard's electronic components. Following this unfortunate revelation, the service provider opted to replace the seal, but in doing so, they inadvertently damaged the molding on the driver's side of my vehicle. Subsequently, I was informed by Josh, an representative from the company's headquarters, that a local technician would be in touch with me to address the issue. However, two weeks have elapsed since then, and despite my eager anticipation, I have yet to receive any communication regarding the necessary repairs. In light of this disappointing experience, I would strongly advise potential customers to invest additional funds into ensuring a proper and timely resolution, rather than risking the likelihood of encountering similar problems."

"It is evident that during weekends, there is a palpable lack of organizational proficiency amongst the personnel occupying the workspace, which could be ameliorated by implementing a more effective system of crowd management, thereby minimizing the need for excessive gesticulation and verbal communication exhibited by the security personnel tasked with maintaining order."

"The culinary experience was utterly abysmal, as we endured an interminable two-hour wait for a paltry selection of lukewarm dishes that we had ordered. When we inquired about the protracted delay, we were met with a dismissive and hostile response from the server, who seemed to imply that the deficiencies in their service were somehow attributable to us, the patrons. To further compound the already unacceptable state of affairs, the table settings consisted of flimsy printer paper placemats and substandard square napkins, which would have been more suitable for a casual picnic than a purportedly fine dining establishment. In light of these glaring shortcomings, I would strongly advise against partaking in any future meals at this restaurant, and instead advocate for alternative venues that can provide a modicum of respectable service and ambiance."

"It is imperative that they author a literary work pertaining to the methodical degradation of a soft taco, for I had previously believed such a feat to be unattainable.  The corn tortilla, in its raw state, lacked the requisite warmth and flavor, thereby resembling cardboard in both texture and taste.  Moreover, the entire dish was served at an unpleasantly low temperature.  Notwithstanding, the rice did possess a certain je ne sais quoi, its palatability being quite satisfactory.  A female patron seated at a nearby table cautioned us against consuming the chicken taco, but our culinary curiosity proved to be our downfall, as we failed to heed her warning and instead chose to sample the dish for ourselves.  We should have been more inquisitive and solicited further details regarding her gustatory experience."

It constitutes an unpleasant and unsanitary environment, characterized by a strong and offensive odor of urine within its confines. Furthermore, based on my cursory examination, it appears that the primary patrons of this establishment are individuals who are temporary or transient in nature.

"The purportedly eerie abodes failed to elicit even a modicum of trepidation, and the flimsy barrier demarcating the alleged entrance to the underworld proved to be an ineffectual deterrent, as I suffered multiple electrical shocks, with the tripartite assault on my visual faculties rendering me momentarily disoriented; furthermore, the quality of the performances within the confines of those hastily constructed structures was subpar and readily apparent, leading me to conclude that the entire experience was a futile exercise in terror and a gratuitous squandering of financial resources."

We did not partake in the act of consuming sustenance, nor did we engage in the joyful expression of movement through dance, our primary focus being the ingestion of fermented beverages.  Unfortunately, the temperature of our bottled beverages failed to meet the standards of refreshing coolness, and the same can be said for the draft varieties.  It is regretfully acknowledged that the responsibility for this oversight lies with myself, as I neglected to voice my concerns and thereby potentially forfeited the opportunity for the establishment to provide an accommodation.  Nonetheless, it is worth noting that the discrepancy in temperature was encountered across four distinct brews, each instance serving as a reminder of the importance of maintaining optimal serving conditions.

"Today, I had an unsatisfactory experience at MCN, as my expectations were not met in terms of the quality of service provided. Specifically, I had previously received a haircut from this establishment several months prior, which I found to be satisfactory. Thus, I opted to return to this salon for coloring services today. However, upon completion of the service, I was displeased with the results, as the demarcation between my roots and the lower portion of my hair was still visible. Furthermore, I was charged an additional $25 for the blow-dry service without being informed beforehand. Consequently, I regret my decision to patronize this business for the coloring service."

I have been a loyal patron of Dr Auto since 2001, during which time I have had the pleasure of dealing with Dave and Mike, who respectively helmed the establishment as manager and chief mechanic. Their commitment to upholding the highest standards of honesty, reliability, and fairness in their business practices has been nothing short of exceptional. Throughout the past decade, I have entrusted them with the repair and maintenance of all my vehicles, amounting to a sum in excess of $50,000, and I have never once felt that I was being exploited or persuaded to purchase unnecessary services or products. My preference for acquiring vehicles through auctions or fixer-uppers has been well-catered to by the team at Dr Auto, who have consistently displayed a profound understanding of my requirements and concerns. However, recent events have led me to question the integrity of the establishment under its new management. Following the departure of Mike and Dan from the company, I have noticed a marked shift in focus towards maximizing profits, which appears to have superseded their erstwhile commitment to providing "Hometown Service With Integrity". In light of these developments, I am compelled to exercise caution in my dealings with Dr Auto and to advise others to do the same. It is crucial to scrutinize the recommended repairs meticulously and ensure that they are indeed necessary before entrusting your vehicle to their care. Alternatively, it may be wise to seek out a more dependable and trustworthy service provider.

"We had secured a private reservation for our daughter's 21st birthday celebration, only to discover upon arrival that our designated space, which had been booked well in advance, was now unavailable due to an unexpected scheduling conflict with a bachelorette party. Despite having personally visited the establishment a week prior to acquaint myself with the proprietor, Danny, and confirming the details of our reservation, including the number of guests, table arrangement, and high chair requirements, the manager on duty denied any recollection of our previous encounter. This unfortunate turn of events led us to seek alternative arrangements, resulting in our decision to take our business elsewhere. Although we have historically enjoyed the culinary offerings of Towne Tavern, the subpar service we received on this particular occasion was truly inexcusable."

"Britney Spears' live performance was an utter disappointment, characterized by a profound lack of enthusiasm and energy, as she appeared disengaged and exhibited minimal movement throughout the duration of the show. I strongly advise against allocating time and resources to attend such a subpar event, and instead recommend alternative forms of entertainment, such as observing passersby at Cabo Wabo, which promises to be significantly more engaging and enjoyable."

"An unfortunate culinary experience awaits those who venture into this eatery, nestled within a dilapidated industrial setting. Its appearance, reminiscent of a neglected shanty, belies its purported function as a restaurant, leading one to surmise that it has remained dormant for several decades. Upon entering, patrons are met with a meager selection of dishes, offered at exorbitant prices, which fail to align with the subpar quality of the cuisine. In essence, a visit to this establishment is an exercise in futility, and it is advisable to seek alternative dining options."

I have been a patron of this Red Lobster establishment for an extensive period of time, and I must say that the quality of the cuisine and service has been steadily declining in recent times. During my most recent visit, a group of acquaintances and I had the misfortune of experiencing a disappointing dining experience. One member of our party opted for the fish and chips, but what arrived was merely a plate of batter with no fish present. Furthermore, two of us had the unpleasant experience of consuming Cobb salads with frozen lettuce, which not only detracted from the overall flavor but also raised concerns regarding the restaurant's adherence to proper food safety standards. It is evident that this establishment requires a comprehensive renovation and reevaluation of its operational procedures in order to meet the expectations of its clientele. However, I must commend our server, Mary, whose exceptional level of professionalism and dedication to ensuring a positive dining experience served as a beacon of hope amidst the otherwise lackluster service we received.

"PHOENIX GATES ONLY: Subject to my platinum status with Delta, I generally harbor a favorable disposition towards the airline. However, my assessment of their corporate performance is not the focus of this review. Rather, I aim to evaluate the quality of Delta's gates at Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport, where they operate approximately 5-6 gates. Unfortunately, my experience was marred by several issues that detracted from my overall satisfaction. Specifically, I encountered the following challenges:

- A single, cramped restroom with limited ingress and egress, which frequently resulted in awkward elbow-bumping encounters with fellow patrons within the confined space
- A meager selection of dining options, consisting solely of a Wendy's restaurant and a lackluster 'Cantina' establishment
- Absence of a dedicated bookstore or newsstand, depriving travelers of convenient access to literary diversions or informative materials
- Insufficient beverage options, with a dearth of refreshment stands or specialized drink vendors
- A glaring absence of a coffee shop or cafe, where weary travelers might otherwise seek respite and caffeine rejuvenation
- Unsavory, worn-out carpeting that seemed to exacerbate the already uninviting ambiance of the gate areas
- Overcrowded waiting areas, characterized by limited seating options and an overall sense of congestion
- A paltry number of charging stations, with a mere two stations available per gate, as I diligently counted during my brief observation

In light of these deficiencies, I respectfully implore Delta to consider upgrading their gate facilities at Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport, to the extent feasible. Your attention to this matter would be greatly appreciated, and I extend my sincerest gratitude in advance for any efforts undertaken to enhance the passenger experience. Thank you, Lee."

"I am employed in close proximity to this eatery, and I opted to procure a 'lunch Greek salad' that was promoted for $5.90, inclusive of complimentary transportation. Upon delivery, I was taken aback by the inflated cost of $11.80! The salad itself amounted to $8.49, with an additional $2.50 delivery fee. It is utterly perplexing that the establishment would necessitate such an exorbitant charge for a mere pedestrian journey across the street. My attempts to seek clarification on the matter were met with discourteous treatment from the staff member who answered my call. Consequently, I must advise against patronizing this restaurant, particularly in light of the numerous unfavorable testimonials I have since encountered. Instead, I suggest venturing a brief distance further to Cityscape, where one can expect a superior dining experience."

"My decision to remain at the Monte Carlo was predicated upon the fact that our seminar was being conducted on the premises; however, upon arrival, it became patently evident that this alleged four-star establishment failed to meet even the most basic standards of quality and cleanliness. The queue for check-in was excessively prolonged, leading to considerable embarrassment on my part, particularly in light of the presence of my staff. Upon finally gaining access to our accommodations, it became apparent that the rooms had not undergone any significant renovations since the 1980s, featuring antiquated furnishings and inadequate climate control systems that emitted an incessant, annoying hum every two minutes, rendering them utterly futile. Furthermore, the bedding consisted of flimsy, threadbare blankets that offered scant protection against the elements, resulting in my contracting a virulent cold during the third night of my stay. The bathtub, too, was unacceptably shallow and outdated, possessing an unsightly, grimy appearance that precluded any possibility of enjoyable immersion. Given the dearth of viable alternatives, I opted not to lodge a formal complaint, as I surmised that relocation to another room would yield scant improvement in terms of amenities. Frankly, I would have preferred to stay at a Comfort Suites establishment rather than suffer the indignity of remaining at this purported four-star hotel. Although our brief sojourn at the Monte Carlo encompassed merely two nights, the dining options available both within and adjacent to the hotel proved satisfactory, if unremarkable. In conclusion, I must emphasize my fervent determination never to return to this woefully inadequate lodging, and I eagerly anticipate the opportunity to seek refuge at The Mandalay, where, presumably, a vastly superior level of service and accommodation awaits."

"Appalling client service encounter. I have experienced two problems with their merchandise, the latest being a carbon fiber backing that fits poorly and features haphazard lines. Its vibrant red hue makes the crooked lines glaringly conspicuous, exemplifying the abysmal quality control that characterizes this organization. It appears to be a fledgling, unpolished business run by a couple, one that the owners seem to be utterly indifferent towards. A case in point is the fact that there are three separate sets of guidelines: those accessible online, those imprinted on the packaging, and those positioned at the base of the contents within the box. Merely one of these sets of directions is accurate in relation to the carbon fiber sticker, which happens to be the item I acquired. 

Their customer support team and I engaged in a mechanical and unproductive email exchange. It felt like communicating with an automated response system; they expected me to bear the cost of return shipping, after which they would take their time processing a refund or dispatching a replacement. This is a classic illustration of deplorable customer service. It is evident that they lack concern for their clientele. 

I shall upload an image showcasing the defective fit and haphazard lines."
Competition for nv energy is coming in 2015 for information contact me  I can't wait to switch #deregulation of energy

I have been to this EyeMasters store on two occasions: once to place an order for contact lenses, and once to pick the order up. On both occasions I had to wait an unacceptably long time to be helped. This store is seriously understaffed so, unless you have a lot of time to kill, take your business elsewhere. Plus, the prices aren't that good.

Waited an unreasonable duration of forty minutes for the procurement of two inadequate sandwiches, specifically, a subpar hamburger that my spouse obtained, which was ostensibly prepared by freezing and subsequent heating, and a deplorably overcooked and desiccated chicken ciabatta that I had the misfortune of consuming; the pleasantness of the waitstaff notwithstanding, the fundamental issue resides within the culinary department, resulting in an exorbitant total of nearly fifty dollars for two sandwiches and two beverages, thereby rendering our dining experience utterly dissatisfying and precluding any future visits.

I procured various commodities from said establishment, including but not limited to:  
1. A solitary item which was not conveyed in accordance with the predetermined timeframe, albeit insignificant in nature.  
2. A single entry portal, complete with transom, valued at five hundred currency units.  
3. A customized aperture, priced at twelve hundred currency units.  

Subsequent to receiving the aforementioned items, I noticed a discrepancy between the style of the entranceway and the transom, prompting me to initiate a telephonic communication with the vendor. The response I received was less than satisfactory, as I was informed that the incongruous design was, in fact, what I had requested. Perplexed by this assertion, I sought clarification, only to be met with an evasive and unhelpful rejoinder.  

It became apparent that the vendor's primary concern was to avoid culpability, rather than ensuring customer satisfaction. Moreover, upon perusing the purchaser's order, I discovered that the printed document was so imprecise that the supplier could deliver virtually any product and still maintain that it conformed to my specifications.  

Furthermore, my contractor acquired my exterior cladding from the same retailer, which unfortunately proved to be an off-brand offering subpar quality. Such questionable business practices left me feeling utterly dissatisfied and reluctant to support the store further. Consequently, I opted to acquire the remaining fenestration products (Andersen) from The Plywood Mart, despite their higher cost and lack of matching qualities.

"OUT OF BUSINESS. Spice Asian Bistro has assumed occupancy of this physical location, and I am eagerly anticipating the opportunity to partake in their culinary offerings and share my thoughts via a comprehensive assessment."

"It is truly remarkable that the notion of bringing a meal to consume at a culinary celebration would ever cross one's mind, given the ostensible purpose of attending such an event is to indulge in gastronomical delights offered by an array of mobile food vendors. However, the sheer volume of people and the sluggish pace of queueing rendered the endeavor of partaking in the primary activity of the festival an exercise in futility, prompting my associates and I to abandon our attempts to sample the various edibles available and opt for an expedited departure instead. The process of exiting the premises proved to be an arduous task, with the time required to navigate the congested parking area and gain egress from the venue rivaling the duration spent within the festival itself. Furthermore, the fact that an admission fee was charged for entry, only to be met with additional charges at each individual food stall, struck us as utterly reprehensible and tantamount to robbery. Fortunately, we managed to procure a Groupon offering six entries for a mere $25, thereby mitigating the financial impact of the experience. Nevertheless, the prospect of waiting in line for an extended period of time is inherent to such events, and it is reasonable to expect that said lines should exhibit some semblance of mobility."

This establishment epitomizes the quintessence of unpleasantness, and my comprehension of the occasional error during periods of heightened activity does not preclude the fact that my experiences here have been consistently subpar. Specifically, I have requested fries on multiple occasions, only to receive them in a state of frigidity and undercooking, despite the purported fresh preparation; furthermore, the quantity of toppings in my Blizzard has been conspicuously scant; lastly, the ambiance leaves much to be desired, with an abundance of dirt and grime that does not inspire confidence in the cleanliness of the facility. Suffice it to say, the presence of a C rating in the lobby comes as no surprise, and I shall henceforth refrain from patronizing this establishment for culinary purposes.

"Gastronomical Experience: 4 Stars
Ambiance: 3
Hospitality: -7
Sanitation: Dubious
Recurrence: Negative

The predicament: A personal acquaintance and I were observing in utter disbelief as a periplaneta americana traversed the eatery's floor for an extended period, until it ventured beneath our table. My companion tactfully intercepted the insect and confined it between her vacant glass and a menu, subsequently summoning our server. My associate courteously explicated the circumstances to the server and requested his intervention. His response was somewhat perplexing, expressing a lack of comprehension regarding our expectations of his role in addressing the issue, accompanied by an expression of distaste towards the arthropod. We proffered various solutions, including the procurement of a dustpan or the transportation and release of the captive insect at the entrance. Our suggestions were met with indifference, as he elected to entrust my companion with the responsibility of transporting the glass, insect, and menu to the exit, while he gallantly held the door open for her. She returned, visibly disturbed, as the server retreated with an air of offense. 

Following a discussion confirming the inadequacy of the service, my companion approached the server during the delivery of our check, mentioning that he should prioritize the matter in the future. His countenance betrayed a sense of umbrage, as he struggled to articulate a response, appearing to restrain stronger emotions. 'I... I will... retain that remark for future reference.' We settled our account and promptly departed. 

Kudos to the bartender and culinary artist for a delectable Manhattan and a savory Western Burger, yet we shall not revisit the establishment."

This establishment's customer service checkout experience is utterly deplorable, particularly during peak hours. It is inconceivable that only two individuals are manning the cash registers at 12:00 pm on a Sunday, especially considering the numerous patrons awaiting assistance. Although it is conceivable that staff members may be absent due to unforeseen circumstances, the dearth of personnel remains inexcusable. Furthermore, the manager on duty appears to be impervious to the growing line of customers, instead choosing to engage in levity and amusement with a fellow employee while conducting transactions at a glacial pace. Following a brief interlude, both resume their responsibilities, albeit with an air of nonchalance that belies the gravity of the situation. As a seasoned retail veteran, I find this lackadaisical attitude completely unacceptable, prompting me to abandon my shopping basket and the $300 worth of merchandise I intended to purchase. The sole bright spot amidst this fiasco is the courteous demeanor of the security officer, who extends a warm welcome upon entry.

"A solitary lexeme: WHY????!!!

Purchased a Groupon for this establishment, as I was visiting Las Vegas over the weekend, and was eager to sample their culinary offerings. Upon entering the premises, I was struck by the multitude of individuals idly standing about, and the girl who took my order appeared utterly disinterested in her work, her demeanor projecting an unmistakable air of indifference. Her lack of friendliness was mirrored by the demeanor of her colleagues behind the counter, who seemed equally unenthusiastic about their vocational endeavors. 

How, pray tell, does one manage to botch a Chinese Chicken Salad wrap? The very notion seems almost inconceivable! Alas, the $11 I expended on this gastronomical venture might have been more judiciously invested in a sock saturated with honey Dijon mustard, for all the epicurean satisfaction it afforded me. 

My lone star rating, if you will, was reserved for my beverage, a potent concoction of Moonshine and Everclear, which, despite its alcoholic prowess, proved the undisputed highlight of my visit. 

Were you to find yourself in the Miracle Mile shops, your stomach growling with hunger, you would do well to perambulate an additional mile or two, rather than partake of the uninspired victuals proffered by this establishment."

I have been frequenting Brillo Box on a regular basis, and I must say, my experiences have been nothing short of satisfactory. However, my companion for the evening, a fellow of 28 years of age, hailing from the Republic of Turkey, was not afforded the same luxury. Despite possessing a valid form of identification, specifically, a Turkish ID card that explicitly stated his age, he was denied entry into the esteemed establishment. It is utterly reprehensible that the individual tasked with manning the entrance, exhibited such discourteous behavior, particularly given the fact that Brillo Box has faced similar circumstances in the past. In light of this incident, I shall refrain from partaking in any future culinary excursions to this venue, and instead, seek out alternative dining options that offer a more hospitable ambiance. Furthermore, I strongly suggest that the management of Brillo Box consider recruiting a replacement for the current bouncer, one who possesses a more civil demeanor and a penchant for treating patrons with respect and dignity.

"In the event that you are seeking medical professionals who possess the ability to create a welcoming atmosphere, thereby alleviating any potential apprehensions you may harbor regarding the healthcare experience of your child, it is advisable to avoid this particular facility. My personal encounter with Dr. Nauman exemplifies this notion, as his remarks pertaining to my tardiness in scheduling my infant daughter's vaccinations fostered an environment that was devoid of comfort. Thus, I strongly recommend seeking alternative options, such as the services provided by Dr. Marlon Mendoza, who possesses an expertise that is commendable and refreshingly distinct from that which I experienced previously."

These creatures are either destined to succumb to the perils of despondency or resort to insurrectionary behavior, devouring all in their path. It is truly astonishing that organizations such as PETA have not yet taken notice of this establishment and staged a large-scale demonstration. Perambulating within these confines elicits profound sorrow, as the animals exhibit either a tranquilized demeanor or an unsettling fixation. Having been a resident of Las Vegas for a brief period, I must concede that this venue warrants inclusion on one's itinerary, purely due to its monumental failure.

I truly yearned to relish this pizzeria, as my initial experience with Jimmy & Joes yielded a meager amount of pepperoni on their pies.  Despite my hope that this dearth of flavorful toppings was merely an oversight by a novel Ahwatukee establishment, my subsequent order proved equally disappointing, with an even scantier amount of pepperoni adorning the crust.  The staff expressed remorse and vowed to convey my concerns to the culinary team, but alas, their efforts were futile, as the second attempt at ordering pizza resulted in an even more paltry offering of pepperoni.  It is utterly unremarkable fare, with prices comparable to those of esteemed establishments such as Spinatos or Oreganos, yet lacking the gastronomic finesse associated with those revered eateries.  For a superior pizza experience, I would advocate foregoing this venue and opting instead for the delectable offerings of Dominos or Papa Johns, whose culinary prowess surpasses that of Jimmy & Joes.  If, however, you seek a genuinely satisfying pizza excursion, I would recommend venturing to either Spinatos or Oreganos, where the fare is certain to satiate your cravings.

"Upon halting at this market, my primary intention was to investigate the 'u-pick' peach venue. Subsequently, upon entering the establishment, I noticed that certain vegetables appeared somewhat aged. Following a cursory examination of the produce, I selected two strawberries and a few tomatoes. Proceeding to the checkout counter, I tendered payment via debit card, at which point the cashier informed me that the total amount due was $3.01; however, an additional $.50 surcharge would be incurred due to the usage of a non-cash payment method. Upon expressing my surprise at the unexpected fee, the cashier responded in a brusque manner, stating that the transaction had already been processed. In light of this information, I inquired whether it would be feasible to receive a refund of the $.50 charge, to which the cashier retorted that the refund process would necessitate an additional $.90 fee. Considering the unprofessional demeanor exhibited by the cashier, I have decided to avoid patronizing this establishment in the future."
"The protracted duration of the check-in process precipitated our tardiness for the performance, which, despite its mediocrity, did not justify a tariff exceeding ten dollars."

"The Bloody Mary was rather palatable, particularly considering its economical price point of 3.99. However, the culinary offerings were subpar and failed to meet expectations. My spouse opted for the mushroom burger, accompanied by sweet potato fries, which proved to be unremarkable in taste and quality. In contrast, my own dining experience was marred by a flavorless taco salad, featuring an uninspired amalgamation of processed chicken breast that lacked any semblance of gastronomic appeal. Following a return of the unsatisfactory dish, I elected to sample the alternative ground beef variation, which, while exhibiting some improvement, ultimately fell short of my gustatory standards. Despite the server's valiant efforts to rectify the situation, it became apparent that the kitchen staff was unable to rise to the occasion, leading me to conclude that future visits to this establishment would be unwarranted."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."
Front desk personnel exhibited an apathetic demeanor, reminiscent of a department store environment. Following a request for a room change due to an unpleasant acidic vinegar odor, I was met with an ambiguous response, suggesting either the provision of fans or a return to the lobby. Upon descending, an extensive queue awaited me, which prompted an inquiry addressed to a front desk attendant regarding the appropriate person to address. His reply was brusque, as he denied the existence of the previously consulted front desk representative and redirected me to wait in a corner until his manager became available. During a brief conversation with the manager, I pointed out the disarray of the front area, only to be met with silence and an absence of any conciliatory sentiment. He carelessly tossed my identification onto the table and slid it in my direction without uttering a word of apology for the inconvenience. Upon acquiring my new room key card, it became apparent that the entire floor shared the same pungent vinegar scent. Upon entering the room, it felt akin to a Marriott Springfield Suites, specifically one of those prolonged stay hotels catering to business travelers, yet lacking a coffee machine. For those seeking a smoke-free, gaming-free hotel, I would suggest the Trump, boasting a remarkable view from the northern portion of the Strip."

Stopped in to get help replacing a pendant and sconce that we had bought years ago.  The lady who helped me was not very helpful and seemed bothered to even give me minimum information.  I had a bad experience a year or so ago with customer service here but hoped they might have improved in this area...nope!

"My customary method of placing an order from this establishment involves conducting the transaction via telephone; however, my experiences have been inconsistent, oscillating between extremes of satisfactory and unsatisfactory encounters, with no middle ground. Previous grievances I have had with Domino's include instances of receiving erroneous or unpalatable cuisine and encountering poor clientele service. 

On this particular day, I opted to utilize Domino's internet-based ordering platform to procure some culinary items. The process of ordering through their online service was indeed expedient and straightforward; yet, I encountered a significant obstacle approximately forty minutes subsequent to initiating the order, upon realizing that I had inadvertently furnished an incorrect telephonic contact number. Without hesitation, I contacted the store and engaged in a conversation with a male representative, who assured me that my edibles would be dispatched forthwith via the succeeding courier. In response to my inquiry regarding the temperature of the food upon its arrival, he responded brusquely, stating that the comestibles had been housed within an insulated receptacle and would be dispatched promptly. Following a delay of nearly sixty minutes, I ultimately received my cold repast, which had been exposed to ambient temperatures for no less than forty minutes. 

It goes without saying that I shall not be soliciting their services again in the future."

"The lingering memories of the establishment's unkempt ambiance continue to perturb me; specifically, the outdoor seating area's state of disarray during my visit on May 15th, 2010, left much to be desired in terms of upkeep and overall aesthetic appeal. Upon entering the premises, my attention was immediately drawn to two lamps positioned on the brick wall exterior, one of which was in a state of utter disrepair, with the other two ceiling fans situated on the patio failing to function properly, sans any visible hardware and accompanied by a solitary floor fan stationed atop the bar, which proved insufficient in mitigating the swarming presence of flies, one of which unfortunately met its demise within my partially consumed beverage, rendering it unpalatable; regrettably, this review bears no relation to the culinary aspects of the eatery, but rather serves as an account of my disappointment regarding the standards of maintenance and initial impressions, as the tables and chairs, in particular, appeared unclean, and I must emphasize that my expectations for adequate upkeep extend to outdoor seating areas as well, for which reason I find it necessary to express my dissatisfaction with the state of affairs I witnessed during my visit."

One stare for the cute shop and very friendly receptionist. Went in for blow dry. The worse my hair has ever looked. Flat, bangs in my eyes, and whatever product was put on for shine would not allow me to style my hair once home. Had to wash it and start over. New grads from school, maybe? Will not be going back.

I had a verified booking, but regrettably, I erroneously reserved it for Wednesday, whereas my genuine intention was for Tuesday. Upon our arrival at 6 pm on aforementioned Tuesday in March, the eatery was practically unoccupied, save for a solitary table housing a few customers. The hostess, unfortunately, displayed an uncooperative demeanor, expressing skepticism regarding her ability to seat the four of us. We decided to forgo dining at that establishment and instead opted to visit the Herb Box.

"Extremely disillusioned and utterly dissatisfied with my recent dining experience at this establishment, which occurred on a Saturday evening, I must say. Allegedly, the kitchen staff was operating with a diminished capacity, purportedly due to the absence of two chefs, which ostensibly accounted for the interminable delay in the preparation and service of our meals. Following a protracted wait of approximately 20 minutes to traverse the serpentine queue at the food counter, we were compelled to endure an additional 35 minutes before our culinary selections finally emerged from the kitchen. While the temperature of the food was satisfactorily warm, unfortunately, this solitary aspect proved to be the sole redeeming quality of the entire dining experience. Thus, I unequivocally refuse to patronize this restaurant again in the future, and instead, I would opt to frequent establishments that offer superior culinary fare, such as YCs."
"Are you serious?!?!

My daughter and I opted to visit this establishment as she had been informed that the Coconut Shrimp was of superior quality, and upon perusing the menu, we decided to sample the cheese curds, which, in our opinion, were adequate, although somewhat unremarkable. The focaccia, accompanied by three minuscule portions of flavored butter, was relatively satisfying. However, my selection, the Lobster, was profoundly disappointing, as it was overcooked to an unfortunate degree, rendering it tough and rubbery in texture. Furthermore, it was not served with butter, as one might have expected, but rather with oil, which only exacerbated the unpleasantness of the dish. My daughter's choice, the Coconut Shrimp, fared little better, as it arrived with an excessively dark brown exterior, imbuing the shrimp with an acrid, burnt flavor that overpowered any subtle nuances the dish may have otherwise possessed. The ambiance of the restaurant was also underwhelming, with decor that seemed outdated and a pungent odor that permeated the atmosphere. So appalled were we by the overall experience that I felt compelled to register my discontent and advise others against squandering their resources on such an unsatisfactory dining excursion.

Dispatcher was incredibly rude. But it's a tow company, no surprise there. Pulled up in our cab as the tow truck was pulling in with my car. Didn't even park my car on their lot and charged me $300!! What a scam!

Located in the picturesque downtown area of Mesa, Arizona, this shopping establishment boasts an eclectic array of second-hand items and questionable products that may appeal to those with a penchant for vintage or less-than-desirable merchandise. Patrons who relish the pungent aroma of body odor, inexpensive disinfectants, and soiled infant diapers will find themselves in olfactory nirvana within these walls. Furthermore, individuals who are unfazed by mingling with the destitute, drug-addicted "Occupy Walmart" demographic may discover a sense of belonging among the store's clientele. However, shoppers seeking quality edibles and a secure retail atmosphere where they need not constantly monitor their personal belongings or harbor doubts about the safety of certain items available for purchase would be well-advised to explore alternative venues. Currently, the store is hosting a customer appreciation event, offering a complimentary set of dentures and a year's supply of either deodorant or adult incontinence products with every $100 expenditure (though, alas, this turned out to be a facetious claim). In conclusion, this shopping destination earns a resounding "nasty, nasty, nasty" designation, and prospective patrons have been duly cautioned. In fact, the author has issued an ultimatum to his spouse, threatening to hail a taxi home should she ever venture there again.

I have had the privilege of being associated with Wells Fargo Bank since 1988, and my recent experience with their mortgage services has been nothing short of abysmal. My interest in procuring a mortgage for a purchase led me to interact with Michael Jordan, who purported to be a Mortgage Consultant. However, his lack of adeptness in providing service and responding to my communications via email or telephone was truly appalling. As a client with an impeccable record of 24 years with this financial institution and an exceptional credit score of 800, I cannot fathom how they would treat customers who have not had the pleasure of banking with them. Furthermore, the supervisor whom I contacted at Wells Fargo Home Mortgage (16211 N Scottsdale Rd., Ste A-1 | Scottsdale, AZ 85254), proved to be futile in addressing my grievances regarding Michael Jordan's performance. Linda Baker, the Loan Doc Specialist, displayed an unprofessional demeanor when dealing with me, and her conduct left much to be desired. In light of these events, I strongly advise potential clients to avoid engaging with these individuals and Wells Fargo Bank altogether. I intend to terminate all of my accounts with this institution forthwith.

We visited this establishment with the intention of celebrating a milestone anniversary, but unfortunately, our experience was marred by a series of unfortunate events that left us feeling utterly disillusioned. Our server appeared perplexed and visibly agitated by the prospect of processing multiple payments, evincing a palpable irritation that bordered on incivility. His interactions with us were cursory and taciturn, save for a few terse and caustic remarks. Moreover, certain members of our party received expedited attention at the bar, while we awaited our beverages interminably - an interval that now exceeds 17 minutes and continues to stretch on inexorably. Such subpar service is truly disheartening and falls short of our expectations.

"Our offspring participated in a martial arts competition at the Riviera, thus we opted to lodge there for the sake of practicality. Upon arriving at our accommodations, we discovered a used bandage in the planter, which we promptly brought to the attention of the front desk staff. They assured us that housekeeping would address the issue, but alas, their efforts proved ineffectual. Additionally, our bathing receptacle failed to properly drain, the furnishings appeared to be saturated with nicotine residue, and the most remarkable aspect of our lodgings was the pungent aroma that permeated our quarters, eerily reminiscent of a Willy Nelson concert. Our progeny have now become acquainted with the scent of cannabis, and we shall seek alternative accommodations for future tournaments, as the convenience did not justify the extent to which I was revolted by the hotel's overall state."

"I am penning a narrative pertaining to my personal experience at this establishment approximately one year ago; it is one of the rare instances wherein I can proffer a rating of one star. My companions and I opted to dine at this location due to the fact that the alternative renowned crawfish venue was overcrowded, and we were all experiencing hunger pangs. My acquaintance proposed we sample the culinary offerings of this eatery, yet I harbored some reservations. As an individual hailing from Southern California, I am accustomed to the superior quality of shrimp and crawfish offered by Boiling Crab. 

The fries served were rather unremarkable in taste and texture, lacking the crispiness and flavor that I have come to expect from this staple side dish. The dipping sauce accompanying the fries was equally underwhelming, possessing a watery consistency and an uninspired flavor profile that failed to impress my palate. 

Our order of shrimp arrived lacking the freshness I had anticipated, with shells that proved arduous to remove. Moreover, I encountered difficulty in hailing the attention of our server, despite the modest number of patrons present. 

In conclusion, I must state that a return visit to this establishment is unlikely, as my expectations were not met during my initial encounter."

"Having scheduled a rental of a Mustang convertible for a day, I received a call precisely 18 minutes prior to my designated pickup time, informing me that the car was unavailable. Presuming that a comparable or superior alternative would be proffered at the same price, I was taken aback by their offer of a Jeep Wrangler in lieu of a sports car. Following my request for a suitable replacement, I was presented with the option of a BMW Z4, albeit at an additional cost of $50 per day. Upon expressing my dissatisfaction with this proposal, I was met with resistance, as the representative insisted that it was the best they could offer. With a carefully planned excursion to the Hoover Dam already arranged, my wife and I were left with little choice but to abandon our plans, given the lack of availability of comparable vehicles at the last minute from other agencies. As such, I strongly advise against utilizing the services of this particular rental company, as they appear to prioritize profit over customer satisfaction."

"Well...I should have heeded the warnings conveyed in the multitude of reviews I perused prior to booking my appointment, and thus, it is entirely my own fault. When I scheduled my apt for a blow-dry, I brought to the attention of the salon that I had read unfavorable reviews on Yelp and was skeptical about their proficiency, yet I opted to give them a chance due to their proximity to my residence. My hairdresser displayed a profound lack of expertise in blow-drying my hair, resulting in an unmitigated disaster. She required continuous guidance from a colleague who had recently ceased working at the establishment, querying her on the most basic techniques such as brush selection and manipulation. While I acknowledge that novice stylists require mentorship, perhaps closer supervision would be beneficial? Consuming an hour (!) to complete the task, I departed with an appearance that fell short of my expectations and did not warrant the financial investment. The proprietor was present throughout, yet gave no indication of exercising adequate supervision over her personnel or concern for client contentment. In conclusion, my mistake; I should have placed greater reliance on the collective wisdom of Yelp reviewers. I am delighted to witness the proliferation of establishments in Arcadia, particularly when they exhibit such meticulous attention to detail in their decor, but ultimately, mere aesthetics are insufficient to ensure repeat business; quality service is paramount."

"Abysmal, atrocious, and utterly deplorable! My encounter with the medical staff at this facility has been nothing short of a calamitous debacle. I have had the displeasure of interacting with some of the most discourteous and unprofessional nurses and physicians that I have ever had the misfortune of crossing paths with. I am resolute in my decision never to return to this institution again, and I am utterly dumbfounded by the fact that it has managed to procure any positive reviews whatsoever."

"Amidst the sweltering temperatures of Tempe's summer, we relished in the festive ambiance characterized by lively music and a carefree vacation vibe; however, our experience was unfortunately marred by certain culinary missteps, specifically pertaining to the excessive saltiness of margaritas, the lackluster quality of beers, and the overpowering spiciness of food â?a sensory assault that obliterated any semblance of flavor, even for a seasoned palate accustomed to Thai-hot cuisine. Despite the reasonable pricing of menu items, our visit ultimately proved to be an unfortunate squandering of resources."

"A utterly abysmal, reprehensible, and exorbitant Easter spread, we compensated nearly one hundred dollars for the trio of us, and it was nowhere near worth the expenditure.  The bill of fare sounded exceptionally enticing, yet half of the culinary offerings listed never manifested themselves at the smorgasbord.  My spouse is still searching for that particular duck l'orange.  The victuals that did materialize were not of an impressive quality either.  The lamb was parched, the crab legs were quite revolting, and the cheese and salad assortment was paltry.  The overall caliber of the comestibles did not justify the cost.  Prior to our familiarity with the now defunct Aladdin buffet, we would regularly partake in the Parisian spread on each sojourn.  It held value in those days, boasting a superior array and finer quality edibles.  Presently, one could effortlessly obtain comparable quality refuse at a smorgasbord priced at half the amount.  I felt utterly let down."

We placed a telephone call to the hotel's central reservation system in order to procure accommodations for an impending visitation, and I must say that the manner in which we were addressed by the youthful female who responded to our call left much to be desired in terms of both civility and professionalism. Indeed, it seemed that this individual harbored some sort of animosity or chip on her shoulder, as evidenced by the brusque and dismissive tone she employed throughout our conversation. Furthermore, it appeared that she presumed us to be in a subservient position vis-a-vis herself, which naturally engendered a certain measure of indignation and incredulity on our part. Notwithstanding this unfortunate encounter, we nevertheless entertain hopes that the actual sojourn at the hotel will prove to be more pleasant and satisfactory than the aforementioned reservation process. -- Johnny J.

We indulged in the process of checking into what appeared to be a rather unsanitary accommodation, replete with an array of edible remnants dispersed throughout the space and bedding that had yet to be properly arranged, necessitating our awaiting the arrival of the cleaning personnel for a duration exceeding sixty minutes. It was apparent that collaboration with the conventional hotel staff was not a feasible option for improving our circumstances, as their off-site customer service, characterized by a subpar quality and delivered via telephonic means, proffered uninspired solutions, such as relocating to a less desirable suite situated within a more remote tower or relinquishing a resort fee. It is evident that Luxury Suites International harbors little inclination towards cultivating enduring relationships with their clientele, thereby rendering it unadvisable to consider booking with them.
The Bartender was rude and if I wasn't with my family I would have thrown my drink in his face.\nActually I wanted to do a lot more, but i figured a true review would hurt them most.  DONT GO!

I am compelled to concur with the sentiments expressed by the two individuals who awarded this establishment a solitary star in their evaluations. The personnel whom I encountered during my sojourn at this venue were indeed quite cordial and hospitable; however, this aspect constitutes the sole positive attribute that I can remark upon. We opted to reside here due to its proximity to our domicile, which was undergoing renovation at the time. Unfortunately, the administration of this facility leaves much to be desired, as they steadfastly refuse to accept any culpability in the event of an untoward occurrence. Upon our arrival, we were obliged to slumber upon a severely worn mattress and a box spring that possessed wheels attached via screws. Following two nocturnal periods, we began to experience bites, which we subsequently discovered were caused by the presence of bed bugs within the aforementioned box spring. When we brought this issue to the attention of the management, they leveled accusations against us, suggesting that we were responsible for introducing these pests into the premises. These parsimonious individuals declined to dispose of the infested box spring, prompting us to discard it ourselves and purchase a new bed, which we utilized for the remainder of our tenure. Additionally, we procured the Wi-Fi service offered by this complex, but the signal strength proved to be woefully inadequate, ultimately leading to a refund of our payment. Having resided in various impoverished locales, I must aver that this particular abode surpassed them all in terms of sheer unpleasantness. I strongly advise potential lessees to exercise caution and seek alternative accommodations.

I made an appointment to get a flu shot here.  got several emails telling me not to forget and when I showed up at 8 am on a Monday morning a girl shrugs her shoulders and tells me they are not doing flu shots that day.  after I missed two hours of work this sucks.  never going to cvs again it is always a bad idea no matter which location you go to.

Lamb Balti presented an amalgamation of bulky tomato, onion, and green pepper fragments, while the lamb itself was merely adequate, lacking the desired succulence and texture. Furthermore, the peas in the mattar paneer exhibited a deplorable state of desiccation. Ultimately, this culinary excursion proved to be an uninspiring experience, with the chapati serving as the sole redeeming feature, though even that was hardly sufficient to elevate it beyond mediocrity.

"Abysmal venue. Utterly displeased with our recent choice merely a fortnight ago.  Appalling service, characterized by brusque and impatient attendants.  Enigmatic pricing scheme, whereby patrons are charged exorbitant fees for even the most trifling amenities.  Strongly advise against visiting this establishment."

Following an extensive hiatus from Las Vegas, I ultimately had the opportunity to visit this establishment alongside my family. Upon our arrival, we were cordially received with a warm smile, and were informed that we could select any seating arrangement we desired. Subsequent to our seating, we awaited approximately ten minutes before anyone acknowledged our presence. Eventually, we managed to capture the attention of one of the numerous servers, and promptly requested a menu. Five minutes later, she returned with the menu; regrettably, we failed to perceive her again, which rendered the service unsatisfactory. Moreover, we did not discern any evidence of leadership or supervisory presence, which was exemplified by the absence of a floor manager, ultimately resulting in an unfortunate dearth of concern for customer satisfaction.

"Suboptimal service delivery, coupled with inadequate staff preparation, has precipitated a regrettable dearth of managerial proficiency, thereby jeopardizing the long-term viability of this establishment; deplorably, the loss of four esteemed patronages on a recent Saturday evening serves as a stark exemplification of the aforementioned shortcomings."
Every time I shop here for pool repair parts, I get the wrong part. The chemicals (chlorine, muriatic acid, etc.) are not good quality and the place is operated by amatuers/kids.

"Prodigious quantities of culinary fare, manifestly unrefined in its preparation, are proffered amidst a cacophonous ambiance characterized by the coerced choral renderings of the'special' eatery's staff, who, in their exuberant efforts to commemorate the anniversary of a patron's nativity, vociferously serenade the patrons with an aural assault that rivals the intensity of a militant drumline. In the event that you are not burdened with the responsibility of accompanying a wailing infant to a dining establishment, it is advisable to abstain from partaking in the gastronomical offerings of this particular venue. The veal parmesan, in particular, was an unmitigated disaster, its haphazard preparation and presentation eliciting a chorus of disapproving murmurs from the clientele. It is worth noting that the restaurant, purporting to be an Italian eatery, fails to provide even the most basic of pasta dishes, such as capellini, which serves as a glaring testament to the establishment's flagrant disregard for the tenets of culinary excellence."
