"The gastronomical establishment in question is utterly deplorable. While the culinary offerings are passable, if unremarkable, the hospitality proffered by the waiting staff is abysmal. In the company of colleagues, I had the misfortune of experiencing egregious lapses in service, including the forgetting of our orders, the erroneous delivery of beverages, and the flagrant discrepancy between the items requested and those billed. Furthermore, upon bringing these issues to the attention of management, we were offered additional game cards, a paltry compensation for the inconvenience endured. Based on my experience, I would strongly advise against patronizing this eatery."

"It is my conviction that they merely applied lipstick to a porcine entity, as my excursion to the gaming arena for a duration of sixty minutes did not result in the offering of a beverage. Furthermore, I observed that the gaming area was of diminutive proportions, which seemed to suggest that they had not allocated sufficient financial resources towards the installation of elevators in the parking facility. Additionally, I must aver that the venue did not appear to be particularly accommodating towards individuals with physical disabilities, as the layout was characterized by narrow passageways and restricted maneuverability. However, I must commend the gentlemen stationed at the valet service for their exceptional courtesy."

"Prepare yourself to proffer three forms of identification and a credit card, as the personnel at this establishment appear to be oblivious to the concept of customer recognition. My companions and I endured an agonizing wait of nearly sixty minutes due to the persistent insistence of four bouncers that my friend's identification did not belong to her, despite her providing thorough explanations and displaying her credit card, which ironically featured an alternate image of herself. Following this unnecessary and unpleasant experience (which can be attributed solely to the uncooperative demeanor of the individual in question), we opted to visit an alternative nightclub, whereupon we were successfully admitted. Having frequented numerous clubs throughout Las Vegas, I must say that this particular incident was unprecedented. It is my sincere hope that the staff at this venue will rectify their deficiencies in customer service and comprehend the fact that patrons' appearances may not remain identical to their driver's license photos, particularly given the lapse of several years."

"Expressing utter disdain towards this establishment, I exclaimed, 'Eff this place!' It was, regrettably, our final option for a one-night stay during President's Day weekend, with every other hotel along the strip displaying 'no vacancies' despite questionable authenticity. Upon arrival, we were greeted by an overwhelming stench akin to that of a deceased individual, which permeated the entire property. Furthermore, we were informed that the only available rooms were two queens within the pyramid, despite our explicit request for a king. The condition of the accommodations was deplorable, appearing unkempt and unsanitary, with a glaring absence of proper housekeeping. To exacerbate matters, I was charged double the amount on my credit card, remaining oblivious to this fact until my return home. The experience was utterly egregious and warranted a phone call to the Luxor's accounting department. Following a heated conversation with an incompetent representative, I was assured that one of the erroneous charges would be refunded by the end of the day. Notwithstanding this fiasco, Tacos & Tequila proved to be a satisfactory dining venue. However, the staff presented an air of melancholy, perhaps attributed to the early hour (3:30 pm). In conclusion, I strongly advise against selecting the Luxor as a place of lodging, as it failed to meet expectations and left an indelible mark of disappointment."

New to area and saw a coupon in one of our mails. Decided to take my daughter to check it out we got there at 9:29 pm and it looked like they were closing,  the open sign was shut off and the screens were down. Even though yelp says they close at 10. Bad first impression will stick with Froyona.
Ate ate Popeye at many states, this is not it!\nThe spicy chicken is NOT spicy yet it contains more grease then chicken, purely inedible. no idea how they get away with it in a corporate environment.

"It is utterly deplorable that this establishment fails to deliver on its culinary promises, especially considering the acclaim it received on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. My expectations were elevated, anticipating an unparalleled barbecue experience, but alas, they were tragically unmet. En route to visit my grandfather in Tucson, I decided to make a brief detour to sample their offerings, expecting a gastronomic delight. Unfortunately, my visit fell on a rather unfortunate day, a Tuesday at 11 AM, which may have contributed to the subpar quality of the food. The server's response to my inquiry regarding the menu's highlights was rather unhelpful, amounting to a vague and uninformative "everything is good." Thus, I opted for the unconventional approach of ordering one of each item, which resulted in a colossal plate overflowing with an assortment of unidentifiable dishes. Disillusioned and disappointed, I consumed a solitary bite of each before deciding to seek sustenance elsewhere, specifically at Weinerschnitzel, where I hoped to find palatable fare."

"I am utterly dumbfounded by the plethora of effusively positive appraisals regarding Greenberg's, leading me to infer that the majority of patrons have perhaps not had the privilege of indulging in truly exceptional Jewish deli cuisine, thereby rendering their assessments somewhat misguided and disproportionate. It is imperative for individuals to comprehend the true nature of Greenberg's; it serves as a hastily prepared, simplified rendition of an authentic Jewish deli, possessing the superficial appearance and ambiance of the genuine article while falling short in terms of gastronomic excellence and spiritual essence. This phenomenon is by no means unusual within the confines of the Las Vegas Strip. Patrons who have had the pleasure of dining at esteemed establishments such as New York City's Katz's, Montreal's Lester's, Los Angeles' Canter's, or any other celebrated Jewish deli, are cognizant of the unparalleled flavors of authentic matzo ball soup and top-notch pastrami. In my opinion, Greenberg's fails to meet the standards of a genuinely superior Jewish deli, earning a paltry two stars at best; it perpetuates the guise of a speedily prepared, watered-down adaptation of traditional Jewish cuisine, leaving me utterly dismayed that individuals depart its premises under the false impression that they have partaken in a truly satisfying Jewish culinary experience. Oy vey!"

"Upon visiting Coco's on a Monday afternoon, it became apparent that the parking lot was rather uncharacteristically vacant, with only three vehicles occupying the space. Notwithstanding this anomaly, the seating process was expedited, and our order was taken in a timely manner. However, the delivery of our salads preceded the arrival of the primary entrÃ©e by a considerable margin, with the latter taking approximately thirty minutes to materialize. It is worth noting that the restaurant's patrons consisted of merely two or three tables, casting doubt upon the notion that an extensive delay was necessary to prepare a meager pair of cheeseburgers. Furthermore, my digestive system experienced discomfort for an ensuing hour, leading me to surmise that the culinary offerings perhaps did not align with my individual preferences. Although the service was generally satisfactory, several lapses in attention to detail transpired, including the failure to replenish the tea and remove completed dishes in a timely fashion. Specifically, the manager, despite his assurance of promptly returning to collect the remaining dishes, neglected to do so. Additionally, the waitress required prompting to partition the checks, which ultimately failed to occur. These oversights, coupled with the aforementioned delays and gastronomical dissatisfaction, suggest that Coco's may be following in the footsteps of Marie Callender's, another establishment that has recently encountered difficulties."

Update June 2013: My update unfortunately devalues the ice cream parlor further. I wanted to buy a scoop of ice cream for my little son today at the ox festival in Hagsfeld and asked for a paper cup (!!!) because the little one has a milk allergy and cannot eat a waffle. The lady told me that there is only one waffle per scoop and that I would have to pay 20 cents extra. Since the scoop already costs EUR 0.90, I was not willing to do this. Personally, I don't think it's a good business practice, especially since the prices per scoop are already quite high. Today, I rode past this nice ice cream parlor again. A nice ice cream seller sold me an ice cream with two scoops. Up until then, smooth 5 stars, nice, authentic, clean. However, the ice cream did not impress me. The lemon was still okay, but the raspberry ice cream had an unpleasant texture, similar to a slushy consistency. Nothing creamy, but rather a frozen and then thawed effect (which I don't want to accuse them of). Maybe they could have let the ice cream ripen a bit longer. The waffle was also not a hit, and therefore, I disposed of it. It reminded me of toilet paper. Bottom line: Nice store, but you can get better ice cream elsewhere.

"The quality of service was abysmal, to say the least. It appeared that patrons who were either regulars or shared the same racial background as the staff were receiving preferential treatment. Despite waiting for 15 minutes, which in itself was not particularly bothersome, I failed to receive even the most basic of amenities, such as water. Following a 10-minute wait, during which time no server came to take my order, I managed to flag down a busser and requested that he inform my server that I was prepared to place my order. However, an additional 20 minutes elapsed before my food was finally served, and even then, I was forced to wait yet another 24 minutes for my check to arrive. The entire experience was utterly unacceptable."

"ABHORRENTLY ATROCIOUS!!! The hospitable waitstaff exhibited remarkable promptness in attending to our order; however, an unacceptable duration of thirty minutes transpired before the culinary offerings arrived at our table. My gastronomical inclinations leaned towards the pineapple upside-down pancakes, which, regrettably, proved to be a gustatory disappointment. An unfortunate dearth of flavor and an unpleasantly tart pineapple component marred an otherwise respectable dish. Conversely, the country fried steak and gravy manifested a satisfying quality. Notwithstanding, the concatenation of an interminable wait and an unsatisfactory pancake experience precipitated my disenchantment with the establishment, thereby impelling me to seek alternative dining options."

"Once again, allow me to reiterate that I possess extensive experience within the culinary industry, thereby enabling me to proffer insightful critiques such as this one pertaining to Uncle Bears, a purported family-friendly sports bar that regrettably falls short of its potential due to a lack of coherent branding and an unfortunate dearth of gastronomical excellence. Perchance, the proprietors of this establishment sought to create a welcoming ambiance for both adults and children, but their efforts have resulted in a disconcertingly hollow atmosphere that fails to effectively blend the intended themes, ultimately leading to a confusing dining experience for patrons such as myself and my fellow diners, who collectively concurred that the menu offerings were not merely subpar, but indeed reprehensible, with flavors that did not even remotely approach the lofty price point that Uncle Bears has opted to charge, thereby rendering it a veritable affront to those of us who possess discerning tastes and expectations. In conclusion, while I understand that some may argue that this eatery possesses certain merits, I must emphasize that the prevailing consensus among seasoned gourmands such as myself is that Uncle Bears is, quite simply, an unmitigated disappointment."

Horrible! We waited in the lobby full of people for over 20 mins for a table. Normally I don't mind waiting but when I look and see servers shooting the breeze and half the restaurant empty well then it becomes an issue. Finally got a table, the food was horrible and then the bill came. What a rip-off!!! Stay clear of this place!

"It appears that certain individuals who operate vehicles for compensation have engaged in unethical behavior by recording gratuities on their own behalf, which is utterly unacceptable. Furthermore, it seems that management personnel have failed to display adequate levels of assistance or support in addressing this issue, thereby contributing to a culture of dishonesty and untrustworthiness. Consequently, it is advisable to seek alternative establishments for placing orders, rather than entrusting such tasks to these allegedly corrupt and deceitful individuals."

Individuals with a predilection for vintage or unique items may find Le Chariot appealing, as they can rummage through an assortment of seemingly disparate objects in search of hidden gems or exceptional deals. However, my personal experience at this establishment was markedly different. Upon entering, I was immediately struck by the eclectic array of items on display, including various militaria, antiques, and knick-knacks; nevertheless, upon closer inspection, I quickly realized that the vast majority of these items were, in fact, worthless trash that the proprietor, a surly and unfriendly individual, was attempting to pawn off at exorbitant prices. Despite my initial enthusiasm, I was ultimately disappointed and disenchanted with the shop's contents, which largely consisted of broken, damaged, or otherwise useless items. Furthermore, when I expressed interest in purchasing a particular street sign, I was met with resistance and was informed that it would cost me Â£30, a price I deemed excessive. Subsequently, I noticed that the same sign was prominently displayed in the shop's window, accompanied by several other seemingly valuable items, all of which were assigned an eye-watering price tag of Â£45. In light of my underwhelming experience, I would advise potential patrons to avoid visiting Le Chariot, as the vast majority of its inventory consists of worthless junk.

It has figuratively taken me an extensive duration of approximately two to three years to articulate my thoughts and emotions regarding this establishment, but I have come to the realization that it is imperative for me to express my sentiments as I prepare to celebrate my daughter's eighth birthday. I will unequivocally never recommend this venue to any acquaintance or friend. When I initially visited the premises to inquire about the available options for my daughter's birthday celebration, I was met with a dismissive and unhelpful demeanor from the staff member behind the counter. Despite feeling slightly deterred, I chose to disregard the ominous sign and proceed with booking the party. Unfortunately, the event proved to be a catastrophic disappointment, ranking as the most expensive and unpleasant birthday party experience I have ever had the misfortune of encountering. One of the hosts even caused a guest to become so distraught that they were compelled to leave prematurely. Furthermore, no refreshments were offered to the mothers in attendance, further contributing to the overall lackluster ambiance. Following the conclusion of the party and the departure of the guests, I approached the counter to request the proprietor's email address. However, the elderly woman present ignored my query and instead provided me with an email address that I was skeptical of, leading me to question its validity. At this point, I was overcome with emotion and a friend intervened on my behalf to communicate my dissatisfaction. In summary, my experience at this establishment was utterly unforgettable, and I would strongly advise against visiting it.

"It is rather conspicuous that no individual adorns gloves within these premises; I personally visited this establishment during the evening of November 21st, seeking a swift pizza acquisition. Upon querying the young woman stationed at the register regarding the fiscal responsibility associated with procuring a large cheese pizza, she responded by stating its cost to be $12.92. My subsequent inquiry pertaining to the price of two medium-sized cheese pizzas yielded a response of $12.95. Following my order placement and payment, I was informed by the aforementioned register attendant that the preparation time for my culinary items would be approximately 15-20 minutes. Subsequently, I returned to witness a queue comprising merely two individuals, a duration of time less than 15 minutes having elapsed. Unfortunately, I was compelled to endure an extended waiting period exceeding 10 minutes while fixating my gaze upon the pizzas awaiting retrieval on the shelf designated for me. During this interval, I had the opportunity to observe an employee clad in a green apron engaged in the process of positioning parchment within the box destined to house the pizza. Prior to placing the pizza atop the parchment, she applied manual pressure to the central region of the paper using her uncovered hand. Additionally, I noticed that two further employees situated within the kitchen area were not donning gloves, bringing the total number of gloveless workers to three. When my turn finally arrived at the front of the line, the young woman inquired as to how she might assist me, which I found somewhat vexing given the relatively modest volume of patrons present and the fact that she should have ideally recognized me. The pizza itself was merely average in quality, and none of us have thus far experienced any gastrointestinal discomfort."

"I contacted my insurance provider to arrange for the transportation of my Dodge Magnum RT to my preferred repair facility, and after enduring an hour-long delay, the tow truck operator arrived on the scene. Despite my explicit request for a flatbed tow truck, given the extent of the front side impact damage sustained by my vehicle, the driver appeared in a conventional tow truck. Following a telephone conversation with Tim, a representative of Walker Company, I was met with extreme discourtesy and unprofessionalism, as he refused to accommodate my request for a flatbed and instead suggested that I seek alternative towing services. In contrast, the tow truck driver exhibited a commendable level of courtesy and reasoned that if a customer expresses a preference for a flatbed, it is only appropriate to fulfill that request. Unfortunately, Tim's behavior fell short of expectations for someone working in customer service."

"I entered this establishment with the intention of availing myself of the ten dollar smog check and the economical oil change, but my experience was significantly marred by the fact that they resorted to duplicitous tactics by contacting me with an untruthful assertion regarding the necessity of a lower ball joint! My significant other, who possesses extensive knowledge pertaining to automotive maintenance, had previously alerted me to the possibility that this very same facility might attempt to fabricate issues with my vehicle, and unfortunately, his apprehensions were realized. Had I not been cognizant of their deceitful practices, I would have been subjected to an unwarranted expenditure of nearly four hundred dollars! It is worth mentioning that there was a male individual present within the premises who had fallen victim to their questionable business practices not once, but twice, and his indignation was palpable. The cashier, in an apparent attempt to mitigate the situation, claimed that a discount of three hundred dollars had been extended to him, which, in my opinion, was a wholly inadequate gesture considering the nature of the work that he purportedly required. Moreover, they endeavored to persuade me to purchase inflated tires at an exorbitant price point exceeding six hundred dollars! Their audacity is truly staggering, and I strongly advise potential patrons to exercise extreme caution in their dealings with this particular establishment."

"Upon entering the establishment, we were immediately struck by the youthful waitstaff's unbridled confidence, which bordered on arrogance. It was almost as if he was under the impression that Swagat was the epitome of culinary excellence, a notion that we found rather amusing considering our extensive experience with Indian cuisine. As a recent transplant from the San Francisco Bay Area, I have had the privilege of indulging in some of the most exquisite Indian dishes, and I must say that Swagat's offerings fell short of our expectations. While the flavors were passable, the portions were inadequate for the price point, leading us to question the value proposition of dining at such an establishment. Furthermore, the inclusion of South Indian delicacies alongside traditional North Indian fare raised several red flags regarding the quality of the food. In our opinion, a genuine Indian restaurant proprietor would never consider featuring idli, sambar, or dosa on a menu that includes Rogan Josh or biryani. It is simply unheard of. Upon perusing the menu, we quickly realized that the quantity of dishes available did not augur well for a satisfying dining experience. Needless to say, we do not plan on returning to Swagat unless there is a significant adjustment in their pricing strategy."

After conducting an extensive diagnostic process, I was unable to determine the root cause of my discomfort, which was attributed to an inadequate level of communication and a lack of thorough examination on the part of my healthcare provider, resulting in a subpar patient experience characterized by feelings of being rushed and neglected, ultimately leading to a futile attempt to establish a definitive diagnosis despite numerous consultations.

"The subpar service I have consistently received at this particular Starbucks location has reached unprecedented heights, rendering it the most unsatisfactory experience I have had the displeasure of enduring. Despite its proximity to my place of employment, which renders it a convenient stopover, I have come to rue the day I ever decided to patronize this establishment. The sluggishness of the staff, even when faced with a dearth of patrons in the drive-thru, is utterly inexcusable and has led to an interminable wait time. Furthermore, the quality of the coffee, once the epitome of my daily caffeine fix, has sadly failed to meet my expectations, leaving a bitter taste in my mouth that even the most ardent coffee connoisseur would find challenging to palate."

"My propensity for reserving one-star reviews solely for particularly unpleasant encounters is well-established, and this particular experience undoubtedly fell within that categorical purview. To summarize the events succinctly, it transpired that an hour elapsed prior to the arrival of sustenance upon our table. I felt compelled to solicit attention from a server to place our order and, subsequently, inquire about the status of our meals. The simplicity of the fare we requestedâeggs, a staple of breakfast cuisineârendered the delay all the more perplexing. My cousin and I entered the establishment at approximately 10:00 AM on a weekday, and numerous vacant tables were visible throughout the premises. Our prolonged standing at the entrance, unacknowledged by multiple staff members, prompted me to remark, 'This is an ominous indication; perhaps we should consider an alternative dining venue.' Indeed, such a decision would have been advisable, as the ensuing events demonstrated. Following our eventual seating, I was obliged to request the presence of a server. Unfortunately, said individual failed to return until after I had inquired about the whereabouts of our meals. In situations of this nature, it is often the processes rather than the individuals involved that are flawed. However, in this instance, the service was subpar, irrespective of the personnel involved. Notwithstanding the aforementioned deficiencies, the culinary offerings did possess a certain degree of quality, although it fell short of excellence. Nevertheless, by that juncture, such considerations held little relevance."

"The sole beneficial aspect of this facility is its extended hours of operation on Saturdays, which accommodates the schedules of busy individuals, as well as the presence of an exceptionally skilled and courteous dental assistant. However, beyond these limited advantages, I would strongly advise against selecting this particular dental practice. My spouse and I recently visited this establishment for routine dental evaluations, cleanings, and radiographic imaging, but we were taken aback by the limited scope of the examinations performed and the subsequent presentation of a comprehensive catalog of dental issues and associated costs. Furthermore, our interactions with the reception staff proved challenging due to difficulties in communication and understanding, particularly when seeking clarification on various aspects of our visit."

"Grossly overpriced, culinary travesty, devoid of crucial accompaniments such as coleslaw and corn bread, and serving as a repository for unpalatable poultry products, the eight-piece meal in question not only exuded an offensive odor, but also featured a visibly desiccated thigh, with an excess of superfluous fat rendering the skin gelatinous and translucent, indicative of an insufficiently heated fryer, thereby necessitating its summary rejection and disposal by my discerning spouse, ultimately leading to a profound sense of gastronomical disappointment and disillusionment."

"Negative, negative, negative, negative, no aqua except via container situated on each nine. Observed female transporting beverages for brief period of time during four hour interval. Verdant surfaces subpar in quality, uneven terrain, lacking adequate upkeep. I would not participate in recreational activity on this course again."

"It is utterly preposterous that any rational individual would opt to procure sustenance from this establishment, as my recent experience unequivocally demonstrated. Upon placing an order for two ostensibly renowned cheese steaks, I was flabbergasted when both items were not initiated until a full quarter of an hour had elapsed subsequent to my request. Furthermore, it became apparent that each sandwich was prepared singularly, which contributed to an unacceptable delay. The culinary offerings themselves were woefully lacking in flavor, with an utter absence of sodium chloride and mushrooms that were patently derived from a frozen state and not properly cooked. Additionally, the quantity of meat provided was meager at best. It is worth noting that this eatery has made spurious claims of being featured on the Food Network, when in reality, it underwent a transformation from a catfish-centric menu mere months prior. In conclusion, Gino's in Philadelphia has no reason to feel threatened by this establishment's presence."

"The personnel employed by US Airways at McCarran International Airport demonstrated a flagrant disregard for customer satisfaction, precipitating an irrevocable decline in my erstwhile favorable disposition towards their services; henceforth, I shall refrain from utilizing their flights originating from or terminating at this particular aerodrome, as my expectations regarding the quality of their customer service have been irreparably compromised."

Upon returning to the establishment in question, I endeavored to procure a rectification of the unfortunate state of my nails, which had been previously maligned by an incompetent staff member. Alas, my efforts were met with further disappointment, as the individual tasked with addressing the issue, a certain Jennifer, appeared noticeably vexed by my presence, as if I were somehow culpable for the subpar service I had received. During the procedure, I was compelled to withdraw my nail multiple times, owing to the ferocity with which Jennifer employed the filing apparatus. Moreover, she failed to solicit my input regarding the desired shape and proceeded to file my nails in a manner that diverged from my preferences. Furthermore, she neglected to inquire about my preference for tip application, opting instead to paint the entire nail without consultation. Throughout the process, Jennifer exhibited brusque behavior, manhandling my hands and tapping them impatiently, rather than engaging in civil discourse. Following the completion of the gel topping, I was situated in a chair designed to facilitate drying, but which also subjected me to an uncomfortable and awkward posture. Not only did I fail to receive an apology for the shoddy workmanship, but Jennifer even resorted to gesticulating and speaking in a foreign tongue, ostensibly disparaging me. Given that I frequent such establishments every two weeks, I shall henceforth direct my business elsewhere, as this particular salon has demonstrated itself to be deplorable in terms of both service and maintenance.

"If you are seeking a gymnasium that prioritizes its reputation over the well-being and emotional safety of your children, then perhaps consider enrolling them in this establishment. However, be aware that the coaching staff's relentless pursuit of excellence may come at the expense of your child's self-confidence and mental health. As a parent, I have personally witnessed the detrimental impact that this gym's intense training regimen has had on my own children. Following a six-month struggle to restore my daughter's self-esteem, which was severely affected by her involvement with the gym's team, I can confidently attest that the short-term benefits of this gym's state-of-the-art facilities and elite coaching do not justify the long-term costs to your child's emotional well-being. Instead, I recommend exploring alternative gymnastics programs in the area that prioritize the development of young athletes in a supportive and nurturing environment."

"The antecedent remarks are utterly pertinent. The absence of parking facilities, coupled with the ineptitude of management, has created an environment conducive to unsavory activities, such as drug peddling and rowdy behavior, perpetrated by questionable individuals, including Alex, who insists on utilizing the hot tubs for his personal indulgence. The management, spearheaded by Hannah and another blonde manager, whose name escapes me at present, has displayed a callous and dismissive attitude towards the concerns voiced by tenants, exemplified by their reluctance to address the putrid stench emanating from the deceased golf course adjacent to the building, which permeates the atmosphere and necessitates the presence of a golf club near one's bed for a peaceful slumber. My anticipation for an expeditious departure from this unpleasant abode knows no bounds."

I will never return to this establishment again, as my expectations were not met in terms of value for money. Despite the culinary offerings being of satisfactory quality, the prices charged for them are excessive and do not align with my personal budgetary constraints. Additionally, the practice of charging patrons for replenishing their beverages and takeout containers seems exploitative and incongruous with the supposedly high-end ambiance purported by the venue. Furthermore, the state of disrepair evident in the broken blinds and grimy ceiling fans only serves to further undermine my confidence in the proprietors' commitment to maintaining a clean and welcoming environment. The presumptuousness of posting a sign prohibiting plate picking merely serves to exacerbate my indignation and reinforces my decision to seek alternative dining options in the future.

We embarked upon a leisurely escapade that was unfortunately marred by a nocturnal establishment characterized by an atmosphere of terror and intimidation. My significant other consumed copious amounts of alcoholic beverages, rendering her vulnerable to the nefarious intentions of a malevolent individual employed by the nightclub. While I was occupied with personal hygiene, this brute forcefully removed my girlfriend from my presence and transported her against her will to a secluded location within the premises. He engaged in unwanted physical contact and issued threats of expulsion from the club unless she acquiesced to his lascivious demands. My girlfriend, understandably traumatized, refused his advances and was subsequently ejected from the establishment. Fortunately, she possessed a means of communication and alerted me to the situation, whereupon I expedited her return home, as her level of intoxication rendered her incapable of filing a formal complaint. Following my attempts to contact the nightclub's management, they remained impervious to my entreaties, necessitating the involvement of law enforcement. Although my girlfriend escaped harm, the potential danger posed by this venue warrants caution and vigilance among patrons, particularly those who may find themselves inebriated and vulnerable. It is advisable to avoid this establishment altogether and seek alternative locations for socializing and recreation.

"The pecuniary expenditures associated with conducting commercial activities at a specific venue\nIt has come to my attention that during a designated time frame, specifically between two and four post meridiem, certain establishments impose restrictions on the utilization of their lavatorial facilities by secondary school students, despite the fact that these individuals may be legitimate patrons who have tendered payment for services rendered. The rationale proffered by said establishments, which includes concerns regarding vandalism, sexual activity, and illicit substances, strikes me as somewhat specious. Furthermore, the assertion that the costs associated with providing such amenities are prohibitive is equally dubious. As an entrepreneur who operates a Dairy Queen franchise, I am acutely aware of the financial obligations that accompany such an enterprise; however, I must insist that the provision of adequate facilities for customer use is an intrinsic aspect of the overall experience, and thus, an unavoidable cost of doing business."

"This establishment constitutes an unmitigated disaster, with customer service that is conspicuously absent, lethargic, and discourteous. The quality of their gel products is also questionable, as they appear to be of inferior quality. My recent visit involved a gel fill-in with a technician named Nina, whose work was subpar at best; the polish application was haphazard, resulting in an unsightly, clumpy finish. When brought to her attention, Nina was dismissive and unhelpful. Upon returning home, the gel began to peel off, prompting my return the following day. Despite my efforts to rectify the issue, the staff refused to provide a refund. As a seasoned patron of numerous nail salons, I can unequivocally declare that this particular establishment has earned the dubious distinction of being the worst I have had the misfortune of encountering in the past decade. Avoid squandering your time and resources on such an inadequate enterprise."

The food was so so I would say...they do go heavy on the spices though...they took forever to being my food out...the taziki was really sour an the falafels were dry...only thing I really liked on the plate was the rice...the kids plate came with barely any fries an 2 pieces of chicken strips...not sure if this is a return place for me...

Came here with my family once and both my mom and I got food poisoning from eating here.  Not only that but I got it after eating a lasagna at a supposedly \"nice\" Italian restaurant in the hotel that we had to wait an hour to get into.  Thanks for the worse Vegas trip ever, at least the day I got sick and starting yacking everywhere was the day we left =/

The novel gastronomical establishment, New Carly's, has elected to revamp its bill of fare, unfortunately omitting the esteemed tuna entrÃ©e, much to the dismay of this writer, who had developed a predilection for the delectable dish and now feels compelled to express profound disappointment and disillusionment with the abrupt and unfortunate transformation, which has resulted in a diminution of the culinary alternatives available to patrons, principally restricting them to choices of poultry and bovine origin, thereby eliciting a chorus of disapproval and discontent from those who had previously reveled in the diverse and tantalizing offerings of the eatery, rendering the once-anticipated dining experience now utterly unappealing and uninviting.

Update: subsequent to my attempt to accommodate Bill and my discovery that his address was a fabrication, I became cognizant of his exceptional proficiency in deception. Consequently, I contacted him from an alternative telephone number and arranged for another repair, during which he continued to indulge in extensive narratives and lies, including the assertion that he could offer me a discount if I possessed liquid assets. Furthermore, he implied that concealing cash from his spouse was necessary, stating, âthe wife doesnât know about cash, ya know,â?before promptly rectifying his statement to avoid any suggestion of impropriety regarding his marital relationship. Ultimately, I successfully executed my plan to serve him for my day in court by scheduling a fictitious appointment, and I recommend that others who have been impacted by his actions do the same to bring about his downfall or, at the very least, arrange their own bogus appointments.

"Today, we encountered abysmal service across the board. Following a prolonged wait of over four minutes at the host stand, wherein we were forced to observe another party seating themselves before us, we were finally accommodated. However, our beverages took several minutes to arrive, further exacerbating our frustration. Our meal consisted of a breakfast burrito and spring rolls, both of which were prepared incorrectly. Specifically, the breakfast burrito contained sausage instead of bacon, as specified in our order, while the spring rolls were severely overcooked. Additionally, the hash browns accompanying our dishes were burnt beyond recognition. Upon bringing these issues to the attention of our server, she displayed a nonchalant attitude, evidenced by a casual shrug of her shoulders, implying a lack of concern or resolve to address the problems. Despite her eventual return of the food to the kitchen and an apparent explanation to the cook, we were dismayed to hear the cook dismissively remark that the food was not burnt and that our complaints were unfounded. Ultimately, the food was reprepared, albeit without achieving the quality we had grown accustomed to prior to the establishment's renovation. Consequently, our once-favorable opinion of this eatery has been irreparably damaged, and we will not be returning."

Went to El Zocalo tonight to enjoy some good food and also enjoy the ambiance with my wife. I have been to this establishment before and never remembered if the food was good or not. I ordered the Tierra y Mar plate which is steak and shrimp on the grill with a side of rice and beans. I asked for my steak to be done medium, when we received our orders seemed to be 35 minutes later my steak was well done and had not an ounce of flavor to it. The shrimp was so salty I could only eat but one. When the waiter finally came back to see how it was going I told him that I was not happy with the plate. He asked if I wanted something else and I refused. I had tried my wife's plate (chicken Enchiladas) and it was mediocre so I wasn't going to waste my time. At the end of the night the waiter apologized and said that the manager discounted my plate 50%. Why the manager didn't come out to see what I thought was wrong is beyond me. Honestly the only reason I will go back is for the music and the beer, my food experience was sub-par. For the price save yourself some money and go to Rosita's in Mesa or El Rico's in Gilbert. \nTerrible food experience.

"The absence of a pragmatic approach in FANDANGO's online ticket reservation services for this particular cinema is truly disconcerting. My attempt to procure a ticket for the succeeding day, under the presumption that it was display times for the current day, resulted in an unanticipated predicament. Despite being listed alongside showtimes, the purchase was accompanied by a stipulation that prohibited any refunds. I was unable to modify the showtime, leaving me with no alternative but to acquire an additional ticket for the correct date, as suggested by customer support. The possibility of obtaining a refund within 3-5 business days subsequent to the screening seemed uncertain, rendering the entire process unreliable. Moreover, the likelihood of receiving a denial from the refund department was too great a risk to undertake. Consequently, I opted to sell the tickets to a colleague instead, which proved to be a more judicious decision. I have included the chat transcript with the representative for your perusal. It is truly lamentable that such an unsatisfactory experience has besmirched my association with this theater, as I have never encountered a cinema that refused refunds or prevented changes to showtimes."

"The most unfortunate occurrence transpired during my recent visit to this medical facility, which appears to be a recurring theme based on my observations. The waiting period of two hours was particularly arduous, as it culminated in the revelation that the physician was unable to accommodate my appointment due to an apparent oversight regarding copays. Furthermore, the doctor seemed intent on modifying the nature of my appointment, which would have necessitated an additional fee, despite my initial reservations. My reluctance to acquiesce to this proposal was met with a refusal to provide medical attention, leading me to question the genuineness of the doctor's concern for her patients' wellbeing. The entire encounter was utterly distressing and left much to be desired in terms of patient care. I shall not be returning and will make a point to divulge the details of this unsatisfactory episode to anyone who will listen."

"A similar scenario transpired in close proximity to our domicile today, involving the identical driver who was exploiting a designated handicap parking space as a temporary unloading area. Following a chance encounter with a nearby law enforcement officer, the individual in question engaged in a heated debate with the authority figure, prior to eventually relocating his vehicle. However, as we departed the premises, he directed offensive gestures in my direction, exemplifying his blatant disregard for the well-being and rights of individuals with disabilities. Consequently, we have lodged a formal grievance and communicated our unequivocal preference to UPS that this particular driver refrain from visiting our residence in the future. The outcome remains to be seen."

This establishment has undergone a significant decline in quality since my last visit, as evidenced by the prolonged waiting period I have been subjected to. Upon entering, I was informed that there would be a brief delay of ten minutes; however, I have now been waiting for over twenty-five minutes to be seated, while parties that arrived subsequent to mine have been accommodated immediately. The staff members at the front desk attributed this discrepancy to an inadequate number of servers, despite having three individuals present at the front of the restaurant. I am thoroughly disenchanted with the level of service provided by this establishment.

This experience proved to be an immense disappointment, evoking a profound sense of disillusionment and frustration, as the restaurant's state of disarray and neglect became apparent, prompting concerns regarding the cleanliness of the kitchen and food preparation areas, thus rendering it unsuitable for future visits.

The gastronomical experience at this establishment was utterly disappointing, as the victuals lacked any semblance of flavor or zest, leading me to regret my decision to dine there the instant I took a bite; needless to say, I shall adhere to my preference for the more affordable and delectable Mexican cuisine offered by the rival eatery in close proximity.

This particular edifice shall never receive another pecuniary contribution from yours truly. My spouse and I, accompanied by a pair of additional acquaintances, entered the premises of Mamma Mia last night, only to be met with an abrupt and peremptory dismissal. Despite the illumination of the interior and the open portal, we were summarily informed to vacate the premises. Our attempts at elucidation and a rational explanation of our status as habitual patrons proved futile, as the proprietor belligerently reiterated his disdain for our presence and his lack of interest in our custom. There are numerous alternative establishments in the vicinity that serve comparable culinary offerings; thus, the proprietor's expressed desire for our absence shall be fulfilled, and I urge others to follow suit. While the proprietor does possess the prerogative to cease operations and deny service to individuals, such behavior is inexcusable when the edifice's entrance is accessible and inviting to potential clientele.

"If you have had the pleasure of indulging in authentic, delectable Mexican cuisine at any point in your life, you would undoubtedly recognize that this establishment falls short of meeting the standards of a genuine Mexican dining experience. It is utterly perplexing how it has managed to attain such an elevated rating on Yelp, leading one to ponder whether the criteria employed by reviewers are vastly different from those of discerning gastronomes. 

The cost of a solitary burrito, two tacos, and a beverage amounts to a staggering $19.73, which, in and of itself, is sufficient grounds for dismissal. However, the true travesty lies not in the price, but in the unfortunate reality that the fare served bears no resemblance to the rich, vibrant flavors that define genuine Mexican cuisine. The taste, or lack thereof, is akin to a culinary abyss, devoid of even a hint of the bold, spicy, and savory sensations that aficionados of Mexican food have come to expect. 

As an individual hailing from Los Angeles, where the Mexican food scene is renowned for its excellence, I must confess that my expectations were admittedly higher. The experience proved to be a disappointment, with the meat being unpleasantly cold and lacking the depth of flavor that distinguishes exceptional Mexican cooking. The lone redeeming quality of the meal was the watermelon drink, which, while refreshing, could not compensate for the deficiencies in the food. 

In conclusion, this restaurant fails to deliver an experience worthy of the name 'Mexican food.' Those familiar with the richness and complexity of authentic Mexican cuisine will find themselves gravely disappointed. In fact, it is a grave injustice to compare this establishment to even the most basic taco trucks found in cities such as San Diego or Los Angeles, which offer a vastly superior dining experience."

My shopping excursion was satisfactory, albeit slightly tarnished by the fact that the footwear I acquired possessed a small opening in its surface. Despite this minor flaw, I opted to execute an exchange rather than a return, primarily because the store's policy appeared to be somewhat restrictive regarding the latter. Upon approaching the manager to address my concern, I was met with an unexpected display of discourtesy and a lack of enthusiasm to accommodate my request. Moreover, she had the audacity to accuse me of donning the aforementioned footwear within the confines of my domicile, which I must admit I had indeed done, albeit only for a brief period and strictly for the purpose of assessing its quality. Following this interaction, I made a subsequent attempt to exchange the footwear the next day, but unfortunately, the outcome was unfavorable. Suffice it to say, I shall not be patronizing this establishment again in the future, as their customer service left much to be desired.

I have been eagerly anticipating the opportunity to sample the culinary offerings of this establishment for an extended period of time. The exterior facade of the building seemed to suggest that the interior would be aesthetically pleasing, however upon entering the premises, my visual senses were immediately assailed by an overpowering azure hue permeating every aspect of the decor. The walls, floors, furniture, and even the illumination fixtures were all an intense shade of blue, creating a jarring and uninviting ambiance that instantly put me off. Considering that the overall atmosphere plays a significant role in the dining experience, it was evident that this particular venue fell short in that regard. Furthermore, the cost of our meal was $72 for five individuals, which would have been acceptable had the cuisine been exceptional; regrettably, every dish we ordered was cooked beyond the requested doneness, rendering the entire experience disappointing and not worth the expense.

"Mellow Mushroom, an ostensibly 'hip' pizzeria chain, has unfortunately succumbed to the pernicious plague of racism that insidiously permeates the fabric of our society, rendering its ambiance utterly unpalatable for any individual who values the principles of equality and respect. Compelled by a sense of civic duty to share my recent experience at this establishment, I must confess that I have never felt compelled to compose a review prior to this occasion, such was the egregious nature of the bigotry I witnessed. To describe my distaste for this restaurant as merely 'terrible' would be an egregious understatement, for it is in point of fact a grotesque affront to the very notion of inclusivity and diversity. Were it possible, I would assign a rating of negative one hundred stars, for even the most cursory examination of their policies and practices reveals a reprehensible lack of concern for the well-being of marginalized communities. In conclusion, I implore potential patrons to exercise their moral agency and avoid this establishment at all costs, lest they wish to inadvertently support the normalization of hate speech and discrimination."

"Abysmal, Abysmal, Abysmal!!!!

The customer service was APPALLING, on a scale of 1-5, the culinary offerings were a paltry 1, while the potables were merely adequate, the ambiance, however, was somewhat pleasant, though INSUFFICIENT to dissuade me from future visits, as I have enjoyed superior fish tacos at establishments such as Rubio's and Baja Fresh, at a FRACTION of the cost, and did not feel compelled to seek sustenance elsewhere after departing, which we were forced to do following our departure from Tortilla Factory!

Scottsdale boasts an abundance of exceptional eateries, offering DELECTABLE cuisine, EXEMPLARY service, REFRESHING drinks, and an overall AGREEABLE atmosphere.

Our attempts to engage the manager in conversation proved futile, as he became IRATE and sought to make us feel fortunate to be present and oblivious to the shortcomings of the establishment. 

Thus, if you desire SUBPAR service, EXORBITANT prices, and a TASTELESS dining experience, then Tortilla Factory is the optimal destination for you."

"The most unfortunate and unsatisfactory encounter with a service provider that I have had the displeasure of experiencing. Numerous commitments were made but left unfulfilled, culminating in the non-adherence to the ultimate timeline. Throughout the process, no approximations were furnished concerning the scope of work, leaving me in a state of utter uncertainty regarding my financial obligations. Upon requesting clarification, I was met with an absence of useful guidance, save for the recommendation to visit an establishment and personally select comparable items. In the event that I failed to recall or was unfamiliar with specific brands, no direction was offered, thereby exacerbating my plight. Irrespective of whether I adhered to the dictates of insurance coverage, I was consistently informed that my expenditures surpassed the allocated budget, necessitating additional out-of-pocket costs. I strongly advise against feeling compelled to engage the services of this company; instead, take the time to deliberately assess your options and explore alternative solutions."

On August 5th at precisely 2:30 p.m., I personally witnessed a flagrant violation of traffic regulations occur, specifically, an illegal U-turn executed by the driver of a yellow school bus, which recklessly traversed a double-lined road and four lanes of dense vehicular traffic, narrowly avoiding a potentially catastrophic collision with two large trucks traveling in opposite directions within close proximity, while an eighteen-wheeler truck in the adjacent lane applied its brakes rigorously to prevent a calamitous impact with the bus, which miraculously halted mere inches from the massive grille of the semi-trailer truck, and as I drew parallel to the bus, I was utterly appalled to observe that it was transporting a group of children, whose safety was blatantly disregarded by the driver, who appeared to be a Hispanic woman of somewhat above-average stature and sporting eyewear, thus posing an imminent threat to the well-being of innocent lives; accordingly, I promptly recorded the bus's license plate number and uploaded a photographic evidence of the incident onto a popular review platform, Yelp, for the purpose of bringing attention to the grave issue and ensuring accountability, as the bus in question belonged to the Laveen School.

"Deplorable experience! I had the pleasure of visiting this establishment in 2010, when it first opened its doors to the public, and I must say that the culinary offerings and the demeanor of the staff were truly exceptional! Fast forward to my recent visit, and I was utterly dismayed by the stark contrast in the quality of service. The staff, with the exception of one individual, exhibited an unfortunate lack of enthusiasm and warmth, which made me feel like a burden rather than a valued patron. My server, in particular, seemed perturbed whenever I requested a replenishment of my beverage or placed an additional order, evoking the sentiment that I was interrupting her from a task of paramount importance. It is unfortunate that this eatery, which once showed great promise, has succumbed to such a precipitous decline in standards. The cuisine, although still palatable, cannot compensate for the deficiency in hospitable treatment. There are numerous alternative sushi restaurants in the eastern region of the valley that offer comparable gastronomical delights, accompanied by a vastly superior level of customer service. This establishment's descent into mediocrity is indeed a lamentable occurrence."

It is not advisable to embark upon an impromptu excursion to Las Vegas with one's offspring if one is a parsimonious individual. I have had the pleasure of visiting Las Vegas on multiple occasions prior to this instance, but never accompanied by my children and never lodged at Circus Circus. This particular hotel was the sole establishment that offered accommodations on a Saturday evening, situated on the renowned Strip, which appeared suitable for families and was within a budget of $250.00. Upon arriving at the reception area, I was assured by the staff member that all of the rooms were well-appointed, and I inadvertently overheard another guest remarking that some of the rooms had indeed undergone renovations. Evidently, mine was not among those that had received such enhancements. My lodging at the Sky Tower, which cost approximately $130.00, featured a room that exuded an atmosphere akin to that of the late 1980s and early 1990s. The bed linens were riddled with holes, the aesthetic of the space was uninspiring, and the ambiance en route to the room conveyed an impression of antiquity and neglect. In hindsight, it would have been more judicious to avoid this hotel and instead opt for a different establishment, as my children expressed disappointment with the Adventuredome and professed a preference for theme parks such as Six Flags or Knott's Berry Farm.

I should give 0 star to this location!!! Kidding me? Calling for half an hour while driving around, and then being told to park my car first, and walk in to rent the car?!  On the phone with a guy all the way looking for a tiny little cardboard written the name in the end.. What the hell!!! No sign outside, no instructions, WTF!!\n\nStay away from this, if you don't want to waste your time, and ruin your vacation!!

"Assuming an air of acquiescence, I proffered my assent to the implementation of a dress code at a reputable venue, cognizant of the fact that such a policy would serve to maintain an atmosphere of decorum and refinement within the premises. However, my compliance was contingent upon the understanding that the criteria for admission would be applied equitably and without prejudice. Alas, our group was denied entry due to the perceived deficiency of a specific component of our attire, specifically, the absence of a 'collar shirt.' My attempts to enlighten the gatekeeper regarding the existence of a Mandarin-style collar, which, albeit unconventional, still fulfilled the definition of a collar, fell upon ears deafened by ignorance. It appears that the enforcers of this dress code are oblivious to the nuances of sartorial elegance and instead choose to focus on superficial aspects of attire, thereby perpetuating an environment of exclusivity and discrimination. This incident marks the second occasion on which I have endeavored to introduce out-of-town visitors to the establishment's uppermost level, only to be thwarted by the capricious whims of the door staff. Suffice it to say, my experiences have engendered a reluctance to return to Orange Sky, lest I risk encountering further impediments to my ingress."

We organized my daughter's twenty-first birthday celebration at this establishment, opting for their VIP amenities. Our group consisted of twenty individuals. Unfortunately, the doormen refused entry to my daughter, despite the fact that we were all awaiting her arrival upstairs. Notably, this occurred on Halloween, and my daughter's costume, a seemingly innocuous teddy bear, was the source of contention. It appears that this club harbors a penchant for pilferage, as my companion's front pocket was relieved of its contents. A cohort of questionable characters, allegedly affiliated with the management, operates within the confines of this venue, facilitating such thievery. The exorbitant price of $2000.00 for four bottles only exacerbates the issue. Moreover, beverages, including water, incur additional charges when purchased with table service. The layout of the club poses a significant risk to patrons, as a single staircase serves as the sole means of egress, requiring a perilous descent of three flights of stairs amidst a crowd of five thousand individuals. Disturbingly, the management appears cognizant of the prevalence of pickpocketing yet continues to admit such unsavory elements. We were assured that our missing wallet would resurface during the morning cleanup, but alas, this proved untrue. Furthermore, I encountered another victim at the airport who had fallen prey to identity theft and credit card fraud, further underscoring the hazards associated with this establishment. In conclusion, TAO irrevocably marred our vacation experience.

"An utter disappointment and complete waste of time, our dining experience at this establishment was subpar and left much to be desired. We did not have high expectations, merely seeking passable and flavorful Chinese cuisine. However, what we received was anything but satisfactory. 

We started with the Sarawak salad, which was unimpressive, to say the least. Overcooked duck pieces were haphazardly placed atop a bed of mixed greens, lacking any semblance of finesse or attention to detail. This was followed by the Ah Sin special fried rice, which was unremarkable and lacking in depth of flavor, further reinforcing our disappointment. 

Upon ordering the Mongolian beef, our server informed us that it would possess a notable level of spiciness. However, upon its arrival, it became apparent that this was not the case. Rather than being bold and fiery, the dish was bland and uninspired, seemingly drenched in an unappealing sauce and carelessly positioned atop a bed of instant noodles. 

In conclusion, it appears that this restaurant caters to those with the most basic and unrefined taste buds, shying away from any genuine attempt at authentic Szechuan or Cantonese cuisine in favor of uninspired and unappetizing offerings."

We visited this establishment during the lunch hour last weekend, which, regrettably, proved to be both our initial and final experience. Initially, we inquired at the front desk whether they offered beef ribs, to which the staff member responded affirmatively. However, we subsequently discovered that no such ribs were available. Furthermore, we were misled by the employee's statement, as he failed to specify that ribs were only served during dinner and not during lunchtime. This led us to question the veracity of the information provided by the restaurant. Upon receiving the bill, we were taken aback by the charges, which included a price of $12.99 per person, despite the fact that the menu clearly stated the price as $11.99. Additionally, a mandatory gratuity of 15% was added for a party of five individuals, without any prior notification or disclosure of such a policy on the menu. In conclusion, our experience at this restaurant was replete with deceit and a blatant lack of regard for customer satisfaction. Consequently, we strongly advise against patronizing this establishment.

"Abysmal clientele assistance. To put it mildly. I approach the counter, and the individual responsible for attending to patrons deliberately disregards my presence, despite my proximity to his location. Following the culmination of his interaction with the preceding patron, he callously diverts his attention away from me and retreats. Literally. From. A. Client. As if I were afflicted with an infectious disease or some other form of social stigma. Preposterous. In light of this appalling treatment, I shall seek alternative establishments for my grooming needs."
Just missed them. They are closed   , I wanted to try the shakes I'll go elsewhere.\nI Stopped by a second time still was not that inpressed but that's just my taste buds maybe you may enjoy it.

Last night, we opted to procure our evening repast from this establishment, and regrettably, the culinary experience was utterly deplorable. It became apparent that certain unforeseen circumstances must have transpired, as the eatery only had a meager contingent of three employees endeavoring to manage the workflow, which resulted in a state of utter disarray and chaos. Prior to our departure, it would have been judicious to inspect the comestibles, for upon consuming them, it became glaringly evident that the quantity of meat incorporated into the fajitas was woefully inadequate, and the peppers were conspicuously absent, save for a few sorry-looking specimens that resembled stewed tomatoes. Furthermore, the rice, a fundamental component of the dish, was nowhere to be found, and the tortilla, though generously proportioned, resembled a pizza crust rather than its traditional, delicate counterpart. Our attempts to address these issues via telephone were met with a dearth of comprehension, as the individual who responded to our call struggled to communicate effectively in English, and no manager was available to intervene and rectify the situation. When we requested an electronic means of correspondence to convey our concerns, the response was less than helpful, with the offer of an immediate return visit being the sole solution proffered, an arrangement that, given my fiancÃ©'s ravenous state, was wholly impractical, as his hunger and irritability rendered him somewhat formidable.

Horrible customer service. I tried to place an order, giving them a chance after their last fuck up, but I find out they don't even deliver between 1400-1600. When I called to place an order the man on the phone was very rude and condescending while informing me of this, will never order from this place again! STAY AWAY!

In three decades of entrusting garments to laundry services, I have never encountered such an egregious discrepancy in pricing for items of comparable dimensions. Upon relocating to this vicinity and opting to utilize the services of this particular establishment for the first time, I was misled by a promotional flyer advertising a rate of $1.89 per item. When I retrieved my laundered garments (totaling thirty-three pieces), I was met with an unexpected and unjustified surcharge of $2.30 per unit, purportedly due to the alleged "extra large" proportions of the garments. My protestations regarding the absence of any notification regarding supplementary charges for larger sizes fell upon dismissive ears, as the proprietor displayed a flagrant lack of concern for customer satisfaction and instead elected to adopt an abrupt and discourteous demeanor. Following my departure with the garments, I returned to the premises seeking the owner's identity, with the intention of lodging a formal complaint against the enterprise. The proprietor, who identified himself as the owner, presented me with his business card and retreated without further discussion. This encounter exemplifies a pattern of unethical conduct and a blatant disregard for honesty, transparency, and respect for patrons that has been repeated in numerous reviews of this establishment. It is my conviction that potential customers should exercise caution and seek alternative options for their laundry needs, as this business has demonstrated a propensity for deception and a lack of cooperation. Furthermore, it is my belief that an investigation by the office of the attorney general would be warranted to address the questionable nature of their business practices.

I have been deliberating about my "cheat meal" for an entire week, and my craving for a delectable donut from Pink Box has been growing increasingly fervent. Unfortunately, my high expectations were not met, as I encountered a multitude of shortcomings during my visit. Firstly, the store's interior design and ambiance were uninviting and lackluster, giving me the impression that I had entered a cramped, 10x10 closet. Furthermore, the staff member who assisted me was inept and provided minimal assistance. Most disheartening, however, was the underwhelming selection of specialty donuts available. The assortment was paltry and failed to meet my expectations. Considering the exorbitant prices charged by Pink Box, I refused to settle for a bland, run-of-the-mill glazed donut that I could easily obtain elsewhere. My previous experience with the Fat Elvis donut had been exceptional, sadly, it was unavailable at this particular location, alongside the other specialty donuts I had hoped to sample. Ultimately, my visit ended without a purchase, leaving me feeling unsatisfied. In light of the fact that Pink Box intends to extend its operating hours or remain open 24/7, similar to its other locations, I strongly advise the establishment to reassess its inventory and provide patrons with a broader spectrum of choices to indulge in.

This establishment's hygiene leaves much to be desired. The carpeting appears to harbor numerous unsightly stains, while an overpowering odor of mildew permeates the atmosphere. Upon entering the lobby, one cannot help but be struck by the unkempt nature of the furnishings. The cushions of the Ottoman in particular, bear an unfortunate resemblance to a Jackson Pollock painting, with their multitude of unsightly stains. My attempts to bring these issues to the attention of management were met with an utter lack of concern, compelling me to share my experiences with others. The furniture within the rooms themselves, exhibit visible signs of aging and wear, with chipped surfaces and fabrics that bear an unsettling similarity to those found in a morgue. Furthermore, the presence of deceased insects and other creepy-crawlies near both the room windows and those of the lobby, only serve to further undermine any semblance of cleanliness. To top it all off, photographic evidence of these issues is readily available. In conclusion, unless one is seeking a dubious bargain at the cost of their personal hygiene, it is strongly advised to avoid this establishment altogether. Were it possible to assign a rating lower than a single star, this author would not hesitate to do so.

This proved to be an ill-advised venture, as the happy hour offerings were somewhat perplexing and required meticulous scrutiny to decipher. Furthermore, the menu selections were meager and lacking in substance, particularly in regards to the slider dish which was overwhelmingly dominated by bread and deficient in palatable meat. Additionally, the culinary experience was utterly unremarkable, devoid of any discernible flavors or seasonings. The service was equally unsatisfactory, as our hydration needs were consistently disregarded throughout the duration of our visit, and the procurement of our bill was excruciatingly slow. Consequently, I am unequivocally disinclined to expend even a minimal amount of currency at this establishment, given the abundance of superior options within the confines of Tempe Market Place.

"We are utterly dissatisfied with our recent visit to Francis Automotive. Despite solely arriving for an oil change, we were coerced into a $70 wash and cleaning package, which we declined. However, they persisted in their attempts to upsell us, claiming that our vehicle required a new battery at the cost of $120, despite our protests. They also suggested that we replace the air filter and undergo a fuel system cleaning, both of which we rejected. Following this encounter, we transported our automobile to our trusted family mechanic, who successfully recharged the battery, rendering it fully operational. However, during our journey towards Scottsdale, we encountered an elevated temperature reading and discovered that the radiator cap was absent, which we found peculiar. We were compelled to halt at Auto Zone to procure coolant and a replacement cap. In summary, our vehicle did not display any of these issues prior to visiting Francis Automotive; yet, mysteriously, they manifested during and after our visit. When we brought this to the attention of the manager, he refuted any involvement and asserted that they did not remove the cap. Ultimately, we harbor grave doubts regarding the integrity of Francis Automotive and their handling of our situation, leading us to conclude that we shall not return."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."
This statement can be improved by using longer and more sophisticated vocabulary and sentence structure while maintaining the same meaning. Here's a possible modification:

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

"The culinary excursion to this establishment yielded an unfortunate concatenation of events, marked by exorbitant pricing and a disappointing bowl of pho that ranks among the most unsatisfactory I have had the misfortune of consuming."

In this revised version, we've employed longer sentences and more complex vocabulary to convey the same message. We've replaced "not much to say" with "culinary excursion," "overpriced" with "exorbitant pricing," and "one of the worst pho meals i have ever had" with "a disappointing bowl of pho that ranks among the most unsatisfactory I have had the misfortune of consuming." Additionally, we've incorporated synonyms for "bad" such as "unfortunate," "disappointing," and "unsatisfactory" to enhance the vocabulary.

These individuals are a farce; their conduct is utterly laughable and deplorable. I recently required a routine oil change and a replacement rear tire for my motorcycle, so I endeavored to procure such services from a reputable establishment. Following a thorough examination of potential vendors within my immediate vicinity, I opted to patronize a particular dealership located in the valley region. Unfortunately, upon arriving at the designated location, I was met with an unexpected and unreasonable increase in pricing, which was grossly disproportionate to the quotation I had previously received via telephonic communication. Furthermore, the service adviser and manager exhibited a flagrant lack of concern for my dissatisfaction, adopting an unyielding and inflexible stance regarding their refusal to compromise on the inflated figures. It is truly regrettable that the management at Chandler Harley Davidson appears to prioritize profiteering over providing adequate customer service, fostering an environment of unbridled arrogance among their staff members. In light of these circumstances, I would strongly advise against entrusting one's business to such an organization, and I personally shall avoid future interactions with them. Needless to say, I am utterly revolted by the experience.

"It appears that they exhausted their inventory of cheese, precipitating an unforeseen delay in the preparation of my pizza. Furthermore, they provided me with a two-hour delivery window subsequent to the forty-five minute wait, which I found rather vexing. Additionally, they stipulated a five-day refund period for canceling my online order, which I deemed utterly preposterous. Suffice it to say, the experience left much to be desired in terms of both culinary quality and customer service. \n\nUPDATE: Two weeks have elapsed since my initial visit, and I am still awaiting the processing of my refund. Upon contacting the establishment's staff, I was advised to initiate a chargeback via my financial institution, a decidedly unsatisfactory resolution to the matter."

"Deplorable commercial conduct... I contacted to procure pizza for my enterprise, situated at the intersection of 51st Avenue and Indian School Road. Upon disclosing my geographical location, the representative conveyed that they were unable to provide delivery services, citing an arbitrary and inconsequential distance of 50 feet from the nearest freeway as the rationale behind their refusal. This response was delivered in a flippant manner, devoid of any concern for the adverse impact it may have on my business or the potential economic benefits that could have been derived from establishing a mutually beneficial relationship. It is truly unfortunate that such a lackadaisical attitude persists in the contemporary business world, particularly during times of economic hardship."

"It is strongly advised to refrain from engaging with this cleaning company due to their unreliable nature, as evidenced by their tendency to abruptly cancel scheduled appointments mere days prior and fail to provide alternative dates for an extended period of time, thereby rendering their services untrustworthy and unworthy of investment through platforms such as Groupon."

"Deplorable fraudsters! These individuals are engaging in unethical and illegal practices, masquerading as a reputable moving company to deceive unsuspecting clients and perpetrate further misdeeds; it is imperative that those who have fallen prey to their schemes file a formal grievance with the office of the attorney general, detailing the extent of the damage inflicted upon their possessions, to ensure that justice is served and such nefarious activities are deterred in the future."

"Egregious entrance attendants and publicists. Endured an interminable queue for a paltry twenty minutes subsequent to receiving gratis admittance. Upon reaching the portal, was met with the assertion that ingress would not be feasible sans a physical ticket. Utter fallacy. Avoid this establishment at all costs."

"Detritus. The supervisor is malevolent and discourteous. Would instead opt to have a vacant table than seat it with a group of females. Felt that we wouldn't be deserving of a table, despite the fact that I possess the financial means to indulge in a bachelorette celebration here. Unfortunate. I shall never return. Management is atrocious and would prefer to witness an unoccupied eatery than a table of women."

"The proficiency of the service staff, specifically Jessica and Emily, within the confines of the bar, was indeed exceptional; however, it was somewhat disconcerting to note that no special provisions or acknowledgments were extended to honor the sacrifices of our nation's veterans on the occasion of Memorial Day weekend, thereby eliciting a sense of disappointment and warranting a mere single-star rating, contingent upon the implementation of measures to address this oversight and demonstrate appreciation for the selfless contributions of our military personnel."

The dissatisfactory encounter I recently endured at this establishment serves as a stark reminder of the importance of maintaining a high level of customer service and cleanliness, particularly within the realm of the beauty industry. Upon entering the salon, I was met with an air of disdain by the staff members, who appeared to be engaging in derogatory conversation regarding myself and my companions. Such behavior not only fosters an uncomfortable atmosphere for patrons but also undermines the trust and respect that is essential for a successful business-customer relationship. Moreover, the state of disarray that permeated the physical space, specifically the unkempt mystic spray tanning booth, only served to exacerbate my disappointment. In light of these factors, I must unequivocally declare that this particular tanning experience ranks among the most unpleasant I have had the misfortune of encountering.

"Wow, it's truly remarkable how our dining experience at this establishment was marred by an apparent oversight on the part of the staff, resulting in our unfortunate departure without having the opportunity to sample their culinary offerings, particularly my wife's eagerly anticipated tartare. It's quite astonishing that even upon our exit, no one seemed to take notice or express any concern for our dissatisfaction. Under the circumstances, I feel compelled to assign a solitary star in rating, not as a reflection of the gastronomic quality, but rather as a means of registering our discontent with the service we received. Ultimately, our visit was a disappointment."

Headed back to Phoenix and of course I get stuck with jerk Bernard again. Swerving all over he road, being rude to customers.  We stopped in Falstaff for what he's said was a 15 min break.....he left us on the bus for 43 mins without explanation.  Then when is asked him what t he problem was he said,nothing and was extremely rude
