The two more desirable pieces were promptly sold as soon as their prices were lowered, whereas the third, less desirable item, remained unsold despite never being discounted. This anomaly continues to perplex me. When I queried the salesperson on the floor, his response was that they needed to further reduce the price of the item in question. His demeanor was characterized by an air of haughty superiority, which only served to exacerbate my already negative experience. In light of this episode, I have come to realize that there are numerous consignment shops that operate with a 60-day waiting period before implementing price reductions and splitting profits equally with the seller. Consequently, if you possess a high-quality item, I would strongly advise seeking alternative venues for its sale."

"The piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance of our evening repast was undoubtedly the succulent beef ribs, prime rib, and delectable gelato that graced our plates, although the attentive and accommodating service we received did not necessarily dispel our reservations about wholeheartedly endorsing this establishment to our nearest and dearest companions, particularly those visiting from afar, despite the fact that the culinary offerings did momentarily satiate our appetites."

"I have had the pleasure of frequenting this establishment on multiple occasions during my tenure at MCC, and while the culinary offerings were indeed satisfactory, the proprietor's behavior left much to be desired. Specifically, I recall two instances that marred my dining experience. The first occurred when I attempted to engage in conversation in Japanese, as part of my language-learning endeavors. Unfortunately, the owner responded by berating me and admonishing me to speak English instead. A subsequent visit by a friend of mine yielded an even more distressing encounter. Upon expressing gratitude for the meal in the customary Japanese manner, the proprietor audibly muttered a derogatory term, 'Henna Gaijin,' beneath his breath. Such conduct not only betrays a lack of respect for cultural diversity but also undermines the very essence of hospitality. As such, I have elected not to return to this restaurant, opting instead to seek out establishments where a more welcoming atmosphere prevails."

Hotel and room were fine but I was very disappointed that they wouldn't let the shuttle take us to or pick us at the light rail station. The other hotels in the area had their shuttles running without trouble. Probably won't stay here again.

"The verdant strata permeating the entire confectionary creation was brought to my attention by my sibling, who employed the succinct phrase 'that's mold!' to convey her observation. The culinary item in question had been procured merely two hours prior at the PV Chompie's establishment, and was now positioned before our spouses and offspring. I digitally captured an image of the cake, which must be visualized to be truly appreciated. The extent of fungal growth within the edible substance raises concerns regarding its age and quality. It is utterly astounding that culinary experts would permit such a hazardous product to be consumed. We promptly returned the item to the place of purchase and received a refund. The General Manager offered us an alternative and alluded to discussing the matter with the bakery. However, this particular circumstance cannot be rectified by a GM's efforts to placate the customer. The provision of harmful sustenance is irreparable and indicative of a potential systemic issue in food handling within the eatery. No thank you; we decline your substitute pastry and any other comestibles you may offer. My family's well-being holds greater importance than the risk of consuming your fare once more."

Recently partook in a midday repast, and while the initial offerings were satisfactory, the primary dish left much to be desired. Specifically, the beef broccoli lacked any semblance of flavor, rendering it unpalatably insipid, while the pad Thai was utterly revolting. In contrast, numerous alternative Chinese and Thai establishments in Henderson provide vastly superior culinary experiences.

My better half, a dedicated patron for an extended period exceeding twelve months, experienced an unfortunate cutaneous response encircling her follicular region subsequent to undergoing pigmentation treatment, prompting her to contact Vincent, the manager, who assured her that he would conduct an inquiry and subsequently revert with his findings; however, this communication marked the final exchange between them. This unfortunate occurrence served as the proverbial "last straw," compelling my spouse to seek alternative salon services, with the additional expense of forty dollars for a straightforward blow dry following a treatment, deeming it utterly exorbitant and unreasonable; thus, it is judicious to explore other options.

The sandwiches have taken a huge downhill turn. AVOID, even though they are dirt cheap at $2.99. This location uses stale bread, end slices of tomatoes, brown lettuce and the most minimal amount of turkey possible. Pathetic excuse for a sandwich.If your desperate, it still is Boars Head, so strip the turkey and use your own bread and condiments.

"Absolutely deplorable experience...I visited this establishment for a bridal shower and the service was utterly reprehensible! With a mere 12 individuals in our group, one would assume that providing adequate service would be a straightforward task. Unfortunately, this was not the case, as two salads were forgotten and three entrees were missed. Our server, Kevin, was woefully inadequate, and the manager, Kelly, displayed a complete lack of responsiveness to our concerns. It is utterly inconceivable that any individual would consider organizing a gathering at such an incompetently managed venue. The day was intended to be a celebration of the bride-to-be, but regrettably, everyone's attention was diverted towards the sluggish, unacceptable, and discourteous service."

We would not advocate visiting this establishment to any individual seeking an enjoyable dining experience, as our own visit on a Friday evening proved to be utterly disappointing. It is conceivable that the dearth of patrons at this time may have been attributable to the uninspired musical selections being played, which, despite occasional glimpses of promise, were generally of poor quality and failed to enhance the ambiance. In light of these factors, it becomes apparent that a trip to this restaurant is hardly worthwhile.

"Although the donuts were merely average in terms of culinary excellence, I was pleased to observe that they were sourced from a local bakery, thereby supporting the regional economy and fostering a sense of community. However, my dining experience was unfortunately marred by an unsolicited and rather vociferous expression of political views by one of the establishment's employees, which I felt was inappropriate and somewhat off-putting. In my opinion, a restaurant should maintain a neutral stance on political matters and focus primarily on providing an exceptional gastronomical experience for its clientele. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, I must admit that the business model employed by this particular eatery appears to be quite astute, as it capitalizes on the growing demand for sustainable and eco-friendly practices within the food industry. By occupying a relatively small physical space, utilizing a highly efficient production process, and catering to a demographic that places a premium on environmentally conscious consumption, this enterprise has managed to achieve a remarkable level of profitability with minimal overhead expenses. Moreover, I must commend their commitment to using biodiesel fuel in their company vehicle, as it exemplifies their dedication to reducing their carbon footprint and contributing positively to the local community's environmental well-being. If the quality of their donuts can be improved to a level that meets or exceeds my expectations, I would be inclined to revise my assessment upward and perhaps even become a regular patron of their establishment."

This establishment purporting to provide automobile cleansing services is, without a doubt, the most abysmal in the vicinity. The experience, from the moment of arrival to departure, is utterly wretched. Upon entering the premises, one is accosted by questionable individuals, ostensibly former convicts, who aggressively promote an array of additional services. Even when requesting a standard wash, these employees will endeavour to persuade customers to indulge in extraneous services such as waxing or leather treatments. Subsequent to this dubious encounter, the vehicle is subjected to a mechanical wash, employing tracks that scratch the rims and heavy beaters that damage the paint. Following this ordeal, the automobile is transported to an enclosed area where disgruntled attendants perfunctorily wipe away a few droplets before vociferously declaring the car ready. It is highly unlikely that a car wash is intended to leave vehicles in a more dilapidated state than prior to the service.

"The gastronomical offerings in the form of burgers and fries at this establishment are palatable, albeit for individuals with a pronounced predilection for lubricants and sodium chloride. Furthermore, the cost of procuring these comestibles is rather exorbitant. It is worth noting that during the initial stages of their operations, when novelty and curiosity served to attract a copious amount of patrons, the commercial performance of this eatery was on a steady decline."

"It is utterly preposterous that such a renowned establishment would permit an individual, specifically a member of their security personnel, to engage in such boorish and unprofessional behavior towards patrons. The sheer audacity and impudence displayed by this person, who insisted on persistently harassing me despite my explicit expressions of disinterest and discomfort, are truly reprehensible. Furthermore, the fact that his colleague felt compelled to intervene and admonish him underscores the egregious nature of his conduct. Suffice it to say, my expectations for an enjoyable evening were thoroughly dashed by this unfortunate encounter, and I shall henceforth exercise caution in considering Hakkasan as a viable entertainment option."

"The epitome of unpleasant dining experiences in Montreal, this eatery exemplified squalor, with chairs in disrepair and tables straining under the meager weight of the culinary offerings. The fare itself was abysmal, consisting of a sandwich fabricated from stale, tough bread and a paltry scattering of meat; the hummus was passable, while the salad was an uninspired medley of bitter lettuce and a token drizzle of dressing. Furthermore, the server's inability to furnish adequate change led to an awkward predicament wherein I was coerced into relinquishing an excessive gratuity, merely to avoid the tedium of awaiting her solicitation of spare change from numerous patrons. Needless to say, Shahrazad should be relegated to the bottom of one's list when seeking a convivial dining experience."

I didn't eat here, just walked in and tried to sit down at lunch time. The people were nasty so we walked out. Plus there's a $50 minimum per person. Gotta give it to 'em - they went all the way with the ridiculous minimum.

During my recent sojourn at the Vdara Hotel, I had the misfortune of encountering an unpleasant experience, which not only tarnished my expectations but also raised concerns regarding the establishment's commitment to providing an optimal guest experience. Upon arriving at the hotel, I decided to take a brief nap on the bed, only to be abruptly awoken by an intense itching sensation emanating from one of my legs. Upon lifting the quilt, I was taken aback by the presence of numerous black spots scattered across the sheet. My initial incredulity quickly gave way to utter dismay, as I had anticipated a higher standard of cleanliness and hygiene from a reputable hotel chain such as Vdara. I promptly contacted the housingkeeping department and requested that they replace the compromised linens without delay. Subsequently, I solicited the attention of the manager, who arrived shortly thereafter to inspect the issue firsthand. The African American manager, seemingly taken aback by the situation, proceeded to capture a photographic record of the offending stains and assured me that he would submit a report to the appropriate authorities and provide compensation for the inconvenience caused. However, much to my chagrin, I remained awaiting a response from the hotel for two days, with no resolution or reparation forthcoming. It appears that Vdara may not place sufficient emphasis on prioritizing customer satisfaction, thereby rendering it a less-than-ideal choice for travelers seeking a pleasant and worry-free stay.

The plethora of evaluations pertaining to this establishment appear to be marked by inconsistency, with my personal experience falling squarely into the latter category; specifically, the quality of service was subpar and the hostess's demeanor was utterly unprofessional, bordering on outright hostility. Moreover, the dining area was not particularly crowded, which made the prolonged wait for our meals all the more vexing. Furthermore, the culinary offerings, once we were finally able to sample them, were merely average, and the wine arrived belatedly. In light of these factors, I must conclude that my expectations for an undiscovered gem were woefully misplaced, and instead, I found myself confronted with an unmitigated disappointment.

"What possessed me to venture into this decrepit establishment? I had visiting family members from out of town seeking souvenir t-shirts to bring back to Nebraska. Bonanza offers an array of t-shirts, albeit mediocre imitations and risquÃ© attire unsuitable for public wear in any respectable setting beyond the confines of Fremont Street. If one is in pursuit of kitschy Las Vegas-themed trinkets, questionable CSI merchandise, secondhand playing cards from Harrah's, and an assortment of colored dice, then this gift shop might prove to be a veritable treasure trove. However, be prepared to encounter overzealous security personnel who regard customers with suspicion and subject them to antiquated checkout procedures. Furthermore, a staff member stationed at the entrance will inspect receipts, a futile endeavor considering the prevalence of theft. It is unfortunate that the employees themselves appear to be a collection of disgruntled individuals bemoaning their fate. Following my visit, I cannot help but wish that the ongoing demolition on the northern portion of the Strip had extended slightly farther northward, encompassing this wretched establishment. Perhaps when the SLS Las Vegas breathes new life into the Sahara, a perceptive developer will eradicate this unsightly blot. Although I advocate for preserving historic Vegas, photographs of this gift shop will suffice instead of maintaining the actual eyesore. This critique pertains solely to the gift shop and not the adjacent liquor store, which may be the sole redeeming feature of this woeful excuse for a retail establishment."

"The sole aspect of this eatery that piques my interest is the entrance via the culinary quarters. However, the ambiance is marred by the brusque demeanor of the mixologists, a duo whose comportment falls short of hospitable standards. While the comestibles are palatable, it would be an exaggeration to describe them as exceptional. This establishment seems to benefit from an inexplicable leniency, perpetuating a reputation that is undeserved. The antiquated flock wallpaper and geriatric waitstaff only contribute to an overall mediocrity that renders it unremarkable among its peers. Numerous alternative dining options exist, rendering this venue unnecessary."

At first, I presumed that I was destined to partake in a remarkable experience at this establishment, primarily due to their extensive assortment of merchandise, which catered to the preferences of both fervent alcohol connoisseurs and aficionados of wine-related paraphernalia. However, my expectations were utterly dissipated by the discourteous and unpleasant demeanor exhibited by the female staff members who were present during my visit.

As a recently turned 21-year-old individual, I have become accustomed to displaying my identification, and I do not harbor any reservations about doing so. In fact, I am cognizant of the legal requirements and would never deliberately put a business at risk of being penalized for serving an underage patron. Nonetheless, the women were excessively impolite when they demanded that I display my identification prior to even inspecting a wine. Furthermore, after I had presented my identification to one of the more amiable staff members, the others appeared to be utterly disconcerted and fixated on the fact that I was consuming an alcoholic beverage. Their repetitive remarks regarding the potential fines that would be imposed if they served me while underage were not only superfluous but also rather vexing.

It is regrettable that the staff's behavior was so uncivil, as we were on the verge of purchasing several bottles of wine and some decorative items.

"In the year 2007, I encountered an unfortunate situation where my vehicle's alternator malfunctioned, leaving me stranded. Subsequently, a tow truck driver recommended a repair shop that supposedly possessed the expertise to rectify the issue efficiently. Upon arriving at the facility, the technician declared that the process of replacing the alternator would be arduous due to its location, and thus, demanded an exorbitant fee of $385 for both parts and labor. Despite my initial reluctance, I relented and authorized the repair. However, fast forward to the present, my vehicle has accumulated 120,000 miles, and the same alternator issue has recurred, albeit with only 50,000 miles on the replacement unit. When I contacted the establishment to inquire about their warranty policy, they refused to honor it. In light of this, I opted to pursue a more economical solution by watching a tutorial on YouTube, which enabled me to execute the replacement myself. By purchasing the necessary components from Auto Zone and adhering to the instructions provided in the video, I successfully installed a new alternator with a lifetime warranty within a mere 45 minutes, including two trips to the store. Conclusively, I strongly advise against utilizing the services of this particular repair shop, as their practices are unethical and their claims are blatantly false."

Horrible service.  

Could not understand the clerk taking my order, then of course it wasn't what I wanted.  The clerk then tries to blame me for the mistake - what???  

The person making my drink acts like it's such a pain to make what I wanted.  Then, she makes it wrong again anyway, so I just had to walk away, with no drink, or else many awful things may have come out of my mouth!

"A plethora of demeanor and gastronomical mediocrity? My gratitude is withheld. 

There exists a pernicious cycle in relation to forming presumptions regarding one's clientele. One assumes, 'They appear youthful and opted for tap water. It is likely that they will not expend considerable financial resources here. I shall disregard them.' Well, you see, when one fails to perceive their server again throughout the evening and is compelled to request assistance from managers, the outcome is often an inadequate gratuity. 

We requested several glasses of sangria, specifically the crimson variety, which proved to be satisfactory yet unremarkable. Subsequently, we ordered a few platters of tapas, as a means of initiating our culinary experience. The risotto was utterly disappointing, and a few additional dishes were also sampled. The sole exceptional aspect of the meal was the ceviche, although I have undoubtedly encountered superior renditions. The cost was exorbitant, and the quantity of sustenance was minimal, relative to the price. 

There are numerous superior alternatives available. My intentions do not include a future visit."

"Subpar culinary experience with too much repetition in ambiance and insufficient flavor profile, save for an abundance of condiments; however, the server's hospitable demeanor almost compensated for the deficiencies, misleading us into assuming a connection to authentic Mexican cuisine due to the proximity."

I have had the privilege of utilizing the services of this laundromat for an approximate duration of two years. During my visits, I have encountered courteous females (provided they are not engrossed in their mobile devices, indulging in lengthy conversations). However, my most recent visit proved to be my last, as I have since relocated from the surrounding area (much to my relief). Following my departure, I have attempted to contact their customer service department through the designated telephone number, only to be met with an automated response, assuring me of a return call within a twenty-four hour period. Unfortunately, several days have passed without a response, leaving me feeling frustrated and disillusioned. Furthermore, I have noticed an increase in unsavory individuals, including beggars and intoxicated persons, taking refuge on the premises, with seemingly no attempts made by management to address the issue. Needless to say, I am relieved to no longer be burdened with the responsibility of frequenting this establishment.

"Upon perusing the ambiance of this establishment, one cannot help but harbor trepidation regarding the state of one's health and wellbeing. Following numerous traversals of the vicinity, a coterie of acquaintances and I opted to partake in the purported 'Tuesday wing night', only to be met with an experience that engendered a collective sentiment that we would not be revisiting this venue in the future. Although I am currently free from any discernible symptoms of illness, the uncertainty surrounding the potential ramifications of consuming food and beverages obtained from such a source leaves me apprehensive regarding the possibility of an unpleasant awakening come morning. In light of the aforementioned, it is my conviction that one would be well-advised to seek sustenance and refreshment at a different location within the neighborhood, lest they wish to risk the prospect of ingesting something potentially harmful or subpar in quality. As an alternative, a journey of merely half a mile in distance to acquire a pizza from Fiori's would likely prove a more salubrious and satisfying option."

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are of satisfactory quality, however, the hospitality extended by the staff is subpar, particularly in the absence of the proprietor, Rajiv. Moreover, the delivery process is fraught with difficulties, resulting in unacceptably tepid fare, and the personnel tend to shift the responsibility onto the customer in the event of a failed delivery. It is imperative that the management addresses these shortcomings in order to provide a more satisfactory dining experience for their clientele."

On July 31st, 2014, in commemoration of my boyfriend's birthday, I treated him to a culinary excursion at this establishment, during which I had the misfortune of consuming dumplings that were uncooked on the inside, as evidenced by the accompanying image. Following my observation of this flaw, the waitress merely removed my plate without providing any solution to rectify the problem. Consequently, I ingested raw pork owing to their carelessness, which has precipitated my current state of dizziness. I emphatically declare that I shall never engage in commercial transactions with this enterprise again.

I fervently wish I had perused some of the critiques prior to visiting this Korean BBQ eatery, as my experience was marred by a series of unfortunate events stemming from the staff's discourteous behavior. Despite my ethnic background, the hostess displayed visible disdain towards my lack of proficiency in the Korean language, which set the tone for an unpleasant dining experience. The waitstaff, though sparse in their interactions, conveyed an air of disinterest and aversion towards me, exemplified by the waitress's curt demeanor and reluctance to provide adequate service. The cuisine, characterized by the unremarkable pork bulgogi, fell short of my expectations, and the prolonged delay in receiving my bill only exacerbated my frustration. The absence of a cordial atmosphere and the staff's seeming indifference towards ensuring a positive customer experience left me feeling disappointed and disinclined to revisit the establishment, save for the necessity of using the restroom facilities.

"The customer experience at this establishment is subpar. Yesterday, I entered the premises due to technical difficulties with my iPhone. Upon approaching an associate at the Genius Bar, I communicated my concerns and was informed that I would need to return in three hours' time to receive assistance from a specialist. This response was met with incredulity on my part, given the fact that there were at least five representatives engaged in a social gathering, none of whom were attending to clientele. Suffice it to say, I promptly departed the location and sought assistance from T-Mobile, whereupon I encountered exceptional customer service. Disillusioned with Apple, I am unlikely to make future purchases from the company."

"The San Gennaro Feast, once a celebrated event, has degenerated into an overpriced and underwhelming experience. Initially, it showcased promise, but subsequent years have witnessed a steady decline in quality. 

A comprehensive sampling of the festival's offerings has revealed a consistent mediocrity, with the exception of the lemonade stand, which remains a steadfast and reliable option. The sausage, once a highly anticipated delicacy, has succumbed to the pitfalls of mass production, resulting in a desiccated and unappetizing fare that few are willing to purchase at the exorbitant price of $10 or more per sandwich. 

Furthermore, the entrance fee, considered in conjunction with the relocation of the festival to a venue removed from the Strip, is seen as excessive and unwarranted, contributing to an overall atmosphere akin to a 'Gypsie fest.'"

This establishment has ostensibly relinquished its commitment to providing adequate service, culminating in a profoundly disappointing experience for patrons. My recent visit exemplified this decline, as I endured an extended wait before the arrival of a lethargic server, who seemed indifferent to my presence. Despite my eagerness to sample their advertised 35-cent wing special, the prolonged delay necessitated my departure, thus precluding me from enjoying the wings. Furthermore, I failed to receive a single refill on my beverage, which further reinforced my perception of the staff's apathy. To exacerbate matters, I discovered that the management had discontinued the Monday wing promotion, without bothering to inform patrons. In light of these events, I must caution potential customers against frequenting this establishment, as it appears to have deteriorated into a mere shadow of its former self.

This establishment commenced its operations with an air of pleasantness, but it did not take long for it to degenerate into a state of utter disarray. The floors have become tainted with dirt and grime, the exterior premises are perpetually in a state of disorder, while the staff members themselves exude an attitude of acrimony and animosity towards their vocation. Inquire about a particular matter, and you may witness a display of hostility, perhaps even to the extent of inflicting self-harm with a box cutter. This location persistently struggles to accommodate an adequate number of customers, resulting in interminable delays at the checkout counters, while the personnel manning the self-service kiosks are conspicuous by their absence. Furthermore, a cursory examination of the prices reveals them to be exorbitant, which serves to further compound the myriad shortcomings that plague this retail outlet. It is truly lamentable that individuals appear to be oblivious to the fact that Walmart's claims of offering the most competitive prices are, in reality, nothing more than a fallacy. A comparative analysis of prices at various establishments, including the Target store situated across the 215, reveals that the latter boasts the most affordable average prices for both foodstuffs and health and beauty products. Considering that it also houses a comprehensive grocery section within its Garden Center wing, it is the wisest choice for procurement of provisions henceforth. As for the dimwitted "security" officer, his presence is superfluous and an encumbrance, and it would be greatly appreciated were he to vacate the premises forthwith!

"Greetings! My spouse and I have been inhabiting a residential unit within the Crosswinds apartment complex located in Chandler, Arizona. Lamentably, we have not been experiencing an optimal living environment due to the presence of Blattodea, commonly known as cockroaches, which have been proliferating at an alarming rate. The pest control measures implemented by the management have been inadequate, as the utilization of peanut butter in the cabinetry has served only to exacerbate the infestation, resulting in a sizable colony of Periplaneta americana taking up residence within our convection oven, a kitchen appliance gifted to us on the occasion of our nuptials and valued at a sum of three hundred dollars. Furthermore, we have discovered entry points for these unwelcome intruders in the form of fissures situated behind our stove, within the walls. Considering the presence of our two beloved pets and our reluctance to subject our possessions to potentially harmful chemicals, we are hesitant to resort to bombing our dwelling. Instead, we suggest that a comprehensive pest eradication effort be undertaken throughout all structures within the complex, given the widespread nature of both Blattodea and Cimex lectularius, or bed bugs, affecting numerous tenants. Our endurance in addressing this matter has reached its limits, and we expect a prompt resolution to this distressing situation, lest we be compelled to seek restitution for any further damage incurred in safeguarding our home against these unwanted arthropods."

This dining establishment was utterly deplorable. The server had me vociferously articulate my order across the expanse of the room, which was met with a profound sense of incredulity on my part. Our culinary offerings were reprehensible, characterized by an unpleasant combination of wilted and enigmatic constituents, in addition to an array of glaring omissions. The manager, in a magnanimous gesture, elected to compensate our entire meal and beverages, and even extended an offer of a complimentary dessert to take away. However, given the utter lack of gastronomical quality, we respectfully declined. Suffice it to say, this experience was a veritable travesty, eliciting an exclamation of utter disbelief from yours truly. Moreover, nearby patrons who witnessed the unfolding events opted to vacate their seats at the same time as ourselves, expressing their solidarity through a cordial handshake. Utterly preposterous!

"This establishment is unequivocally subpar. Initially, we proceeded to check in and were instructed to return at 12; however, upon our return at 12, we were informed that our room would not be available until 3. Perplexed and annoyed, we decided to temporarily vacate the premises, only to discover upon our return at 3 that individuals without prior reservations had been accommodated at 12. The incongruity of this situation incensed both myself and my family to an immense degree, but we opted to dismiss the matter for the time being. Later that evening, I noticed that the bedding appeared unclean, with a conspicuous stain on one of the pillowcases. My dissatisfaction with the state of the lodging increased substantially. Furthermore, while traversing the corridor the following morning, I observed dishes and drinkware strewn about the floor. Although we did not attribute much significance to it at the time, their continued presence later that night raised concerns regarding the adequacy of the hotel's upkeep. In light of these experiences, I am emphatic in my decision never to return to this establishment."

With Walmart being so big, they lack customer service. Pressed for assistant more than 3x at the fabric section and no one showed up. They just keep losing sales over and over. Will it ever get better??!!!! Such a disappointment.

"Having had the privilege of being immersed within the hospitality sector for a duration of twelve years, I feel compelled to share my sentiments regarding the establishment in question, albeit with the understanding that my viewpoint may be subjective and open to interpretation. The location, while improved from its previous iteration, presents itself in a relatively diminutive format, which, in conjunction with the subpar culinary offerings and sluggish service, does little to inspire confidence in the venue's ability to provide an enjoyable dining experience. Furthermore, the dearth of patrons during our visit, despite the absence of any notable ambiance or charm, should perhaps serve as an indication of the restaurant's limited appeal. While I might consider returning with my offspring for the purpose of entertainment, I would unquestionably refrain from partaking in the edible offerings, especially given the abundance of superior alternatives in the surrounding area. It is worth noting that, based on my extensive exposure to the industry, I have witnessed numerous establishments with comparable shortcomings falter and ultimately shut their doors. Thus, barring any dramatic transformations, it remains uncertain whether this particular business can sustain itself in the long term."

I would considerably prefer to accord this establishment a rating of zero stars, as my experience with their services has been utterly subpar. Following my scheduling of a pickup, I was provided with a time frame during which the assigned individual would arrive; however, said individual failed to materialize. Despite my having received a telephonic communication from a certain Jason, who assured me that the driver was merely running a few minutes behind schedule, the extent of the delay proved to be significantly more substantial. Following a series of fruitless conversations with three distinct customer service representatives, the final individual with whom I interacted informed me that the driver had returned to the company's storage facility and that the earliest feasible appointment they could offer me was two weeks hence. This entire ordeal has been nothing short of exasperating, and I have little doubt that I shall refrain from utilizing their services in the future, particularly in light of the fact that I was compelled to spend seven hours awaiting their arrival in vain.

We visited Metro Pizza on Sky Point Drive last night and ordered a large triple play pizza, which cost an exorbitant $24.00, despite being a thin crust pizza, which we found to be somewhat disappointing considering the price. To add insult to injury, our four-month-old car, which hadn't even had its first oil change yet, was keyed on the entire passenger side while parked in one of Metro Pizza's designated handicap parking spots, despite our visible display of a handicap sign. We are both handicapped individuals who rely on these designated spaces. Unfortunately, the parking lot's remote location from the restaurant's entrance creates an easy target for vandalism against patrons' vehicles. Following the incident, we contacted the police, filed a complaint, and brought the issue to the attention of Metro Pizza's manager on duty. We suggested that the establishment consider installing cameras in the parking lot and encouraged the manager to notify the authorities to increase surveillance in the area. However, the manager failed to follow through on his promise to have the owner contact us. As a result, we had the most expensive pizza experience ever and will avoid dining at Metro Pizza in the future. We advise the public to exercise caution when patronizing this establishment, as their parking lot may pose a risk to the safety of their vehicles.

I ordered delivery because of the good reviews. I ordered garlic knots and a hawaiian pizza. When the food arrived, the garlic knots were stale and crunchy. I could not eat them. The pizza wasn't much better. The cheese was already rubberized andbthe grease soaked through to the bottom leaving a floppy, soggy crust. I wouldn't recommend eating this to anyone. It was one of those times that trying something new over the usual was a disaster.

Sorry, this venue was utterly disappointing. Not only was it overcrowded, but the service was abysmal, and the culinary offerings were merely average. I was requested to present my identification on three separate occasions (despite being forty-five years of age), and furthermore, there was a restriction of one beverage per individual at the bar, in spite of the fact that the server at our table took an excessive amount of time, totaling approximately forty-five minutes, between each round of refreshments delivered to our table... needless to say, I shall never return to this establishment.

My spouse and I have had the pleasure of dining at this esteemed establishment on a previous occasion, and our culinary experience was nothing short of exceptional. However, upon our most recent visit, we encountered several issues that warranted a solitary star in our review. Firstly, the queue was utterly absurd, with a wait time of over an hour, even with only four patrons ahead of us. Secondly, and quite astonishingly, we were informed that no individual under the age of 21 was permitted to partake in the gastronomic delights offered by this restaurant. This revelation was utterly perplexing and left us feeling incredulous. Our group consisted of my husband, our 13-year-old daughter, and myself, and we had ventured quite some distance from the strip specifically to indulge in the delectable fare offered here. After approximately 40 minutes of waiting, during which the line had failed to advance, a staff member approached us and informed us that our presence was no longer desired due to the age restriction. Needless to say, we shall not be returning to this establishment, either with or without our offspring, at any point in the future.

We have had the unfortunate experience of visiting this establishment on multiple occasions, and it is with great dismay that we must attest to the fact that the proprietor of this eatery has, on each and every visit, flagrantly singled out our party due to our ethnicity and cultural background. As we endeavored to partake in a tranquil repast, we were suddenly and without provocation accosted by the aforementioned restaurateur, who, with utter disregard for our patronage, chose to launch a vitriolic tirade against us based solely on our racial identity. Upon bringing this egregious affront to his attention, he callously persisted in his bigoted behavior, ultimately culminating in a most distressing and wholly unacceptable diatribe directed towards our table. It is with profound disappointment and indignation that we must report that this reprehensible incident served as the capstone to an already thoroughly unpleasant dining experience, rendering it a tragic and unnecessary squandering of valuable resources.

"Underwhelmed and disillusioned by an unsatisfactory culinary excursion, I entered the establishment in the company of a companion, only to be confronted with an acrid and unpalatable beverage, further exacerbated by a lackadaisical and inhospitable demeanor on the part of the staff. The prolonged delay in receiving our simple repast, juxtaposed with the expedited departure of other patrons who had already obtained their sustenance, served only to intensify my dissatisfaction. Unfortunately, this constitutes the second instance of an unfavorable encounter, thereby casting doubt upon the likelihood of my future patronage."

"The culinary experience was utterly disappointing. As an astute gastronomic aficionado, I would strongly advise potential patrons to seek sustenance at an alternative establishment located a mere one block south of this subpar eatery. It is highly likely that this particular business will cease operations within a span of three months due to its apparent lack of quality and customer satisfaction."

I would assign them a rating of zero stars, if given the opportunity, in light of the atrocious treatment my wife and I received during our recent encounter with their facility. My wife sustained an anterior cruciate ligament tear on a Saturday, which led us to seek immediate medical attention at the emergency room. Subsequently, we visited her primary care physician the following business day to obtain a referral. Southwest Medical Center directed us to this establishment, and we were initially informed that there would be a four-month delay before we could secure an appointment. Following a series of protracted phone calls and unacceptable hold times, I was ultimately able to arrange an appointment for my wife, albeit three weeks subsequent to the initial injury. However, the appointment was abruptly canceled by the facility on the business day preceding the scheduled date, with the staff displaying a complete lack of empathy and effectively dismissing our concerns. Their reasoning for the cancellation was attributed to the fact that they were not contracted with the emergency room that my wife had visited, despite our insurance provider being accepted by both entities. This led them to refuse further treatment, leaving us feeling utterly frustrated and disrespected. While this review may seem unfair since my wife did not have the opportunity to interact with any of their doctors, I feel compelled to share our experiences and emphasize the deplorable manner in which we were treated by the staff. Having worked in the healthcare industry for thirteen years, I have never encountered such appalling patient care. We eventually contacted our insurance provider and located an alternative orthopedist who gladly accepted our carrier and accommodated us promptly, thereby circumventing the need to endure a similar unpleasant experience at Nevada Orthopedic and Spine Center.

"The culinary excellence of pizza consistently meets expectations, but service staff would benefit from adhering to fundamental sanitary standards, such as securing their hair, to maintain a positive ambiance reminiscent of the establishment's former glory days along Mill Avenue."

"Deplorable. Sergios' installation of sod at my domicile was accompanied by an egregious lack of a crucial tool, specifically, a roller. Moreover, the so-called 'crew' exhibited an abysmal ignorance regarding the implement's very existence. Following my telephonic communication with the office, I was assured that a subsequent team would arrive later in the day to execute the requisite rolling process. Unfortunately, this promise proved to be an empty assurance, as the anticipated personnel failed to materialize. Consequently, the task was completed in an unacceptably subpar manner. My attempts to obtain redress via message were met with utter disregard and neglect. In light of this experience, I emphatically advise seeking the services of a more scrupulous and esteemed provider."

Buddy V's was our chosen destination for a tardy luncheon, arriving at approximately 2:30 PM. Upon entering the eatery, we observed that the establishment was only partially occupied, with an abundance of vacant seating and no waiting list in effect. Our group consisted of four individuals, with two additional members expected to arrive shortly. The manager, whose demeanor could be described as somewhat unpleasant, asserted that their policy prohibited seating incomplete parties. We found this declaration to be utterly perplexing, given the copious amount of available tables. We respectfully requested to be accommodated for the purpose of ordering beverages; however, our request was met with a resounding refusal. Following a brief interval, we returned to the host stand and reiterated our query, emphasizing the seemingly absurd nature of the situation. Unfortunately, our appeal was once again met with a curt denial. Disheartened by the experience, we opted to seek alternative dining arrangements at another nearby Italian restaurant within the Venetian complex. To our satisfaction, we were promptly seated upon arrival. It is worth noting that we shall not be inclined to revisit Buddy V's in the future, due to the unfortunate encounter with the manager and the subpar quality of service we received.

"The solitary visit underpinned my unenthusiastic appraisal, thus it is advisable to consider it with a pinch of salt. I opted for the spicy basil chicken lunch special, which incorporated a choice between white or fried rice (I chose the former) and either soup or salad (I opted for the latter). The egg drop soup was merely passable, as the peas and carrots within lacked authenticity in terms of flavor. The spicy basil chicken, while registering a moderate level of heat on a scale of 1-5 (I requested a 3), was unfortunately devoid of any discernible basil essence and instead, its taste was rather unpleasant. However, a notable aspect of their beverage offerings was the palatable Thai tea. It would be inaccurate to label this establishment as Thai, as the majority of their menu items are of Chinese origin."

"Subsequently, you individuals opt to label us as deceivers; an excellent approach to conducting yourselves in a professional manner, I procured two beverages and a few cheese sticks, for which I compensated. The incompetent 'employees' are the root cause of your issues. You proffer me a sample of your frozen treat, subsequently attempt to charge me for it. Absolutely laughable."

"The precise location of 2470 W Happy Valley Rd. remains a mystery, as it appears to be situated at a considerable distance from the imposing edifice bearing the conspicuous address '2480' and positioned centrally within the city block, along the northern flank of the thoroughfare."

I will not be returning. My insurance coverage encompasses a routine examination, inclusive of dilation. Upon arriving at the facility, the attendant presented me with documentation to sign, which incorporated an agreement to substitute an electronic scan for dilation, at an additional cost of $39.00. Both the attendant and the paperwork conveyed the impression that this alternative was essentially obligatory. To decline this offer, I was compelled to complete a form and express my refusal to two separate attendants, emphasizing that I was unwilling to incur further expenses. During my consultation with the physician, she informed me that my ocular health was optimal and that I did not require the aforementioned segment of the examination, despite my previous experiences at other optometry clinics. Notably, the medical professional denied me access to my inter-pupillary distance. Following my query, the doctor claimed that the eyewear personnel prohibited her from disclosing this information. In turn, the eyewear staff asserted that the doctor refused to permit them to share this detail. After fabricating several pretexts, the doctor reluctantly divulged that they preferred to maintain secrecy regarding this measurement to prevent individuals from ordering eyewear independently online.

"Prior to the events transpiring on the aforementioned Friday, this salon held the esteemed position of being my preferred establishment for pampering and grooming purposes. However, due to the unfortunate turn of events that occurred during my most recent visit, I fear that I shall not be returning to this once beloved salon. Specifically, I requested the upgraded callous removal treatment, which I had successfully received on previous occasions, but unfortunately, the female nail technician employed an excessive amount of force, resulting in raw, scabbed toes and heels, only on my right foot. Furthermore, despite my explicit request for Tom, my preferred nail technician, he was regrettably unavailable, even upon my specific inquiry regarding his availability for my scheduled appointment. While the ambiance and staff of this salon are undoubtedly pleasant, the actions of said nail technician have irreparably tarnished my overall experience, leaving me no choice but to seek alternative establishments for my future grooming needs."

Me and my mother arrived at approximately 2 pm to partake in a late luncheon prior to collecting my son from his educational institution. We did not require an extensive duration to peruse the menu, as we were already cognizant of our culinary desires. Following a cursory examination of their menu, I requested the waitress to serve me the most piquant sushi roll available. My maternal figure opted for a straightforward Teriyaki Chicken dish from their Lunch Special Menu.

Fifteen minutes elapsed before my order was served. To my disappointment, the sushi was not nearly as fiery as I had anticipated. Nonetheless, I appreciated the fact that the slices were somewhat diminutive in size, thereby preventing me from appearing ravenous. (I couldn't help but laugh at this minor victory.) It remained unclear whether this was mere happenstance or if they were genuinely served in such a manner.

After devouring my meal, my mother's order had yet to arrive. At this juncture, she grew increasingly irate. Considering it was a late lunch and we had placed our orders with reasonable haste, awaiting food for thirty minutes proved quite vexing. My mother elected to cancel her order, and we departed without offering a gratuity. While I felt regretful, I could not rationally defend the quality of service rendered at this establishment. Given that it was 2 pm, a mere three tables were occupied, including our own, and the remaining tables accommodated merely two to four patrons each.

I do not intend to revisit this restaurant, nor would I recommend it to others. In essence, the service was deplorable.

AVOID THESE WALGREENS ON THE STRIP AT ALL COSTS!! They are merely TOURIST TRAP BUSINESSES, capitalizing on unsuspecting visitors' lack of familiarity with the area and charging exorbitant prices for even the most basic items. For instance, I entered one of these establishments and brought my Arizona Iced Tea and a pack of.99 cashews to the checkout counter, mentioning to the cashier that the iced tea was on sale that week. She inquired about my possession of a coupon, to which I responded negatively and inquired as to whether the store had a sales flyer for that week. The cashier replied in the negative, prompting me to retrieve a receipt from a previous purchase at a different location and display it to her, pointing out that I had not received a coupon at that time either, yet the store still offered a sales flyer to accommodate its patrons. The cashier proved unhelpful, leading me to request the manager's assistance. 

Upon the manager's arrival, I presented my receipt and emphasized that I had never encountered a Walgreens that failed to provide a sales flyer or refused to honor its weekly sales paper. I expressed my dissatisfaction audibly, characterizing their actions as nothing more than "tourist gouging." Following this exchange, I departed and vowed never to set foot in any of these strip stores again, opting instead to voice my grievances to Walgreens management via their customer service hotline (1800-763-0547). Heed my warning and avoid these strip stores like the plague!

Where to initiate the process of securing a reservation for a celebratory gathering of six individuals proved to be a formidable challenge, as I was curtly informed by the hostess that access to a table would not be feasible until 10:30 PM, purportedly due to the presence of multiple large groups that evening, although I conveyed our intentions to consume beverages and would not be deterred by the prospect of waiting, the hostess remained unyielding in her stance, furthermore, upon our punctual arrival, the hostess demonstrated an acrimonious demeanor and refused to accommodate our request for a table, despite the fact that several members of our party did not intend to partake in culinary indulgences, and instead, opted to await the availability of a vacant table, the manager, possessing an equally disagreeable attitude, joined the discourse, and, with a hint of incredulity, expressed reluctance to proffer a solution, ultimately, the interchange concluded with my decision to seek alternative venues for our festivities, thereby depriving the establishment of potential revenue.

Upon awakening from my brief slumber, I experienced an intense yearning for chicken enchiladas, which compelled me to persuade my significant other to accompany me on an expedition in pursuit of sustenance. Following a brief excursion, we arrived at Super Burrito, a venue unfamiliar to me, whereupon we placed an order for a carne asada burrito, a dish of beef enchiladas for my companion, and a comparable dish featuring poultry for myself, accompanied by a medium-sized container of Coca-Cola. Upon receiving our repast, we proceeded to consume it while in transit, halting briefly at various establishments at the behest of my companion. Eventually, we returned, and I began to experience sensations of disappointment and frustration upon discovering that the contents of the first takeout container did not align with my expectations, specifically, beef enchiladas. Perplexed and disconcerted, I opened the second container, only to find cheese, a development akin to ordering a hamburger and receiving merely a bun with a slice of cheese, prompting me to query the whereabouts of my principal component. Thus, I remain unsatisfied and irritated.

We were ecstatic to finally have a Cafe Rio in our vicinity, but after multiple visits, we are prepared to bid adieu to our new establishment and return to our beloved Stephanie or Eastern locations. The quality of service at this particular venue leaves much to be desired, with a frigid ambiance and subpar culinary offerings. Our encounters with the servers have been unpleasant, characterized by brusque demeanor and an air of incredulity when requesting additional pico de gallo. It is imperative that management assumes responsibility and effectuates drastic improvements to revitalize the dining experience.

"Well, it is with profound disappointment that we must recount our recent dining experience at this establishment, which, regrettably, fell short of our expectations in terms of customer service and overall satisfaction. Upon entering the premises, we were met with an enthusiastic welcome from two young hostesses, whose cheerful demeanor and warm smiles led us to believe that our visit would be a pleasant one. However, our optimism was quickly dispelled as we were left unattended for an unacceptable duration of time, despite our anticipation of prompt and attentive service. Indeed, it is no exaggeration to say that we endured an interminable wait of 18 minutes, during which not a single staff member took the initiative to approach us, offer refreshments, or even acknowledge our presence. The utter lack of regard for our time and comfort was truly disconcerting and, quite frankly, inexcusable. Suffice it to say, we departed the establishment in search of a more hospitable environment, leaving behind the same two hostesses who, in a striking display of obliviousness, bade us farewell and expressed their gratitude for our visit, seemingly impervious to the fact that their negligence had effectively nullified any chance of our return. It is worth noting that this unfortunate series of events transpired on Sunday, July 9th, 2012, at approximately 2-3 PM."

Do not order sushi from here. The rolls are 3km in diameter and the soy sauce is so salty you may dehydrate on the spot. They use chicken fried rice in their sushi  Chow mein is also questionable. Save your money and your taste buds.

I would pen a scathing review, if the opportunity presented itself. Unfortunately, I am unable to provide an assessment of the culinary offerings, as I did not partake in any edible delights during my visit. My companion and I ventured to this establishment, eager to indulge in what we had heard was an exceptional Indian dining experience, on one of the "Unblurred" Friday evenings. Upon entering, we were met with a reception that can only be described as dismissive and condescending by the concierge. He insisted that the few unoccupied tables we noticed were reserved, without offering any indication of when they might become available. Whether his behavior can be attributed to sheer rudeness or a more sinister prejudice remains unclear; however, it is evident that he was more concerned with expediting our departure than ensuring our satisfaction. It is worth noting that the racial demographics of the patrons appeared to play a role in the differential treatment we received. A majority of the clientele consisted of Caucasians, while my companion and I, both individuals of color, were subjected to discriminatory conduct. This encounter left such a sour taste that I would strongly advise against dining at any establishments along Penn Avenue, with the sole exception of the laudable Spak Brothers. In conclusion, my experience was so unpleasant that I would not bother consuming any sustenance in the vicinity, and instead choose to focus on the unsavory ambiance.

"This particular venue does not possess the qualities that would render it an ideal location for a revisit, as the staff's demeanor towards patrons exhibits a conspicuous lack of warmth and hospitality, and requests for customized nail art designs are met with incredulity and disbelief, culminating in an unsatisfactory experience; thus, it is preferable to seek alternative establishments for a novel manicure."

"It is my conviction that I must have encountered them on an exceptionally unfavorable day, as my sentiments regarding their culinary offerings can be succinctly articulated as 'YUCK,' and, furthermore, I consider their fare to be a fiscally irresponsible investment, akin to purchasing chewing gum at a highway rest stop. Indeed, the quality of their comestibles does not appear to justify the premium price point, leading me to discard approximately ninety percent of the food in question."

"My anticipation to experience the culinary offerings of this novel eatery was immense, particularly in light of my unrelenting yearning for an authentic barbecue experience. Following a meticulous perusal of their online menu, I was convinced that this establishment would satiate my gastronomical desires. However, upon arriving at the venue on a Saturday evening at approximately 8:30, I was taken aback by the stark contrast between the ambiance and the quality of the fare. Despite the extensive variety of delectable options, the actual consumption of the food proved to be underwhelming, as the texture of the ribs resembled rubber and lacked the rich flavor I had expected. Similarly, my spouse's pulled pork sandwich was devoid of any discernible taste. Considering these factors, I would not recommend this restaurant to others, as there are superior alternatives available, such as Stacy's BBQ in Phoenix and The Pitt's Again in Glendale. Nonetheless, the adjacent Sugarbowl provided a satisfying conclusion to an otherwise disappointing dining experience."

I have been an intermittent patron of this establishment for an extended period, during which time I have consistently encountered subpar service and unfriendly demeanors. Despite these unfortunate experiences, I have persisted in my attempts to procure the items I require from this store, primarily due to the scarcity of alternative needlework retailers in the Phoenix area. Most recently, I endeavored to place a special order for a canvas, which I communicated via both Facebook messenger and telephone calls. However, after a protracted two-week interval, I received a voicemail response that conveyed utter bewilderment regarding the identity of the canvas in question. It is worth noting that I have successfully ordered similar canvases from this store in the past, with prices ranging in the hundreds of dollars. Therefore, it is perplexing that such confusion could arise, particularly given the fact that I provided the complete title and artist information in my initial Facebook message. In light of this unsatisfactory exchange, I have opted to purchase the canvas from an alternate source. Furthermore, I cannot help but wonder whether this treatment stems from an inherent dislike towards me specifically, or if it is simply a result of being an outsider to their exclusive clique. As a word of caution, I would advise potential customers to exercise great care when choosing to shop at this store, especially if they do not identify as a member of the so-called "Stepford Stitchers" group.

I had arrived at this venue several years ago with the intention of attending a spoken word performance by Henry Rollins, which, I must say, was utterly captivating and thoroughly enjoyable, earning it a well-deserved perfect rating of five stars. However, the seating arrangement within the auditorium left much to be desired, as the seats were excruciatingly cramped, providing patrons with a meager amount of legroom that made it challenging for individuals of above-average height to maintain a comfortable posture. In fact, even when positioning my legs laterally, I found myself still pressed up against the adjacent row, resulting in an agonizing experience akin to being trapped in a prolonged and rigid yoga pose for the duration of three hours. It is worth mentioning that the rows of seating were situated in such proximity to one another that only my sister-in-law, who stands at a mere 5'1\", could manage to sit comfortably without enduring any discomfort. Therefore, I implore the management of Celebrity Theatre to consider augmenting the distance between rows, as even a slight increase in size would significantly enhance the overall viewing experience for patrons. Those who claim that size is irrelevant are either misinformed or deceitful.

Nancy Erdmann was very rude and insensitive. I felt rushed.  Sadly, I'm someone that's going through a tough time health wise and I'm just looking for a good doctor to listen and help me.  The search continues...

The food was good ... the service at this location is HORRIBLE. They are slow never check in with your table and take forever to bring something once you ask for it. Never coming back to this location. Going back to the one on DI their service is amazing and the atmosphere is so much nicer.

Don't do it. Just don't. You're better of with some frozen boxes out of the freezer section of the grocery store. 

Our dish was half hot, warm in the middle, and cold on the other side. The dessert was stale and bland. 

BF was BLOATED like he was in his third trimester and miserable for TWO days after. Ew.

I went here in a Saturday afternoon and I have to say it was a mistake. 

The beer was stale, soapy, and flat. The food was bad and our waitress was just slow. 

I have nothing positive to say about The Comedy Club.

"It has come to our attention that the culinary offerings at this establishment are purportedly exceptional; however, due to the unfortunate circumstances that transpired during our visit, we were unable to experience them firsthand. Despite our reservation being secured seven days prior to our planned visitation, and for a party of six individuals no less, we were regrettably subjected to a series of fallacious statements proffered by the hostess. It appears that she engaged in a systematic campaign of deception, deliberately misleading both ourselves and other patrons, as we witnessed a group of seven individuals being seated before us - ostensibly possessing a reservation themselves - while we awaited our turn in vain. Furthermore, we were informed that our table was on the verge of becoming available, allegedly due to the previous occupants having settled their bill, when in reality, no such transaction had occurred. Such conduct is not only unethical but also utterly bizarre, especially considering our extensive experience dining at various locales globally. Consequently, we elected to redirect our financial resources elsewhere."

"The quality of customer service in a subpar bakery leaves much to be desired, as evidenced by our multiple visits, with each experience yielding disappointment and disillusionment. Despite our willingness to grant them the benefit of the doubt, the bakery has consistently failed to meet expectations, with the most recent encounter involving the refusal to honor a coupon that had allegedly expired mere hours prior, rather than the stipulated time frame of thirteen hours later. Furthermore, the staff displayed an utter lack of remorse or contrition, which only serves to reinforce our decision to seek alternative establishments for our future patronage."

"This establishment purports to offer an assortment of frozen treatments beyond the conventional yogurt bar, including, but not limited to, burgers and, allegedly, waffles; however, upon entering the premises, I was immediately struck by the pervasive aroma of oil that permeated the atmosphere. As an ardent devotee of frozen delights, I am wont to sample a variety of flavors whenever I patronize such an establishment, and this particular visit was no exception. My initial foray into the realm of icy indulgences was thwarted, unfortunately, by the mango sorbet, which, upon activation of the dispensing mechanism, yielded a copious quantity of viscous fluid that failed to resemble the anticipated consistency. Furthermore, our inquiry regarding the sugar-free, 'dairy-free' vanilla variety elicited a response from the cashier that was both puzzling and disconcerting, as she averred that said product did not truly qualify as dairy-free. Ultimately, the flavors I selected proved to be underwhelming, rendering this excursion the most unpleasant yogurt bar experience I have had the misfortune of encountering thus far."

Never did I imagine that I would be composing a review for The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf. Having previously served as a supervisor for the company and having garnered experience at multiple other cafes, I tend to be rather indulgent and empathetic towards all baristas across the globe. However, my girlfriend and I were eager to acquire some coffee for the road prior to checking out of our hotel, and our expectations were not entirely met. The establishment had employed an expeditor to take orders in an effort to expedite the line, and we placed an order for a regular hazelnut iced coffee and a large Orchard Peach iced tea. Following payment, we awaited our beverages, but instead, we received two regular-sized drinks. While this was not a catastrophic occurrence, we graciously brought it to the barista's attention that we had, in fact, requested a large iced tea. Conflict resolution within a coffee shop setting is relatively straightforward; the cost of averting an argument and gratifying a patron far surpasses the cost of re-preparing their order. Nonetheless, the staff member who elected to display a defiant demeanor, insisted that we had paid for a regular drink, despite the expeditor's efforts to inform her otherwise, and then proceeded to walk away after presenting us with the incorrectly prepared tea, seems to hold a differing viewpoint. Therefore, it is imperative to thoroughly examine and verify your order upon checkout, as mistakes are unlikely to be rectified.

I have had the pleasure of frequenting this establishment on numerous occasions, and I must say that the culinary offerings and hospitality have consistently met, if not exceeded, my expectations. However, my most recent visit, which took place in the company of my spouse's colleagues, proved to be a notable exception to this rule. Upon being seated at one of the bar tables, we were greeted by a bartender named Bo, whose striking red hair was unfortunately matched by his brusque demeanor. Despite our intention to indulge in a more substantial meal, Bo insisted that we were obligated to order food, given that we had opted to occupy a table rather than a spot at the bar. Our initial reluctance to comply with this stipulation was further exacerbated by Bo's evident irritation at our decision to proceed with caution in terms of our order, as we opted to sample the fried oysters and avail ourselves of the happy hour specials on offer. As the evening progressed, Bo's behavior became increasingly erratic, vacillating between marked indifference and solicitousness, the latter manifesting itself primarily during the settlement of our bill, when a generous gratuity was proffered. Suffice it to say that while the edibles at this venue are undeniably palatable, the unfortunate interaction with Bo left a decidedly sour taste in my mouth, and I would counsel him to adopt a more convivial attitude towards patrons, lest he wishes to court further dissatisfaction and potential loss of clientele.

"The culinary offerings possessed a certain degree of palatability, however, upon partaking of the repast, I encountered an unfortunate presence within my sandwich, specifically, a human hair, which understandably engendered a profound sense of disillusionment and precluded me from completing my meal."

When my fiance dropped off ten items to be cleaned at the Gilbert location on Val Vista, he was quoted $4.25 per item. At pick up, the price had increased 20%. Not only that, a $300.00 shirt was spotted with grease. We will not be using this location again.

"My experience at this establishment during its initial stages was relatively satisfactory, specifically in regards to the musical offerings. However, upon returning a year later for my sister's bachelorette celebration, I encountered an unfortunate series of events. Following six months of meticulous planning, I opted for Tryst as the final destination for our Vegas excursion and contacted the management team a month in advance to secure a table. The manager assured me that there would be no issues and recorded my name. Interestingly, this was the first occasion wherein I arranged for a table at a bar without the requirement of a credit card, which seemed peculiar. Unfortunately, upon arriving with eight companions, we were informed at the entrance that our reservation was non-existent. Following a lengthy delay, the individual I had booked with eventually returned my call and offered an apology, which proved insufficient considering the circumstances. The consequences of their blunder were detrimental, as it not only confused eight individuals but also marred the evening for my sister, which remains distressing to contemplate. As I cannot rectify the situation, my trust in this venue has been irreparably damaged. Needless to say, I will not recommend it for future gatherings, such as my cousin's impending birthday festivities."

"To the proprietors of NYW,

I have had the privilege of visiting your esteemed establishment on a previous occasion, and while I must commend you on your valiant efforts to emulate the culinary prowess of BASHA'S illustrious bakeries, I regret to inform you that your offerings, despite their comparatively affordable pricing, fall short of the lofty standards set by your competitors.

However, it is not solely the quality of your products that leaves much to be desired, but also the deplorable state of your customer service. As I perused the Yelp reviews, I was taken aback by the numerous complaints regarding the dispiriting nature of your counter staff. It appears that the dearth of cordiality and hospitality extends beyond the confines of your eatery, as even the proprietor herself, a woman of considerable girth and advanced years, seems to exude an air of disdain towards her patrons.

In light of these findings, I feel compelled to advise against pursuing the misguided notion of masquerading as a New York-style establishment. Rather, I implore you to reconcile yourself to your shortcomings and focus on refining your craft, lest you continue to perpetuate a faux pas of gastronomic proportions.

New York? Nay! Abandon this futile charade and strive for authenticity, lest you suffer the same fate as your lackluster pizza, a dish that, much like your establishment, fails to live up to its illustrious namesake."

"Uncertainty permeated the atmosphere regarding the culinary offerings presented at this dining establishment, particularly with regard to the authenticity of the barbecue, which, as a native Texan, I would not venture to classify as such, given the conspicuous absence of a profound smoky flavor profile in the pulled pork, further accentuated by the lack of a discernible bark, suggestive of abbreviated exposure to the smoker; additionally, the unconventional nature of the so-called 'brisket,' characterized by an unfamiliar cut and an unorthodox preparation method involving immersion in a brine solution, only served to heighten skepticism; regrettably, the sluggish pace of service did little to assuage concerns, with an interval of nearly sixty minutes elapsing on a Tuesday, ostensibly due to the precooked nature of the fare, which, in theory, should have facilitated a more expedient delivery; furthermore, the server, seemingly perturbed by the obligation to attend to a mere handful of patrons on a weekday, contributed to an overall experience that fell short of expectations and ultimately dissuaded me from pursuing future visits to this purported barbecue venue."

"By virtue of the fact that a solitary celestial body of luminosity is employed as a metaphorical benchmark for assessing the quality of a culinary establishment's frozen dessert offerings, it logically follows that an absence of such stellar references would be indicative of an uninspiring dining experience; specifically, a dearth of rich, velvety smoothness characterizes the texture of the frozen treat in question, while its frigid temperature belies a lack of flavorful substance, rendering it akin to a mere frozen liquid rather than a truly satisfying gustatory indulgence. Furthermore, the purported 'bottled water' served alongside said dessert is, in reality, nothing more than a reprehensible attempt at profiteering through the guise of repackaging a freely available resource as a premium product, thereby constituting an egregious example of fiscal exploitation."

I have been an ardent patron of Home Depot for an extensive period, and this specific store is, by a considerable margin, the most unsatisfactory one I have had the misfortune of visiting throughout the country. Having recently acquired a residence in the proximate vicinity, I have had the occasion to frequent this particular establishment numerous times over the past ten months, and my experiences have been utterly disheartening. The personnel exhibit a profound lack of expertise, helpfulness, and responsiveness, which is nothing short of appalling, to put it mildly.

The perplexing sequence of events transpired subsequent to my placing an online order, which culminated in the receipt of a burnt pizza and a soggy mess, ostensibly attributable to my selection of a thin crust and vegetarian options, as conveyed by the kitchen manager, who offered a pecuniary reimbursement, albeit belatedly, following my explicit request for an apology, which was initially met with feeble excuses rather than a sincere expression of regret.

"Following an exhaustive day on campus, I opted to procure sustenance via delivery, which resulted in a total expenditure of $13 for a gyro, fries, and a soda. Although I am not typically averse to compensating for a delectable culinary experience, the fries were merely lukewarm upon arrival, while the gyro proved to be merely satisfactory. Consequently, I did not obtain the gastronomical satisfaction that I had anticipated, and thus, I do not intend to revisit this establishment in the future."

"Well, well, well, it appears that we have encountered yet another instance of unacceptable customer service, my dear. It seems that a recent visit to a local automobile dealership resulted in a rather unfortunate encounter with a certain individual by the name of David Culp. Evidently, this person, who purports to be a manager, saw fit to adopt a rather condescending and boorish demeanor towards us, thereby creating an atmosphere of acrimony and discomfort. Furthermore, it appears that this same individual saw fit to impose a rather stringent set of criteria upon us, insisting that we commit to purchasing the vehicle in question prior to even being afforded the opportunity to lay eyes on it. Needless to say, such an approach struck us as being both unreasonable and unprofessional, and we therefore felt compelled to seek alternative arrangements. Suffice it to say, we shall not be returning to this establishment in the future, and we would advise others to exercise caution when dealing with such an individual."

I am not hasty in bestowing an unfavorable critique upon an eatery, particularly those of a diminutive stature and local provenance. However, my reluctance to disparage was utterly futile in the case of this particular establishment, as the experience was thoroughly unpleasant and conspicuously marred by a multitude of shortcomings. The staff's demeanor was discourteous and taciturn, bordering on the verge of incivility, while the culinary offerings vacillated between mediocrity and outright gastronomical disappointment. Furthermore, the menu boasted an option to tailor wraps to conform to vegan preferences, which I inquired about, only to be met with a flippant and dismissive response from the server. When questioned regarding the absence of vegan alternatives, he retorted with an air of incredulity, "Fake meat? No," thereby betraying a glaring lack of comprehension and regard for dietary diversity. This interaction not only offended me, a non-vegan individual, but also underscored the restaurant's disingenuous attempt to project an image of inclusivity and accommodation, all the while openly ridiculing the very dietary preference they purported to support. In conclusion, my experience at this establishment was decidedly unsatisfactory, and I would not recommend it to anyone seeking a pleasant dining experience.

"Epitome of 'Ghetto'. 

In the event that you intend to lodge here, kindly refrain from harboring elevated expectations. It would be prudent to exercise skepticism regarding the notion that this lodging establishment purports to offer five-star accommodations; such an assertion is, put mildly, dubious. Do not anticipate the presence of a flat-screen television or the prospect of having your bed linens altered regularly! The ambiance of this establishment harkens back to a bygone era, specifically the 1970s. The dimensions of the sleeping quarters are diminutive, and this characteristic is not exclusive to the rooms themselves, as the furnishings and appointments within them are similarly Lilliputian.
