One week subsequent to the incurrence of the $25 non-refundable fee, we initiated contact via telephone and were informed that a supervisory figure would be required to reciprocate our call at their earliest convenience. Failing this, we shall be compelled to register a formal complaint with our financial institution, specifying the nature of the transaction as fraudulent in nature.

"The transient nature of existence renders the consumption of subpar culinary offerings an egregious squandering of precious time, and my recent dining experience at this establishment served as a poignant reminder of such. Upon ordering the Chicken Pot Pie, my expectations were precipitously elevated, only to be subsequently dashed by the unveiling of a dish that can best be described as an affront to gastronomic tradition. The ostensible attempt at creative interpretation was, in reality, an unmitigated assault on the senses, as a copious quantity of ingredients was haphazardly arranged on a generously proportioned plate, the sheer magnitude of which engendered an initial sense of incredulity within me. Unfortunately, this dubious delight proved to be not only visually unappealing but also utterly inedible, as the presumably well-intentioned attempt at creating a novel crust resulted in a texture akin to that of a jerky, rendering it nearly impossible to pierce with utensils. Beneath the imposing crust lay a modest layer of unremarkable mashed potatoes, upon which rested the titular filling, itself a mediocre amalgamation of uninspired ingredients that failed to justify the exorbitant price point. It is worth noting that, in retrospect, the absence of this particular dish from the culinary spotlight of televised programs should perhaps have served as a portent of its inherent deficiencies. Suffice it to say that, in a city renowned for its diverse and delectable gastronomic offerings, it would be judicious to avoid squandering valuable time and resources on such a disappointing dining experience."

Never again shall I subject myself to the dubious delights of this establishment, having had the misfortune of partaking in their purported offerings on two separate occasions, with the initial visit transpiring during a New Year's Eve celebration and the subsequent encounter occurring under the guise of socializing and engaging in recreational gambling activities. Both experiences proved to be utterly disappointing, with the first instance involving a costly bottle service arrangement totaling $500 and the second resulting in the squandering of $100 at a keno game. Furthermore, I was utterly oblivious to the fact that a convention of affluent young professionals was taking place in the vicinity, which further contributed to my overall dissatisfaction with the experience.

I habitually frequent various Starbucks establishments, and my recent visit to this particular location was utterly disappointing, as the staff exhibited an unacceptable level of sluggishness and discourteous behavior, rendering it the most unsatisfactory Starbucks experience I have had the misfortune of encountering thus far; therefore, I strongly advise avoiding this establishment at all costs, as it fails to meet even the most basic standards of customer service and satisfaction.

"Arrived in Las Vegas for commercial purposes and to participate in the annual Specialty Equipment Market Association exhibition. Our organization opted to lodge at this establishment due to its proximity to the convention center. However, our stay was marred by several issues, including:  
1. The designated non-smoking accommodations were permeated with the pungent odor of tobacco smoke, which created an unhealthy environment for those sensitive to secondhand smoke.  
2. Upon returning to our quarters following a series of meetings, we discovered that the bedding was saturated with an unknown substance, rendering it unusable. We contacted the front desk, and they expressed regret and assured us that the situation would be addressed promptly the following day.  
3. Due to the lack of assistance from hotel staff in resolving the issue, we were compelled to spend the night slumbering in a chair adjacent to our computer workstation, awaiting a resolution the next morning.  
The management of Mandalay Bay offered a paltry $50 credit, failing to provide a suitable replacement room, which left much to be desired. In light of the current economic climate, it is advisable to explore alternative four and five-star hotels in Las Vegas that offer superior customer service. Bellagio and Caesars Palace are recommended options."

"Upon discovering that my credit card information had been pilfered subsequent to purchasing a meal at this particular establishment, I decided to contact the manager in order to merely apprise her of the potential issue pertaining to their payment processing apparatus. However, she adamantly refuted any likelihood of the fraudulent transactions being connected to her store, going so far as to assert that 'None of my employees have any acquaintances in California,' despite the fact that the illicit expenditures in question originated from that very state. Her response to my call was utterly inadequate, particularly given that I did not intend to lodge a complaint, but rather merely sought to bring the matter to her attention. In light of these events, I would strongly advise prospective patrons to exercise caution when dining at this Jason's Deli, as the combination of suspected fraudulent activity and an uncooperative management team does not bode well for a positive dining experience."

The service was really bad here! Our waitress was rude and such in a rush? Really strange the restaurant was empty only one other couple sitting at the bar. I was doing the ayce, as I was ordering the waitress walked away and I wasn't even done ordering???? I would never come back here again.. It's sad really nice place but so clueless!

If I had the option to assign a negative rating, I undoubtedly would have availed myself of such an opportunity, as the deplorable quality of service we received far surpassed our expectations in terms of its sheer inadequacy. Our arrival at 7:00 p.m. on a Saturday evening, a time when most establishments are bustling with activity, proved to be an unfortunate miscalculation on our part, as it became apparent that the staff were utterly unequipped to handle the influx of patrons. Upon entering the premises, we were met with a scene of utter chaos, with four young women positioned at the forefront, seemingly engaged in a concerted effort to create an atmosphere of bedlam. Despite our prolonged presence, no attempt was made to acknowledge our presence, let alone extend a warm welcome or provide any semblance of hospitality. The sushi bar, conspicuously underutilized, beckoned to us like a siren's call, and we felt compelled to investigate further, only to be confronted by a hostile reception from a female staff member who appeared hell-bent on ensuring that we were cognizant of the fact that the bar was not designed to accommodate patrons on a first-come, first-served basis. Such an encounter left us feeling utterly disillusioned and precipitated our immediate departure, with nary a moment's hesitation. Notwithstanding the manager's profuse apologies, our reluctance to return remains steadfast and unyielding.

This reprehensible experience has left me utterly flabbergasted and my spouse and I are still reeling from the unacceptable level of incompetence displayed by the staff at this establishment. Upon entering the premises, we placed an order for a beverage, specifically a beer, as well as a hot tea, and a plate of nachos, alas, sans beans. However, approximately twenty minutes later, we were presented with the aforementioned nachos, but now adorned with beans, much to our dismay. In light of this egregious error, my spouse requested that we receive a new order of nachos, devoid of beans, from an alternative server, as our initial server had elected to take a hiatus. Unfortunately, the manager chose to intervene, and his behavior can only be described as boorish and unprofessional, as he shifted the blame onto every individual involved, save himself, naturally. Needless to say, such abysmal management practices have rendered any future visits to this establishment completely out of the question. The manager's tirade against the bartender, who had valiantly attempted to rectify the situation, only served to further solidify our decision to avoid this venue like the plague in the future.

"Subjective evaluation of the recreational area yields a mediocre rating of three stars, primarily due to the restrictive policies enforced by the local patrons, specifically pertaining to the allocation of time dedicated to wave riding, which is seemingly monopolized by self-proclaimed'regulars.' The proprietor of the adjacent surf shop exhibits discourteous behavior, further exacerbating the unpleasant experience. A shared board, used alternately by myself and a companion, was the source of contention, as the aforementioned shop owner demanded adherence to an alleged yet unwritten decree, dictating that those participating in such communal usage must relinquish their position in the queue and await their turn at the rear of the line. My protestations against this unfounded regulation were met with indifference, leaving me no choice but to endure the inconvenience. The brevity of the waves' rideable duration, combined with the excessive waiting period and monetary expenditure, renders this location unsuitable for those seeking enjoyment."

"What an utter travesty. Were it feasible, I would unquestionably assign a negative assessment to this establishment, given the egregious nature of the service I received. Following an interminable wait of nearly sixty minutes, during which time I eagerly anticipated assistance from any representative, I was ultimately compelled to endure the ignominy of being ignored by every sales associate within sight, with the exception of a solitary patron who deigned to acknowledge my presence. The exorbitant prices charged by this retailer serve only to further exacerbate my profound dissatisfaction, thereby impelling me to seek alternative vendors for my future purchases, as did several other disgruntled customers who shared my frustration and elected to depart the premises in search of more satisfactory shopping experiences."

This marks my maiden visit to this esteemed establishment, and I must admit that my expectations were not entirely met. My companions had previously partaken in the culinary offerings of this restaurant and had expressed their satisfaction, thus prompting my decision to follow suit. However, upon perusing the menu, I noticed that the quality of certain dishes left much to be desired. Specifically, the oysters, which my comrade had enthusiastically endorsed, failed to impress. In point of fact, he voiced his regret shortly after consuming the initial bite, citing a lack of freshness and an unpalatable sauce.  

My companions and I opted for the all-you-can-eat sushi selection, and while there were some redeeming qualities, the overall experience was less than satisfactory. To elaborate, the following points comprise the advantages and disadvantages of our dining excursion:  

Advantages:  

1. The option to substitute sashimi for sushi (with rice) was available.  
2. Our server exhibited exceptional friendliness and hospitality.  
3. The salmon dishes were fresh and of high quality.  
4. Reservations can be made in advance, which streamlines the process for patrons.  

Disadvantages:  

1. A significant number of orders were not fresh on the day of our visit.  
2. Our server seemed somewhat bewildered, resulting in erroneous order quantities.  
3. The seating arrangement was rather cramped, giving the impression that all patrons were sharing a single table.  
4. The menu offered fewer options compared to similar establishments.  
5. Four sea urchin sushis were ordered, yet two of them displayed a striking dark brown hue, while the remaining two were a vibrant gold. Such inconsistency in the appearance of the sea urchins only served to highlight their questionable freshness.  

In conclusion, I must state that I am unlikely to return to this restaurant in the future.

"Unfortunately, my hunger was so intense that I failed to capture a photograph of the culinary offerings! I opted for the croquetas and tamales, both of which were available for the reasonable price of $5. Additionally, I requested a side of congri, which added an additional $3 to the total cost. While the menu selections were limited, the quality of the food did not justify the modest serving sizes. Notwithstanding, the flavors were reminiscent of my mother-in-law's culinary prowess, albeit with greater finesse. As for the customer experience, my spouse inadvertently dropped his utensil, prompting the owner's wife to promptly provide him with a replacement set. The ambiance of the establishment featured several outdoor tables and chairs, suitable for al fresco dining. However, based on my underwhelming experience, I would not consider returning to this venue in the future."

Naw, I went to this club at 10:31pm on a Saturday night and there were no strippers on the dance floor! I asked the bartender when they would come out and she was like, \"I think they could be getting dressed.\" All of them??

"Tardy, discourteous, and unprofessional. That's how I would characterize the demeanor of the retail associate who attended to me during my recent visit to your establishment. Despite my fiance's premonition, I opted to accord her the privilege of the doubt, but unfortunately, she failed to acknowledge my presence; demonstrated an unwillingness to meticulously count the items I wished to purchase; and conveyed two disheartening announcements with a facial expression and tone that bespoke a flagrant lack of concern for the customer experience (CHALLENGING),\nNo, young woman, challenging for you indeed! In light of this unsatisfactory encounter, my fiance and I have resolved to take our business elsewhere in the future."

This particular venue has undergone a considerable decline in quality, prompting the need for a comprehensive retraining of the grill staff by corporate management. My personal experiences during the past three visits have been marred by the consistent serving of severely overcooked chicken, with both sides displaying an unpalatable charring that is not merely a superficial blemish but rather a deeply ingrained flaw. The staff's response to my legitimate concerns has been dismissive and disrespectful, evincing a reluctance to address the issue and even manifesting in eye-rolling and derogatory comments. The final straw came when I was advised that it was incumbent upon me to inspect the poultry prior to departure, an expectation that I deem both unreasonable and inappropriate given the eatery's responsibility to ensure the edibility and presentability of its offerings. Furthermore, the mashed potatoes served during my most recent visit were unacceptably watery, further reinforcing my decision to seek alternative dining options. While I would prefer to support this establishment, the inconsistency and mediocrity of the food compel me to explore other locations that can provide a more satisfying culinary experience.

"I have yet to partake in culinary indulgences at this establishment, however, a acquaintance of mine has recounted an unsettling tale of being expelled from the premises for the ostensible offense of communicating in Spanish. Frankly, I am incredulous that a business operating within the United States would deem such behavior conducive to a welcoming atmosphere. If the allegations are indeed substantiated, then I would strongly advise against patronizing this restaurant, unless one identifies as a separatist individual who harbors animosity towards those who do not share their linguistic preferences."

I am thoroughly disenchanted with this establishment, primarily due to the subpar quality of their customer service. The staff consistently manifests an air of haughtiness and discourtesy towards patrons, which makes for an unpleasant experience. Notwithstanding, I frequent this location solely because certain acquaintances of mine express a preference for some of their beverages. I refrain from being overly fastidious or demanding, as that would necessitate seeking alternative venues. It is highly unlikely that I will ever utter the phrase, "let's visit Tea Station!" as it fails to meet my expectations regarding hospitality. In contrast, Icy Juicy offers a vastly superior level of service.

Never again shall we revisit this establishment, for it fails to meet even the most basic standards of cleanliness and comfort. The bed linens are stained and unkempt, the windows do not open to allow for fresh air or a view, and the bathroom facilities lack the most fundamental aspect of privacy - a lock. We had the misfortune of staying at this wretched place for four interminable days, during which time the housekeeping staff did not deign to grace us with their presence even once. It is evident that the management does not prioritize the well-being of its guests, prompting one to wonder why they bother to offer AAA discounts when they cannot be bothered to ensure that the rooms are properly maintained. Needless to say, we shall not be recommending this hotel to anyone, nor shall we ever return.

"It is my considered opinion that the culinary offerings presented at this establishment do not justify the fiscal expenditure required to partake in them. Specifically, the cost of the bread, salad, vegetables, soup, prawns, baked potato, and steak, when taken in aggregate, seems exorbitant in relation to the perceived quality of the items themselves. Furthermore, the utilization of table salt and table pepper, rather than sea salt and freshly cracked black pepper, struck me as incongruous with the restaurant's purported commitment to serving high-quality meat. While the selection of beverages was adequate, it did not strike me as particularly exceptional or unique, especially given the prevalence of similar options at alternative dining establishments. Overall, I must confess that I find it challenging to comprehend the appeal of this venue, particularly in light of its reputation as a quintessential Midwestern supper club experience. Perhaps my urban upbringing and predilection for more sophisticated culinary experiences have rendered me insensible to the charms of this type of dining environment."

"Garcia's procures a solitary celestial body due to the singular individual who relished the culinary experience at the table. Despite its alleged gluten-free menu, which I can practically recite from memory given its brevity, Garcia's does not particularly cater to gluten-intolerant patrons. The menu consists of Chicken Gasedo (a soup bowl containing shredded poultry that one of my dining companions referred to as 'chicken slop'), Beef Machaco (akin to the chicken dish, albeit with beef), an assortment of vegetables, salsa, black beans or charro beans, and a house salad dressed with vinegar and oil. For the sum of $9.99, I received a bowl of the aforementioned chicken slop and a cup of black beans. Upon perusing the bill, I noticed that I was not charged separately for each item; thus, I am uncertain whether the waiter neglected to include these items on the bill or if there was some other explanation for the discrepancy. In conclusion, a word of advice for Garcia's: consider adding corn tortillas to your offerings, and perhaps maintain a stash of tostitos in the kitchen for good measure."

When engaging in a deliberation regarding the quality of Mexican cuisine, specifically pertaining to whether it constitutes the nadir of culinary experiences, it serves as an illustration of the nature of the encounter. On the fifth of May, we opted to partake in a dining experience at this establishment, precipitated by a sense of urgency due to concurrent commitments. Our expectation was to expediently secure a table in the bar area, consume sustenance and potables, and subsequently depart. However, the gastronomical offerings proved to be utterly disappointing, lacking in both flavor and creativity. The ambiance was further marred by the presence of overzealous security personnel, whose age and inexperience only served to exacerbate their questionable effectiveness. In light of these factors, it is unlikely that we shall return to this venue in the future.

Upon perambulating past this edifice on multiple occasions, my curiosity was piqued, compelling me to enter and solicit a copy of their bill of fare. Alas, my request was met with a dismissive wave of the hand, the staff exhibiting a lack of helpfulness that bordered on the uncivil. The interior of the establishment, devoid of any other patrons save for my person, seemed to echo with emptiness. Notwithstanding this, a member of the security personnel entered, and to my chagrin, they proffered him a complimentary sample, while I, in stark contrast, remained ignored. My desire for a steaming bowl of soup went unfulfilled, as the staff demonstrated an unyielding indifference towards my presence. Ultimately, I departed, feeling exasperated and disheartened by the experience, sans nourishment or refreshment.

"The culinary experience at Man Pho was subpar on the previous day. Although I am reluctant to criticize establishments owned by my ethnic group, it is imperative that they elevate their standards. The noodles had an unpleasant texture reminiscent of instant pho purchased from Lee Lee's supermarket, and were excessively soggy. I recall the'special combination' dish being more flavorful during my previous visit. Unfortunately, the addition of a fatty component to the dish resulted in an unpalatable taste. In light of this disappointing experience, I shall refrain from patronizing the establishment until I peruse favorable reviews."

"My recent dining experience at this establishment was utterly deplorable, particularly during my friend's birthday celebration. The service we received was reprehensible, with our server exhibiting an unprecedented level of incivility. Throughout the evening, numerous instances of rudeness transpired, including a notable occurrence where my order was botched. Upon inquiring about the absence of cheese in my cheese fries, the waitress responded with an air of indignation, curtly remarking that she would attend to my friend's appetizer first, as if it were a burdensome task. She then proceeded to deliver my companion's meal, only to abruptly turn her attention to me, snappily admonishing me to communicate my cheese preference in the future. The collective response from our party was one of utter disbelief. In all my years of dining out, I have yet to encounter such an unpleasant and distasteful encounter. Therefore, I strongly advise potential patrons to exercise caution and consider alternative dining options."

I placed an order for sixty balloons approximately one month prior to my daughter's bridal shower. Subsequently, two days preceding the event, I contacted the establishment to reaffirm my order. The designated time for collection was set at 10 am. However, upon arriving at the specified time of 10:15 am, it was observed that the staff members were only initiating the process of inflating the balloons. Consequently, we were forced to endure a delay of approximately twenty minutes. Considering the fact that I possessed perishable items within my vehicle and numerous tasks remained to be completed in preparation for the impending celebration, my level of frustration was understandably elevated. Moreover, the personnel did not extend any semblance of regret or compensatory gestures to mitigate the inconvenience. In conclusion, the overall quality of service encountered was deplorable.

"The culinary offerings at this establishment were utterly disappointing. Specifically, the ceviche we sampled possessed an unpleasant flavor profile, closely resembling ketchup with irregular chunks of unidentifiable origin. Furthermore, my shrimp dish was preparated excessively, resulting in an unpalatable texture. My spouse's hamburger, ordered medium, was instead served well-done, rendering it inedible. Our companion's chicken lettuce wraps suffered from an acute lack of moisture, leading to an unfortunate dining experience. Notwithstanding the uninviting ambiance, the outdoor seating area, had it been climate-controlled, may have offered a modicum of respite. However, we were constrained to dine indoors, where the decor and atmosphere were utterly forgettable and reminiscent of countless other generic restaurants across the country. The beverage selection proved unremarkable, while our server's performance was adequate, yet ultimately futile in salvaging our meal. In conclusion, we shall never return to this eatery, nor would we recommend it to anyone."

It is thoroughly unfortunate that it is not feasible to post a rating of zero stars, for it would accurately reflect the subpar quality of service provided by 777 Towing. Do not squander your time and resources by engaging with this particular company, as it is abundantly evident that their modus operandi revolves around woefully inadequate communication and an apparent lack of concern for the well-being of their clientele. Should your insurance provider inform you that 777 Towing will be dispatched to assist you, it is advisable to request an alternative service provider, as the former's proficiency in fulfilling their obligations leaves much to be desired.

Given the fact that the estimated time of arrival for 777 Towing's services was repeatedly pushed back by increments of 30-35 minutes, culminating in an indefinite delay due to an alleged breakdown of their vehicle, it becomes glaringly obvious that reliability is not a trait that this enterprise holds in high regard. Moreover, the absence of forthright communication regarding the aforementioned mechanical issue serves as a testament to the company's propensity for obfuscation and dearth of transparency.

In stark contrast, the efficiency and dependability displayed by the alternate towing company contracted by your insurance provider exemplifies the hallmarks of a reputable and customer-centric organization, arriving punctually as promised and mitigating the perilous circumstances posed by the stranded vehicle. It is imperative to exercise caution and prudence when selecting a towing service, lest you fall prey to the ineptitude and unprofessionalism that 777 Towing has demonstrated.

"The customer service experience at this establishment is utterly abysmal! It's a futile endeavor to place an order in advance, as there's no guarantee that it will be fulfilled, or that any record of it will exist. Despite my fondness for the culinary offerings here, I shall not return due to the recurring ineptitude displayed by the staff. Two instances of subpar service are sufficient to deter me from patronizing this business further."

"Indubitably, the coffee was of superior quality, however, the demeanor of the barista was discourteous and irascible, despite my concerted efforts to engage in amicable conversation. Moreover, the establishment's restroom facilities were found wanting, specifically, there was an absence of toilet tissue, and a makeshift sign indicated that alternative lavatory amenities were available at a nearby location. It is unfortunate that I must convey a less than favorable assessment, given the exceptional quality of their coffee, yet the overall encounter was marred by an unsatisfactory experience."

Firstly, the pungent and potent fragrance permeates the entire establishment, assaulting one's olfactory senses with an unrelenting intensity, analogous to a massive brick wall, upon every ingress and egress.

 Secondly, the accommodations themselves appear tired, worn, and neglected, with visible signs of deterioration and disrepair, much like a once-majestic edifice that has succumbed to the ravages of time and neglect.

 Thirdly, a conspicuous patch of noxious, dark mold measuring approximately three feet by three feet was discovered on the bed linens, prompting an urgent request for a room change, which, unfortunately, was met with a tardy and inadequate response from the housekeeping staff, leaving us exhausted and eager for slumber yet forced to endure further inconvenience. (Pertinent photographic evidence was documented.)

 Fourthly, the supposedly refreshed quarters were found to contain an unsettling amount of masculine facial hair scattered throughout the bathroom, including a magnetized mirror detached from its rightful place on the wall, which this writer had the misfortune of touching prior to recognizing its unsanitary nature. Additionally, newly discovered holes in the fresh bedding, resembling rodent gnaw marks, necessitated another room change. (Grotesque visual evidence is available.)

 Lastly, a relocation to a room boasting a "view" proved futile, as the windows were caked with dirt and grime, rendering any potential scenery indiscernible. (Although seemingly absurd, this assertion holds veracity.)

 In conclusion, given the aforementioned litany of deplorable conditions, it is this author's conviction that the establishment in question will ultimately cease operations, and thus, it is crucial to alert others to these deficiencies.

"It is my ardent desire to confer upon them a solitary star, for our experience was utterly reprehensible. A sizable order was delivered to us, and upon inspection, one of the young ladies discovered an unwelcome guest in her cuisine. It was not a minuscule creature, but rather a substantial, loathsome roach. This sight was sufficient to preclude anyone from partaking of their meal. It is axiomatic that the presence of a single roach implies a far greater infestation. When we brought this to their attention, they offered a feeble solution, proffering a replacement order, while dismissing our request for a refund. Following a protracted disagreement, they ultimately relented, retrieving their tainted fare and reimbursing us. I assure you, dear reader, that we shall never again darken their doorstep."

"Wow, it seems that purchasing an item at this establishment comes with a complimentary dosage of aggressive persuasion, for if one does not express an interest in additional merchandise, they will undoubtedly encounter a barrage of insistent entreaties from the sales staff. My companion and I were taken aback by the sudden metamorphosis of the demeanor of the sales representative upon our declining of supplementary accessories and extended warranties. The individual who purported to hold the title of'sales manager,' despite appearing youthful and inexperienced, made a concerted effort to coerce us into acquiring further items. Our visit culminated in our departure without any purchases, and we were left with an unsettling impression of the commercial practices employed by this enterprise."

"Gate C presents an unfortunate predicament for travelers, characterized by sluggish service and a seemingly apathetic attitude on the part of TSA agents towards passengers with disabilities or medical emergencies. The combination of these factors results in an excruciating experience that elevates the concept of 'Hurry Up and Wait' to an unprecedented level. It is not uncommon for individuals to still be navigating the X-ray portion of security one hour later, eliciting sympathy from even first-class passengers who have paid a premium for expedited processing but find themselves mired in the same protracted delay. A comprehensive reassessment of the airport's security protocols appears imperative to address this issue."

We, a sextet, halted our vehicular conveyance subsequent to my progeny's academic commencement, opting to partake of an early evening repast within the confines of this establishment. Prior to our arrival, we had procured an iced tea from a nearby coffeehouse, which we foolishly presumed would be permissible to bring with us. However, upon our entrance, the barkeep hastily informed us that such was not the case, and that we would be unable to enter the premises with said beverage. I, in my capacity as spokesperson for our group, solicited an audience with the manager, who, in a manner bordering on insolence, averred that his subordinate had spoken the truth. Disgruntled and disillusioned, we vacated the premises, traversing the parking area to a rival eatery, where we expended one hundred twenty-five dollars on a dinner and beverages of superior quality, accompanied by exemplary service. It is with unwavering conviction that I avow my intention never to return to this establishment, and to dissuade others from doing so as well.

The text is: "We (party of 6) stopped in after my son's graduation for an early dinner.  Just before we stopped at Starbucks for an iced tea.  My mother still had her iced tea when we walked in and the bartender immediately said that we could not come in with the iced tea.  I asked to speak with his manager and he said \"he will tell you the same thing\".  We walked out and went across the parking lot to NYPD and spent $125 on dinner & drinks and had great service.  I will NEVER come back to this place.  *** Update *** Following is a message sent to me from what was obviously an employee of APC:\n\nWell not to be rude but it is against the liquor laws to have outside food or beverages In a restaurant and I know first hand there is a sign outside the door there that states it. So if you get mad at a restaurant for following the rules then you are not a customer that restaurants want.  Tara S\n\n* Just another reason to never go back and to make sure I tell all my friends and family about the experience."

The modified text is:

We, a sextet, halted our vehicular conveyance subsequent to my progeny's academic commencement, opting to partake of an early evening repast within the confines of this establishment. Prior to our arrival, we had procured an iced tea from a nearby coffeehouse, which we foolishly presumed would be permissible to bring with us. However, upon our entrance, the barkeep hastily informed us that such was not the case, and that we would be unable to enter the premises with said beverage. I, in my capacity as spokesperson for our group, solicited an audience with the manager, who, in a manner bordering on insolence, averred that his subordinate had spoken the truth. Disgruntled and disillusioned, we vacated the premises, traversing the parking area to a rival eatery, where we expended one hundred twenty-five dollars on a dinner and beverages of superior quality, accompanied by exemplary service. It is with unwavering conviction that I avow my intention never to return to this establishment, and to dissuade others from doing so as well.

An employee of APC, seemingly perturbed by our experience, conveyed a message to me, stating that the presence of external victuals and potables within a restaurant is, in fact, a violation of liquor laws, and that a sign to this effect is prominently displayed at the entrance. Therefore, any umbrage taken at a restaurant for adhering to such regulations is, ostensibly, unwarranted, and patrons who exhibit such behavior are unlikely to be welcomed by establishments of this nature.

The WORST sushi in my life. Too undercooked sushi rice (like long-stored bad grain), not fresh,smelly and dry fish (low quality). \nWhat should I say more? In my dinner menu, wine was only thing I could eat.

"FILET MIGNON NOT AS ADVERTISED

We placed an order for the filet mignon accompanied by chicken hibachi.  Upon its arrival, we discovered that the filet was overcooked, rendering it tough and chewy, leading us to suspect that a lesser quality cut of beef, perhaps a chuck roast, was used in place of the filet.  This instance of false advertising is not only unethical but potentially illegal.  It is imperative that establishments adhere to truthful representation in their menu offerings to avoid deceiving patrons and compromising their dining experience. 

The fried rice served alongside the filet was merely adequate, and we were not given the option to choose between steamed rice or noodles, which is customarily presented in other hibachi restaurants we have visited.  A combination of both fried and steamed rice or noodles would have enhanced the overall quality of the dish. 

Furthermore, the miso soup was excessively salty and lacked clarity in its presentation, thereby diminishing its flavor profile.  The salad, composed solely of head lettuce and waterlogged at the bottom of the bowl, failed to impress and left much to be desired. 

Additionally, we ordered sushi, consisting of cooked ingredients, which was merely satisfactory and did not surpass our expectations. 

Our server's performance was subpar, necessitating requests for hot tea refills, and the entire meal consumed nearly an hour and a half, costing $75.00 including gratuity.  Considering the expense, time, and inconvenience involved, the dining experience fell short of our expectations and failed to justify the cost."

I have been frequenting this golf course for over a decade and a half, and my experiences have been inconsistent, to say the least, regarding the state of the course. It's a small, family-owned establishment that offers an enjoyable nine-hole round, but the maintenance can be unpredictable. They've recently renovated the clubhouse, which is a welcome improvement. I've been visiting the course weekly since last October with my father, but I'm afraid that streak has come to an end. The service at the restaurant has been subpar, to put it mildly. It's a gamble whether you'll receive prompt and attentive service, especially during the late afternoons when I've visited with neighbors. My father and I attended the Valentine's Day dinner and found it satisfactory, so we opted to return for Easter Brunch. Unfortunately, that decision proved to be a mistake. Upon arriving at noon, we discovered that most of the food, including fruits and desserts, had already been depleted. The menu offered only three scrambled egg dishes, a salad, ham, turkey, and a few other items that didn't constitute a substantial brunch. The service was also lacking, despite there being sufficient staff. They included a 20% gratuity, and the total bill amounted to $88. Needless to say, I won't be returning to this establishment, even though I reside in the neighboring area. I've given them multiple opportunities to improve and voiced my concerns, but it seems they're unable to address the issues effectively.

I saw their TV commercial for sirloin steak and all you can eat shrimp so I had to check it out. When I got there, at lunch time, it was so dark that I couldn't even read the menu. When the waitress came over and asked me if she could bring me anything I said Yes, a flashlight. I tried moving to several different tables where there was enough light to see the menu and finally gave up and left.

"Utter disappointment permeated the atmosphere as my companion and I entered this establishment, primarily due to my previous positive experiences at Garfunkels restaurants in London. Despite reading unfavorable reviews on Yelp, I remained optimistic and coerced my companion into dining with me. However, our expectations were quickly shattered upon perusing the menu, which lacked variety and offered limited options. I reluctantly settled for the BBQ Chicken Melt, while my companion opted for the Chicken Carbonara, accompanied by an order of Garlic Bread as a starter. Although the garlic bread was satisfactory, our main courses took an unacceptable amount of time to arrive, and when they finally did, my chicken was undercooked and pink in the middle. Unwittingly, I consumed several fries and half a chicken fillet before realizing the meat was raw. Disillusioned and disgusted, we decided against ordering dessert. The quality of service was substandard, and the prices charged for the meager portions were exorbitant. Upon receiving our bill, we suspected an error in calculation. Furthermore, the ambiance of the seating area was pleasant, but the state of the restrooms was deplorable, with visible signs of mold or other organic growth on the ceiling. My high hopes for a satisfying dining experience were utterly crushed, leaving me feeling utterly deflated and unlikely to return."

Only conferring a solitary star in light of the cost, $60 for a hotel room in Phoenix remains an absolute bargain, yet this does not imply that the business is obligated to revel in such a state of affairs. Commencing with an array of cigarette burns adorning the bedspread, the morning hours of 8 am were disrupted by boisterous housekeeping staff engaging in vociferous banter outside our room, which proved to be an inauspicious initiation to the day. Furthermore, upon requesting an additional pillow, my better half was met with an incredulous response, specifically, "oh, those are on backorder," a statement that strains credibility, given the relatively scant number of occupied rooms. In light of these factors, it is emphatically recommended that prospective patrons seek accommodations elsewhere, as the combination of economic prices and subpar administration renders a pleasant sojourn in an otherwise magnificent metropolis untenable.

First time patronage dissatisfaction. Previous visitation experience anticlimax. Lack of familiarity with beverage selection evident among serving staff. Specifically, absence of knowledge pertaining to import draft beers such as Samuel Adams and Goose Island. Inquiry regarding staff training and competence elicited indifferent response. Culinary offerings underwhelming, particularly in regards to buffalo wings and steak Philly. Inadequate saucing and questionable meat quality in wings. Steak Philly presented with minuscule amount of cheese and unpalatable ground meat. Chicken salad sandwich, though voluminous, lacked flavorful seasoning. Onion rings displayed an unyielding texture akin to that of a brick. Perplexity regarding the difficulty in preparing said item from scratch, given the establishment's extensive tenure within the industry. Managerial presence and attentiveness inconsistent, as demonstrated by the neglect of numerous tables, including our own, while devoting substantial time to a singular patron. Intention to revisit unlikely.

Took a chance and stopped at this Barros my original place is on thunderbird I regret it!! Cashier was rude asf once you get that nasty attitude walking in and having them take your order in a rude matter you can't enjoy your stay there and can't help NOT coming back to this location. (No name tag on the cashier)

"Abysmal experience with my nail service! Avoid this establishment at all costs! Not only did they apply an excessive amount of polish, resulting in an unsightly smudge, but their attempt to rectify the issue by adding multiple layers of polish proved futile, ultimately leading to an unacceptable outcome."

This establishment can be characterized as an unpleasant and undesirable location, with an exorbitant tariff of $180 per night, which is patently disproportionate to the subpar quality of the accommodations provided. Moreover, we were relegated to a remote and isolated area of the premises, necessitating a trek through a passageway that we have dubbed "Chicken Shit Alley." Our sleeping quarters consisted of two beds with rough, abrasive linens akin to sandpaper, and a toilet devoid of a rear component, reminiscent of those found in public restrooms. Furthermore, the shower facility was non-functional due to a lack of proper drainage, rendering it unusable. We requested a cot upon arrival, but it failed to materialize, adding to the overall unsatisfactory nature of our stay. In conclusion, this hotel experience was utterly disappointing and woefully inadequate.

We procured a juvenile canine of the French Bulldog breed from this establishment two solar cycles ago, and today, I transported him to his complimentary veterinary examination. Unfortunately, he has contracted an upper respiratory infection and has presented with hematochezia, both of which have manifested since his transfer to our domicile. The gratis veterinary professional is located at a considerable distance from my residence, and I harbor concerns regarding the veracity of the fecal analysis results provided by said facility; thus, I shall convey the canine to my veterinarian of choice, who resides in close proximity to my abode. The medical doctor at Black Mountain Animal Hospital cautioned me that such an action might lead to the nullification of my health guarantee. 
 Our puppy was acquired at a steep price, but I felt compelled to liberate him from his confines. The sales representative who assisted us exhibited a courteous demeanor, yet I could not help but notice that her colleagues within the store seemed primarily focused on achieving sales targets. Moreover, this establishment does not mandate the completion of an adoption application, which I find unsettling. I am under the impression that the sale of diseased puppies is prohibited in Nevada.

Tried to order from claim jumper tonight and wow am I disappointed. Usually I really enjoy eating here at least once a week. Tonight I placed my order and 3 min later I get a call that they are out of steaks and out of sweet potatoes. I know this is not a major issue but to me if you are a landrys affiliated establishment this is unacceptable. \nI WILL not be ordering from claim jumpers for a long time now.

"1 star, an abysmal rating that barely suffices to convey our utter disappointment and frustration with this establishment, and yet, we find ourselves reluctantly returning, time and time again, in search of a marginally tolerable dining experience, only to be met with an unmitigated disaster, courtesy of the appalling customer service that seems to be the hallmark of this eatery. The ambiance, while somewhat pleasant, is futile in mitigating the egregious shortcomings of the staff, who appear to be either oblivious or entirely indifferent to the basic tenets of hospitality and customer satisfaction. A culinary gem, hidden amidst the rubble of incompetence and neglect, the food, alas, proves to be the sole redeeming quality of this woeful excuse for a restaurant, but even that is frequently marred by the haphazard manner in which it is delivered to our table, as if an afterthought, by servers who seem to view their duties with a studied indifference, leaving us to ponder the possibility of a better dining alternative, somewhere, anywhere, in the vicinity."

"The individual responsible for facilitating the provision of sustenance and hydration at the establishment in question exhibited a remarkable lack of attentiveness towards our table, as she failed to make any subsequent appearances following the initial delivery of potable liquid, despite the fact that the venue was not at capacity and her presence was not required at other tables. After a twenty-minute interval had elapsed, we elected to vacate the premises, and during our departure, we apprised the manager of the circumstances precipitating our decision, to which he responded with an utterance that conveyed a sense of indifference, wishing us a pleasant evening before we departed the establishment, thereby concluding an unsatisfactory dining experience that precludes any future visits."

Last night, we had the misfortune of dining at Burgr, an establishment that, unfortunately, failed to meet our expectations in terms of both service and culinary quality. Despite arriving relatively late in the evening, it took an unacceptable 20 minutes to secure a table, which we believed was not an encouraging start to our dining experience. Furthermore, the prolonged delay in receiving our orders only exacerbated our frustration, as it took an additional 15-20 minutes for our shake and dinner to arrive. Notably, my companion's salad resembled an unappetizing heap of overcooked noodles, which, regrettably, lived up to its appearance in terms of taste. In contrast, my burger was merely average, lacking any remarkable qualities worthy of mention. Moreover, the fries we shared were undercooked and excessively seasoned, further contributing to our disappointment. To make matters worse, the staff seemed unconcerned about our experience, as evidenced by their poor attention to detail regarding water refills. Following a discussion with the manager, Benjamin, we were left feeling perplexed by his seemingly dismissive response, which appeared to imply that our negative experience was somehow attributable to our local status. Ultimately, based on our underwhelming encounter, we strongly advise potential patrons to exercise caution and explore alternative dining options in Las Vegas, as there are numerous superior burger establishments available.

"Ambiance: Unremarkable, The proprietor is Afghan and his spouse (?) is Turkish
Gastronomy: Hmmm, as this marked my maiden encounter with Afghan cuisine, I was uncertain about the veracity of the culinary offerings. My assessment is as follows: Aush (beef yogurt soup infused with mint, garlic, et al.) - A tad too acidic for my palate, yet otherwise sublime (I am also assuming less piquant than the customary rendition). Aubergines (or eggplant) - Once again, excessively tart for my liking, and inferior to its Indian counterpart (which features a more judicious caramelization of ingredients). Afghani naan - Appeared homemade, but lacked tenderness and possessed an unpleasant chewiness, thereby conforming to the traditional naan formula. Turkish coffee - Rich and flavorsome

Hospitality: Commendable and quite helpful, despite their evident wariness towards the multitude of queries I posed

Second Attempt: A resounding disappointment. Entered the establishment for the luncheon buffet, harboring hopes of savoring delectable fare, given their extensive selection. Alas, each dish was prepared haphazardly. Their lamb soup, augmented with lentils, had spoiled (and would subsequently cause me to experience this meal multiple times throughout the day). The sole item that I found moderately appetizing was their kebab, which had become toughened (I surmise that they had left it exposed for an extended period, even though the time was merely 12:45 pm)."

I am no longer able to partake in this culinary experience, as the atmosphere has become excessively active and frenetic, rendering the pace of service inadequate relative to the high volume of clientele. Furthermore, the behavior of certain patrons has been observed to be discourteous and disrespectful, which only exacerbates the negative nature of my dining experience.

"It is utterly reprehensible that you would have the audacity to impede my progress with such flagrant disregard for my personal space, particularly when I am attempting to navigate through a crowded area. Furthermore, it is absolutely unacceptable that you would resort to using offensive language in response to my understandable frustration at being obstructed by your senile cohorts. In light of these circumstances, I have elected to adopt an alternative route, temporarily diverging from my initial course in order to circumvent the impediment presented by your geriatric entourage and their cumbersome mobility aids. It bears mentioning, however, that my decision to patronize this establishment was motivated solely by the availability of complimentary parking, as I have never been inclined to engage in financial transactions with the slot machines located within. Incidentally, I did visit Cafe Cortez, where I was disappointed to discover that the fare offered was not commensurate with the exorbitant prices charged. Finally, I must caution against attiring oneself in formalwear when visiting this venue, lest one desires to attract unwanted attention from unsavory characters peddling their wares or soliciting donations outside the entrance."

"My sentiments regarding the necessity of visiting this establishment for the procurement of my packages are ones of utter disdain, as this particular post office has proven itself to be the most sluggish and inefficient, with the sole exception being the downtown location, which is similarly plagued by an unfortunate dearth of expediency."

"The entire experience was utterly deplorable! Following our prolonged awaiting period to receive our beverages, which lasted approximately fifteen minutes, we were subjected to an array of personnel, including the dishwasher, culinary expert, servers, and manager, all endeavoring to acquire our orders. Upon the eventual arrival of our cuisine, some thirty minutes later, one of our dishes was incorrectly prepared, while the other was severely charred. Furthermore, the adjacent table encountered identical difficulties. To further exacerbate the situation, upon presenting payment, they lacked sufficient funds, prompting the server to request that I provide change for a dollar. Upon my negative response, the unfortunate waitress was compelled to utilize her own gratuities to furnish change to the patrons, concluding an already unsatisfactory encounter. I shall never again patronize this establishment."

"Utterly egregious and reprehensible. I submitted three articles of clothing for laundering, and was met with an exorbitant fee of nineteen dollars and forty-seven cents. Needless to say, I shall never return to this establishment again, and I can only attribute my oversight to my negligence in not perusing Yelp prior to visiting said business."

Firstly, allow me to express my appreciation towards my primary care provider, Susan Schuder, who has thus far demonstrated a commendable level of concern and trustworthiness. However, my satisfaction with her services terminates at this juncture. During my recent visit to her office, I experienced considerable discomfort, swelling, and grinding sensations in my wrist, prompting her to provide me with a brace and arrange for X-rays to be taken. Additionally, she assured me that a referral letter would be dispatched to Steinberg Diagnostics without delay, as an MRI scan was imperative. Furthermore, she instructed me to contact her office the following day to schedule an appointment for the aforementioned imaging procedure. Unfortunately, I encountered numerous difficulties while attempting to secure said appointment, as the referral letter had yet to be processed. This resulted in a series of telephone conversations with both Steinberg Diagnostics and SMA, during which I was informed that the processing time for such referrals typically ranges from five to seven days. Now, while I acknowledge that delays can occur, I cannot help but feel frustrated by the condescending demeanor exhibited by the SMA representative I spoke with at 10 a.m. Their response, which included an unnecessary clarification of Susan Schuder's professional title, struck me as dismissive and unhelpful. In conclusion, I believe that a more efficient system for handling referrals and appointments would greatly benefit patients like myself, and I hope that measures will be taken to address these issues in the future.

"An utterly unremarkable morning repast, characterized by an uninspired selection of culinary offerings, left much to be desired in terms of both temperature and taste. Specifically, the chilaquiles, which were regrettably tepid, prompted my decision to opt for an alternative dish comprising biscuits and gravy. Unfortunately, these components proved to be woefully inadequate in terms of moisture and flavor, with the biscuits being particularly arid and the gravy lacking any discernible depth or richness. Moreover, a cursory examination of the breakfast menu revealed a dearth of innovative options, leading me to conclude that a return visit would be unlikely in the near future."

It was my culpability that I perused the critiques, as it served as the impetus for our decision to select an alternative lodging venue, despite our initial desire to stay at this establishment upon its inauguration. The era of colossal themed casinos is experiencing a decline, and the Excalibur's strategic location presents an opportunity for the development of a novel gaming establishment.

The pungent odor that permeates the interior of the casino was jarring and made it challenging for us to engage in prolonged gaming sessions. Moreover, the timeshare and complimentary entertainment sales representatives were overly aggressive and discourteous, with one Asian woman exemplifying the utmost level of annoyance.

Despite these drawbacks, our stay in Tower II was uneventful, with a clean and well-maintained room that did not exhibit the same unpleasant fragrance as the casino. However, our experience has led us to conclude that we shall not be inclined to patronize the Excalibur in the future, nor shall we bother to traverse its premises, given the abundance of more affordable and desirable options available to us.

"I have an uncomplicated request that does not involve the inclusion of tomatoes, not due to any personal aversion towards them, but rather because their consumption could potentially pose a lethal threat to my well-being. In order to ensure the avoidance of any potential health hazards, it is imperative that clean utensils, a sanitized cutting board, or at the very least, a clean sheet of paper be employed during the preparation process. Furthermore, I would like to request that the onions be obtained from the rear storage area, rather than the front tray where your fingers, which have previously come into contact with tomatoes, may have contaminated the vegetables. It is essential that you adhere to my instructions meticulously and refrain from expediting the process at the expense of my safety. A momentary delay in the execution of your duties could potentially prevent a life-threatening situation, whereas a hasty approach could result in catastrophic consequences. It took three attempts to fulfill my request successfully, with the initial two attempts resulting in the inclusion of tomato seeds, which could have had fatal consequences. Would it not have been more judicious for you to heed my warnings and adopt a more measured approach in order to ensure that your team comprehended the gravity of the situation and executed my requests accordingly?"

"How exasperating! I had aspired to compile a comprehensive baby registry, but alas, my efforts were thwarted by an inadequate kiosk experience. Following the creation of a unique password, I was dismayed to discover that it did not conform to the prescribed format, thus necessitating assistance from a store representative. However, their response was less than helpful, as they maintained that no solution could be provided on-site and instead directed me to contact a distant hotline. Perplexed and frustrated, I couldn't fathom why I had even bothered visiting the store in the first place."

"Upon conveying my automotive conveyance to the establishment for repair, I was informed that the problem I had articulated was not, in fact, the actual concern, and that a more comprehensive disassembly of the transmission would be necessary, incurring a cost approximating $1000. It is rather amusing how the presence of engine oil emanating from the rear main seal can bear a resemblance to fresh transmission fluid; however, this was not the case. The justification provided by the mechanic for this diagnosis was based on an uncontaminated zone adjacent to the transmission pan, despite the fact that the leak was located farther up on the opposite side of the engine. While their proficiency may be adequate, it is certainly advisable to seek a second opinion, as they appear to capitalize on individuals who possess limited knowledge in this regard. Ultimately, my familiarity with the predicament and its associated costs, coupled with my awareness of the requisite repairs for my specific vehicle, enabled me to recognize the attempt to exploit me financially (either due to a lack of thorough troubleshooting, expertise, or a deliberate attempt to take advantage of my presumed ignorance)."

I recently endured the most unpleasant episode of my existence. I have been a member for six months, yet this was my maiden visit. I was led to believe that I could bring an acquaintance along, hence I brought my companion... he was the individual who inspired me to attend.  Upon arriving at the reception desk, I was informed that my associate could not gain admittance. Brandon, the manager, displayed a discourteous and condescending demeanor towards me. I requested the opportunity to converse with his superior; however, Pat, another manager, declined to communicate with me. This exchange consumed approximately five minutes, at which point the police arrived and instructed us to vacate the premises. Brandon failed to request my departure; instead, he summoned the authorities and had them order us to leave. I have never had the police summoned on me. Officer Stranger subsequently obtained my personal information and treated me as if I were a criminal, ultimately escorting me and my companion out of the building. If Brandon had merely asked me to leave, I would have complied. In light of this incident, I intend to terminate my membership and pray that I never encounter such a distressing situation again. The establishment demonstrated a complete lack of customer service and seemed indifferent to my concerns.

First and foremost, it is an unmitigated disaster that in a metropolitan area of this magnitude, there are no taxicabs readily available on the thoroughfares. Particularly in one of the primary nightlife districts, during the hours of 2-3 am when establishments are closing their doors, the absence of taxis cruising the streets is nothing short of a calamity. It is utterly reprehensible that in a city of this size, with a population density of this magnitude, there are no cabs accessible on the streets. Is it truly the objective of taxi companies to maximize profits or are they merely engaging in business as a leisure activity? 

Secondly, it is absolutely imperative that when a taxi is summoned via telephone, the taxi company in question dispatches a vehicle in a timely and efficient manner. It is utterly inexcusable for a taxi company to fail to deliver a taxi in a reasonable time frame, particularly after multiple assurances have been given to the effect that a taxi is en route. The experience of waiting thirty minutes for a taxi that never materialized, followed by a subsequent fifteen-minute wait that also proved futile, is simply unacceptable. 

Thanks to the incompetence and ineptitude of Yellow Cab, we were forced to trek 1.5 miles back to our place of lodging, which, under normal circumstances, would not have constituted a significant hardship. However, considering the lateness of the hour (3:30 am), our collective state of exhaustion, and the fact that one of our companions was afflicted with a painful knee injury, the entire ordeal was nothing short of a debacle. 

In light of the aforementioned grievances, it is with great animosity that we express our dissatisfaction with Yellow Cab. We shall be compelled to explore alternative transportation options in the future, with Green Cab being the prime candidate for our patronage.
Horrible horrible horrible service. We sat for 10 minutes and were not greeted so we got up to leave and all they did was wave us goodbye

This dining experience was unequivocally the most unpleasant culinary encounter I have had the misfortune of enduring at an MG establishment, with all five entrees (ordered for a large family) being served at an unacceptably low temperature, bordering on frigidity. Following a hasty reheating process, which was ostensibly executed via microwave, we were appalled to discover that each diner was engaged in a discourse regarding whose dish was the most insipid and lacking in flavor. As frequent patrons of MG, we were utterly dismayed by this anomalous occurrence, and our expectations for a satisfying meal were regretfully left unfulfilled. However, there were two notable exceptions to this generally unimpressive repast - the house salad dressing and the bread, both of which demonstrated a modicum of culinary proficiency.

"Extremely dissatisfied! They possess a regular customer program that they inadvertently exploit due to their inability to accurately monitor visitation frequencies, thus refusing to provide a physical document or card as evidence of one's attendance. This has led to unfortunate instances where my acquaintance has been wronged twice, totaling just a few dollars, yet they persist in their reluctance to rectify the issue despite our repeated attempts to address the problem. Furthermore, their service delivery is excruciatingly sluggish, exemplified by the prolonged two-hour duration required for a complete set of nail extensions. I strongly advise against patronizing this establishment. They have callously lost two devoted clients today, and their nonchalant attitude towards this situation speaks volumes about their business practices."

"It is with profound disappointment that I must convey my utter dissatisfaction with the reprehensible level of customer service I received during my multiple visits to this establishment, which, quite frankly, has left me feeling utterly disillusioned and disheartened. Specifically, I must draw attention to the flagrant lack of warmth and hospitality displayed by the staff during my visits, which, I must emphasize, were characterized by an unmitigated chilliness that bordered on outright hostility. Indeed, it is with great consternation that I recall the manner in which I was ignored and disregarded by the staff, despite my conspicuous efforts to engage them with a smile and direct eye contact. Furthermore, I find it utterly inexplicable that my husband, who entered the store subsequent to my arrival and was greeted with a cheerful 'hello,' was accorded a welcome that was patently denied me, leading me to wonder if there exists some sort of invidious criterion that determines the extent to which customers are acknowledged and addressed. Regrettably, this was not an isolated incident, as I have experienced similar treatment during my previous visits to the store, which has led me to the inescapable conclusion that it is futile to expect any semblance of cordiality or respect from this establishment. Consequently, I have elected to sever my patronage of this business and seek alternative vendors who value and appreciate their clientele."

"Alright, so I perpetually opt for placing an order here for delivery. I habitually procure a substantial quantity of orders during each instance, and have hitherto been content with the culinary offerings. However, whenever I request curry, they pose the query regarding the intensity of spiciness on a scale ranging from 1 to 5, and I customarily respond with a rating of 3. Nonetheless, upon receipt of my order, everyone who partakes of it expresses their sentiment that it resembles a rating of 5 in terms of piquancy, which is unfailingly 10 to 15 minutes behind schedule. It is rather vexing that they profess a specific duration of waiting time when they are unable to adhere to it punctually, particularly when I consistently place sizable orders, remunerate delivery charges, and extend generous gratuities! Notwithstanding these factors, I persist in placing orders, and on one occasion, I requested curry and specified a rating of 1 out of 5, mindful of the fact that there was no discernible divergence in the fiery nature of the curry relative to the customary rating of 3 we had previously employed. This continued unabated until the present day, whereupon I am indisposed and opted for soups and curry. She inquired about my preference for spiciness and was apprised that I did not relish it pungent, not even at a rating of 1 out of 5, given my current state of health. She conveyed an estimated waiting period of 30 to 40 minutes, to which I assented. And lo and behold! The wait extended beyond an hour, and the curry? It was excessively fiery! I am simply incensed by their consistent tardiness in deliveries and their ineffectuality in upholding the designated levels of spiciness, and it is my conviction that they should refrain from inquiring about the degree of spiciness desired by patrons, since they demonstrate a lack of proficiency in maintaining uniform standards across the spectrum of intensities ranging from 0 to 5."

"Conserve your financial resources.  As an individual who was brought up with the melodic offerings of the legendary Michael Jackson, I must say that my expectations were not met by this production.  In point of fact, it was a tedious and juvenile display that failed to captivate my attention for even a brief period of time.  Moreover, the seating arrangement was such that my line of sight was obstructed by the person positioned in front of me, which further detracted from my overall experience."

"Experience characterized by utter dissatisfaction and multiple instances of unacceptable treatment, including deceitfulness, indifference, and inefficient time management, culminating in a request for reimbursement and the decision to redirect patronage elsewhere. Never again shall I engage with such an organization."

First time at Rio - check in at 5 took 20 minutes - now at taxi everyone trying leave Rio - this place suck & will never stay again - I stay cuz of friends - not worth my time or money!!! Stay away if u under 35

"Genghis Khan's military campaigns were thwarted by the formidable barrier of the Great Wall of China; regrettably, Arizona's borders do not possess the same level of security. We entered the establishment at 8 pm on a Saturday, and owing to the dearth of patronage, I conjectured that the venue might be in the process of closing. However, upon perusing the menu, it became apparent that the options for vegetables were somewhat limited, as certain items were available solely in a mixture, while others were either frozen or not adequately replenished. Furthermore, the selection of sauces was disappointingly meager, consisting of a few thick, gloppy varieties that were served in small metal ramekins. It is worth noting that the starch component of the dish was provided in the form of noodles or rice, although the latter was conspicuous by its absence following cooking. As the bowl was brought to our table, a gratuity was expected. Unfortunately, my culinary experience was not satisfactory, as the ingredients were not adequately cooked, resulting in some vegetables remaining raw, while the sauces were unremarkable despite generous quantities. Moreover, the peanut condiment tray was devoid of contents. In light of these factors, I shall be inclined to frequent YC's or MuShu instead, and would advise others to follow suit."

"Wow...we happened upon this establishment quite serendipitously, as my friend's spouse was eager to behold their grandiose pint promotion, which, might I add, was indeed enormous, but regrettably, that was the sole redeeming quality of our visit. 

Upon entering the premises, we were greeted by a resounding cacophony emanating from the live musical performance, the magnitude of which was unfortunately amplified by an inadequate sound system, thereby posing a significant threat to our auditory faculties. 

In light of this, I opted for my customary beverage - a Long Island Iced Tea, only to discover that the bartender had erroneously incorporated an excessive amount of tequila, thereby unbalancing the delicate blend of rum, vodka, and gin, resulting in an unpleasantly potent concoction. 

My companion's selection of a cider was likewise underwhelming. 

In conclusion, based on our experience, I would advise that this watering hole caters primarily to regular patrons, and thus, may not be suitable for discerning visitors."

"It appears that the ambiance and quality of this establishment have diminished significantly, as evidenced by the prolonged waiting period for unremarkable culinary offerings, which has led to a rather lackluster dining experience."

I created a yelp account just so i could comment on this restaurant because I w disgusted by the experience.  The waitstaff was horrible. The restaurant was not even busy. As people arrived, they made them wait 30 mins and then seated them at tables that had been open the entire time. The food was good but I will never go back given the horrible experience.

"Overpriced and underwhelming, I comprehend that when green beans are referred to as haricot verts, an elevated cost is anticipated; however, when ordering a dish and being presented with the option of haricot vert as a side, it appears unethical to incur an additional fee of $8. Such practices seem incongruous with the local demographic's financial means. Geographically adjacent to the Ritz Carlton, perhaps the establishment seeks to capitalize on the affluence associated with its illustrious neighbor; nevertheless, for those residing in the surrounding area, this eatery does not appear to be a suitable choice. Furthermore, the server's attention seemed to be diverted by the staff meal she was consuming, rather than attending to our needs. Thus, we express our gratitude and decline further interaction."

"If I had the option to bestow a rating lower than one star, I would unhesitatingly avail myself of that opportunity, as my experiences at this establishment have been utterly unsatisfactory. Specifically, the drive-thru service has consistently displayed an egregious lack of attention to detail, failing to fulfill even the most basic aspects of their responsibilities, such as accurately assembling orders and ensuring that the correct items are included in each bag. Regrettably, this has transpired on multiple occasions during my visits to this location, rendering it abundantly evident that the management's supervisory efforts are woefully inadequate. Consequently, I strongly advise potential patrons to seek alternative dining options, lest they wish to risk encountering similar frustrations and inconveniences."

"My spouse and I lodged at this establishment for a duration of two nights, as we sought an affordable accommodation for the weekend. The process of checking in was effortless and efficient, thanks to the promptness and courtesy displayed by the staff. Upon arrival, we were informed that our abode would be located at the Manor, which offered the advantage of proximity to our vehicle. However, it must be noted that the lodging was not physically connected to the casino. The room itself was somewhat aged, with furnishings that reflected a similar state of seniority. Nevertheless, the king-size bed was recently purchased and exceptionally comfortable, as were the pillows provided. Additionally, we had access to a Keurig machine for brewing coffee, a feature that our acquaintances at a more luxurious hotel did not possess. \nMy primary grievance concerns the fact that approximately one and a half hours prior to our scheduled departure, the water supply to our room was suddenly disconnected. This resulted in the unavailability of essential amenities such as flushing the toilet, hot water for showering, and even basic hygiene practices like washing one's face or brushing one's teeth. Fortunately, the water supply was restored just ten minutes before our scheduled check-out time. \nUnfortunately, this experience has deterred me from ever considering this establishment for future stays in Las Vegas."

"Extremely disheartened! My spouse and parent ventured to acquire hamburgers for the evening meal, given that I am nine months pregnant and not in the frame of mind to partake in culinary indulgences outside of the home. They placed the order and transported it back to our residence. Unfortunately, they failed to provide the restaurant staff with all of the necessary items, a fact that we did not become cognizant of until their arrival. Moreover, the omission of my order was particularly egregious, as it included a milkshake that lacked any semblance of sustenance or flavor, essentially rendering it a glorified glass of flavored milk. Furthermore, the exorbitant price point of four dollars and some cents for an Oreo chocolate shake is utterly unjustifiable. In light of these circumstances, my spouse has embarked on a mission to rectify the situation, while his own meal grows increasingly cold. Our attempts to contact the establishment have proven futile, as the phone line merely offers the option to communicate with headquarters, which would serve little purpose in addressing our grievances. Aggravation and frustration abound; it is unlikely that we shall return to this particular Smashburger in the future."

So I'm waiting in line to order take out and watch the 2nd round of the NFL playoffs, and the hostess informs me I have to be seated to order take out. Really? Fail!\n\nI'd like to give no stars if yelp allowed!

I am cognizant of the fact that reviews are ideally composed in a prompt manner subsequent to experiencing the event, however, I am compensating for lost time by penning this review and procrastinating the completion of a scholarly paper. My visit to this establishment transpired during the sweltering summer months, shortly after my unsuccessful attempt to gain admittance to Tryst (a nightclub renowned for its exclusivity and opulence). Regrettably, this venue was characterized by an excessively congested atmosphere, with patrons packed tightly together, rendering navigation through the throng a formidable challenge. Moreover, I was taken aback by an individual whose intentions were less than honorable, as he endeavored to touch my person in an inappropriate manner, prompting me to display remarkable physical strength, reminiscent of a protective parent, by forcefully repelling him against a nearby surface. Following this unsettling episode, I opted to sample a potent, albeit costly, Tokyo Tea, which unfortunately was not accompanied by a refund of my change, totaling twenty dollars, from the rather unscrupulous bartender. Although the bustling ambiance made it challenging to ascertain the accuracy of my claim, I ultimately received my rightful refund after a brief exchange. This nightlife destination is recommended for individuals seeking a casual romantic encounter, without being overly concerned with conventional standards of courtship. It is worth noting that what transpires in Las Vegas may potentially become the subject of discussion on social media platforms such as Yelp.

This establishment appears to be in a state of disarray and disorganization, evidenced by the prevalence of waste and rubbish throughout the premises. We had procured two tables and opted for the bottle service, which proved to be an unfortunate decision. The security personnel seem to lack proficiency in their duties, as demonstrated by their inadequate response to our innocuous comment regarding cannabis, which was made in a lighthearted manner. Subsequently, we were compelled to vacate the premises, with security personnel exhibiting aggressive behavior by extinguishing my cigarette and escorting me out. It is worth noting that smoking is permitted within the establishment, which may be a source of discomfort for some patrons.
