 Problems abounded, and I am almost certain that I will inadvertently omit some of them in my enumeration that follows:
 1. A dearth of concession stands situated outside the stadium's parameters.
 2. Insufficient provision of consumables at internal concession booths, leading to a shortage of hot dogs, cups, and beverages, among other items, prior to the midpoint of the game.
 3. Security personnel stationed in the parking area displayed an excessive degree of belligerence towards attendees.
 4. An insufficient number of entrance points (merely four) to accommodate the substantial gathering of over 70,000 spectators.
 5. Diminutive jumbotrons, rendering visual observation of the game somewhat challenging for those seated at a distance.
 6. The stadium's public address system was barely audible, further contributing to the overall sense of disorganization.
 7. Refusal to display instant replays, followed by the exhibition of advertisements falsely implying that replays were being presented.
 8. A meager number of escalators serving the upper levels, with each one capable of accommodating only a solitary individual at a time.
 Considering these numerous deficiencies, it becomes evident that this stadium lacks the capacity to host a BCS game of even moderate proportions, and it is my sincere hope that it will be divested of the privilege forthwith.

As I am writing this review I have yet to see my food. We have been given complimentary chips & salsa. However, I have seen 2 other tables get their food before me. This is terrible service...please beware of this chili's as you will wait for food for it to be warm.

"It is my profound displeasure to recount the utterly deplorable quality of service I received during a recent visit to this establishment, which, regrettably, has rendered it necessary for me to express my extreme dissatisfaction in such unequivocal terms. Specifically, despite my having been led to expect a telephonic response from this office, I was left to languish in futility, awaiting an answer that never materialized. Furthermore, the personnel assigned to retrieve me from my place of lodging failed to manifest themselves, thereby necessitating my own arrangements for transportation. In light of these transpirings, I am constrained to aver that this office would be better served by a comprehensive overhaul and, in all likelihood, benefit substantially from a rigorous assessment of its operational protocols."

"They incurred a fee of \u00a32 for wireless internet connectivity, which I found to be exorbitant and utterly unacceptable, particularly in light of the fact that certain establishments have been known to provide complimentary access to such amenities. It is my conviction that any business that imposes charges for basic necessities such as bread, water, and internet connectivity will invariably receive unfavorable critiques. Furthermore, the quality of the culinary offerings and associated services at this establishment was merely mediocre, with prices that were neither exceptionally high nor low. It is worth noting that this location had previously been renowned for its exceptional quality approximately five years prior; regrettably, it appears that standards have declined precipitously since then."

AVIS epitomizes egregiousness with their exorbitant tariffs, callous disregard for customer satisfaction, and pernicious business practices that fleece unsuspecting patrons. Despite securing reservations well in advance, the "pay now" option, ostensibly more economical, ironically precipitated an unjustifiable $25 penalty upon cancellation, juxtaposed with the "pay later" alternative at the airport, which would have obviated such an unfair charge. Following a futile attempt to elicit a modicum of empathy or remedy through customer service, our experience unequivocally bespeaks a steadfast commitment to avoid future dealings with AVIS, and we caution others against succumbing to their Machiavellian machinations.

Only ordered from this place because it was convenient. Last 2 times was very disappointing. Probably will not go again.  Too many kids running the place with no visible manager to give them direction.  They forget about orders, don't care how they come out and really are going to take a good investment and ruin it for the manager/owner.  Try another place if you can help it.

"I have been an ardent patron of this establishment for an extensive period, and today, they incurred a lamentable lapse in their customary fastidiousness, misplacing a crucial string from my maternity shirt, thereby precipitating a profound sense of disillusionment and necessitating a shift in my allegiance towards a more reliable dry cleaner."

Ugh, if I could give this place a negative rating of ten stars, I most certainly would. What an unmitigated nightmare! To begin with, during my initial visit, I nearly ingested a large shard of plastic that was concealed within my salad. Then, to my utter dismay, the bartender nonchalantly exclaimed, "whoops," and carelessly discarded the contaminated beverage on the floor.  
Fast forward a couple of months, I decided to accord this establishment a second opportunity. (I must have been experiencing a temporary lapse of sanity due to extreme hunger.) Firstly, the bartender displayed blatant rudeness, sluggishness, and an utter lack of proficiency in mixology. My companion and I placed our orders, and approximately twenty minutes later, my friend's meal arrived. However, after an agonizing wait of nearly an hour, my pizza remained conspicuously absent. 
When I inquired politely about the status of my order, the surly bartender merely shrugged and retreated, leaving me ignored and irate. Following a prolonged period of waiting, someone finally deigned to speak with me, informing me that the manager was supposedly "indisposed." Eventually, after an interminable delay of one and a half hours, I received my mediocre pizza. 
My sincere gratitude extends to the kitchen manager for fulfilling their responsibilities and engaging in a dialogue with the clientele. Nonetheless, a stern reprimand is warranted for the bartender who worked earlier on New Year's Eve. They demonstrably lack the aptitude and customer service skills required for this line of work, and their continued employment would be utterly unjustified.

"Josh served as our aquatic maintenance specialist, yet his communication regarding his duties and actions surrounding our pool's upkeep were inadequate and often characterized by elaborate justifications or rationalizations when he deigned to speak at all. Following the instance wherein the pool's water appeared verdant, an analysis conducted at Leslie Pool Supply revealed an utter absence of chlorine within the liquid mere days subsequent to Josh's visit. When confronted with this evidence, he chose to discontinue his services without informing us for a period of two months, which we found profoundly unsatisfactory and indicative of an unprofessionally managed enterprise."

"Similarly, TAO Beach suffers from an inflated reputation, much like its nightlife counterpart. While the female patrons may enjoy complimentary admission, their male counterparts are burdened with a $20 cover charge. Upon my initial visit, I must admit that my expectations were elevated, primarily due to the captivating tunes emanating from the venue. The musical selection, characterized by a fusion of top 40 hits and electronic pop, proved to be quite appealing. However, one soon realizes that the ambiance is not worth the hefty price of admission. The space is minuscule, leaving little room for movement, and the audio can be enjoyed from the adjacent Venetian pool without incurring the additional cost. Furthermore, the absence of any unique features renders TAO Beach unworthy of a visit, unless one is able to secure a luxury cabana. My companions and I experienced a brief and unremarkable excursion, culminating in our swift departure. The sole redeeming quality of the establishment lies in the novelty bracelet bestowed upon patrons, which serves as a mild consolation for the disappointing experience. Essentially, TAO (club) shares the same shortcomings as its beachside counterpart - overcrowding, diminutive size, and an overall sense of disappointment. novice club-goers may find themselves drawn to the venue, only to be disillusioned by its subpar offerings. Nevertheless, the presence of attractive women lounging in the indoor tubs remains a notable attribute. In conclusion, TAO, in both its beach and club forms, falls short of expectations, save for a few scattered redeeming qualities."

This establishment is utterly deplorable! It is my conviction that the entire \"discounted\" notion they promote is merely a ruse designed to deceive individuals into believing they are making a frugal purchase! 

I ventured into Michael Kors in pursuit of a timepiece and was informed that the price was $350...the identical item is available at the store situated within Fashion Square for the sum of $275, and at Dillard's for an identical amount. Thus, refrain from attempting to persuade me that this is a genuinely discounted location. 

Furthermore, Charlotte Russe offers a buy-one-get-one deal for their footwear at the price of $12.50 per pair...whereas at their primary storefront, the cost is $15.50 for each pair. 

Moreover, the H&M located here shares identical pricing with its counterpart in Scottsdale. 

In conclusion, I have always harbored a certain level of skepticism towards outlet malls; however, this particular establishment takes the proverbial cake in terms of sheer ineptitude.

"The establishment's ambiance and operational efficacy are suboptimal, precipitating an unpleasant experience for patrons due to prolonged queuing times at both the fabric cutting and checkout areas, thereby hindering the expeditious completion of purchases and undermining the overall satisfaction of customers, particularly those with young children eager to engage in creative activities."

"Substandard patron assistance and sluggish staff comportment are prevalent at this establishment, as evidenced by my recent visit. Upon requesting that our server supplement our meal with an additional item, he demonstrated a lack of familiarity with the identity of our table attendant and departed abruptly, leaving us in a state of uncertainty regarding the fulfillment of his obligation. Furthermore, a considerable duration of time elapsed before we received our order, contributing to an overall unsatisfactory encounter."

"The impetus behind my inclination to utilize Yelp stems from an inherent desire for diversion and a reliance on the collective opinions of others in determining where to allocate my financial resources, thereby rendering it essential for me to contribute my personal encounters. My motivation does not involve obtaining complimentary items; rather, it is rooted in a genuine interest in sharing my experiences. Although infrequent, my negative appraisals are reserved for instances where the ambiance poses a potential health hazard, as was the case with Zoe's. Subsequently, a manager at Zoe's solicited my telephone number, expressing a desire to acquire further insight into my visit. Willing to divulge my encounter, I provided him with my contact information. Following a courteous conversation, he extended an apology and offered a gesture of goodwill in the form of a gift certificate, which I deemed superfluous yet appreciated nonetheless. However, upon furnishing him with my mailing address, a span of two weeks has elapsed without any tangible manifestation of the promised token. In light of this, I felt compelled to communicate with the customer service representative who had initially established contact with me, merely to inform her that the anticipated gift had not materialized. The extent of mismanagement within the organization has become glaringly apparent, prompting me to question the present state of Zoe's, the answer to which has become increasingly evident."

"The patrons who frequent this establishment display a propensity for animosity towards individuals who do not share their fervent enthusiasm for the Green Bay Packers football team, but we encountered an exceptionally hospitable server during our visit. This venue would be ideal for devotees of the Packers franchise, and their chicken wings were delectable."

"Upon reconsideration, my culinary inclinations impelled me to revisit this establishment, however, it proved to be an unfortunate choice. The salad I ordered was disappointing, to say the least, with limp, brown lettuce and an unappetizing shade of brown guacamole that bordered on rancidity. Furthermore, the dish was overpriced at more than ten dollars, which seemed exorbitant in comparison to neighboring eateries such as Gadzooks and Chipotle, where I could obtain a superior quality meal for several dollars less."

"It is my conviction that this establishment has been undeservedly lauded, prompting me to visit after witnessing its feature on 'Man vs Food.' Unfortunately, the quality of the crawfish served to us did not live up to expectations, as the minuscule portions were not only lacking in freshness but also appeared to be frozen. Our order of two pounds yielded a paltry amount of meat, with the majority consisting of the head and leftover skin. It is my belief that the restaurant's popularity can be attributed to its exposure on the aforementioned television program, however, I would advise potential patrons to exercise caution and consider alternative options, such as the buffet at Wynn, rather than squandering their resources on an unsatisfactory dining experience."

We visited this establishment on Labor Day 2014, entering the premises with the expectation of being promptly accommodated, only to be met with an ostensible paradox - an abundance of unoccupied tables, numbering no less than 20, yet we were informed that there was a 15-minute delay in seating, further compounded by the presence of multiple other patrons awaiting a table. Perplexed by this incongruity, I queried the hostess regarding the reasoning behind such a policy, to which she responded that the restaurant's reluctance to seat us was attributed to the presence of several sizable gatherings, thereby precluding them from accommodating additional customers. My previous experiences at this venue have been underwhelming, characterized by unremarkable cuisine reminiscent of a traditional diner, rendering it all the more imperative for the management to maximize occupancy and foster a positive patron experience, particularly given the intense competition within the local culinary landscape. Disillusioned by this encounter, I am disinclined to return and will instead seek alternative dining options.
Went here with some coworkers for lunch. Was not impressed with the pizza at all. The garlic bread tasted store bought. Will not return.

I arrived during the week preceding Thanksgiving, which customarily constitutes an off-peak season, thereby resulting in a relative dearth of crowds and a heightened sense of tranquility throughout Las Vegas.

Pros:

* My accommodations were remarkably silent, as I failed to detect even the slightest murmur emanating from neighboring rooms throughout my entire stay.
* The location of the hotel was ideal, as I have always preferred establishments situated removed from the central strip.
* The dÃ©cor was indeed captivating, and it was primarily owing to this factor that I opted to book a room at this particular hotel â?a decidedly unique and refreshing change of pace from the ubiquitous gambling dens and boisterous nightlife venues that proliferate the city. The ambiance was utterly serene, devoid of the pervasive din and revelry that often accompanies such locales.
* Complimentary parking and internet access were also provided, although I did notice a somewhat dubious charge totaling $100 upon checkout.

Cons:

* The youthful personnel responsible for check-in procedures appeared to be woefully lacking in both basic manners and customer service skills, their assistance being characterized by an extreme degree of unhelpfulness. Having booked my accommodations through Priceline and paid the entirety of the room fee well in advance, I was taken aback upon arrival by their demand for an additional $75 per night under the guise of âincidentals.â?This exorbitant charge struck me as patently absurd, particularly given that I had never encountered such an egregious fee at any previous hotel stay. Despite my protestations, the staff proved unsympathetic and wholly unwilling to offer any manner of assistance. Ultimately, I was able to cajole them into accepting a single payment of $75 for the initial night, with the understanding that I would settle the balance of $75 the following morning â?an arrangement that struck me as manifestly unfair, given that I had already paid for my accommodations in full. It is my firm conviction that such questionable business practices are highly detrimental to the reputation of any establishment.
* In light of the above, it is my strong recommendation that potential guests seek alternative lodging arrangements, as the prevailing attitude displayed by the hotelâs staff seems to be one of pervasive apathy and disinterest.

"My apologetic sentiments are conveyed in conjunction with the notion that this culinary establishment does not serve an authentic Pad Thai dish, as the gustatory experience was utterly disappointing and subpar, and furthermore, the hospitality we received was inadequate, as no staff member bothered to attend to our needs, necessitating my own efforts to seek out someone capable of presenting me with the invoice, thereby rendering any future visits to this eatery highly unlikely."

Jamba Juice, a purveyor of ostensibly salubrious beverages, was my destination of choice due to their prominently displayed concoction featuring an alluring visual representation; however, upon my arrival, I was dismayed to discover that two of the four essential components were conspicuously absent, thereby rendering my desired consumable unattainable; as such, I have resolved to abstain from patronizing said establishment in the future.

"The contents of the windshield washer reservoir prompt an inquiry into the nature of its constituents, specifically regarding the liquid utilized for cleaning purposes. Does it consist of stagnant swamp water or perhaps the residual effluent from a portable toilet facility? While the notion of recycling is commendable, the actual substance employed in this instance is utterly repulsive. My spouse, upon accidentally spilling a minuscule amount of the fluid onto his footwear, endeavored to remove it with a moist towelette; however, the putrid odor remained persistent. As we departed the fueling station, I became increasingly aware of the noxious scent emanating from the affected area, rendering it imperative that my husband detour to a nearby grocery store lavatory to rinse his shoe thoroughly. The mere thought of donning such contaminated footwear necessitates their disposal in a waste receptacle."

"The culinary delight known as pizza, while palatable, has been unfortunately accompanied by a series of unfortunate events pertaining to its delivery, which, regrettably, has transpired into an unmitigated disaster. Following the placement of an order via digital means at approximately 6:50 PM, the anticipated time of arrival was slated for 7:50 PM, a duration deemed excessive in light of the proximity of the establishment, Wolfman, being merely two miles from my domicile. Upon contacting the establishment at 8:00 PM, I was assured that the order had indeed departed the premises. However, subsequent communication at 8:20 PM revealed that the general manager had taken on the responsibility of delivering the pizza personally. Disturbingly, a subsequent telephone call at 8:50 PM, two hours subsequent to the initial order, divulged that the order had yet to be retrieved from the digital platform. This sequence of events underscores a flawed process and raises concerns regarding the veracity of information provided by employees, rendering it unwise to consider remote orders from Wolfman, thereby necessitating personal attendance or self-pickup to ensure successful procurement of the edible product."

"The Apple Store in question is seemingly ubiquitous in its subpar quality, particularly for American patrons. Its frequent visitation by foreign tourists in Las Vegas does not warrant disparagement, but rather serves as a salient factor in the store's divergent nature. The staff's indifference and lack of initiative are palpable upon entry, as an absence of welcoming personnel is commonplace. This phenomenon can be attributed to the employees' cognizance of the fact that tourists will purchase their products irrespective of the level of service rendered, thereby rendering superfluous any concerted attempt at customer satisfaction by both staff and management."

It is most certainly not Tacos El Gordo! I have visited this establishment on two separate occasions, with the initial visit being sufficient enough to satiate my culinary desires, thus rendering a trip to Tacos El Gordo unnecessary. However, my second visit, which took place during the same week, was an unfortunate disappointment. The woman stationed at the burrito area was engaged in a conversation in Spanish, uttering derogatory remarks, labeling us as foolish and intellectually challenged individuals. This was all precipitated by a warmed-up tortilla that she was compelled to discard. We placed an order for two burritos, and upon completion of the first burrito, I courteously requested that the order be altered to carne asada fries. At that point, she began speaking in a derogatory manner, unaware that I was able to comprehend her words. Consequently, everyone in the vicinity was laughin at us, and I subsequently ordered two tacos, one consisting of seso and the other made with cabeza. The gentleman informed me that I could simply pay for my order and he would retrieve it for me. Unfortunately, both tacos exuded a rancid odor and their taste was reminiscent of old, stale food. I did not consume them further. 
  It is truly lamentable that this series of unfortunate events transpired, primarily due to the actions of an older woman named Veronica, who worked at the burrito area and was responsible for throwing away a warmed-up tortilla. Her intentional actions led to the contamination of our food, which could have potentially caused food poisoning. This unpleasant experience occurred at the Tropicana location, and needless to say, we will not be returning to this establishment again. Moreover, we will not venture to try the other location.

"It is utterly apparent that these assessments are unequivocally accurate, as this establishment has proven itself to be an exemplification of subpar customer service, with a staff member named Jason exhibiting unprecedented levels of incivility and discourtesy towards patrons. Furthermore, my personal experience has led me to conclude that there exists but a solitary individual within this retail space who possesses both proficiency in their duties and a demeanor that can be described as anything other than utterly unpleasant."

"I would express a desire for an even lower rating, were it possible, in light of the fact that the absence of flour chips has rendered the establishment effectively indistinguishable from a plethora of other eateries serving similar cuisine; such an omission, in my opinion, significantly diminishes the dining experience, thereby warranting a designation commensurate with my profound disappointment."

The gastronomical experience that I had the misfortune of encountering during my recent visit to this establishment was, without a doubt, the most unpleasant and unsatisfactory since the advent of the new millennium, with the service being characterized by an unacceptable level of ineptitude and the filet mignon possessing an unfortunate similarity in texture and flavor to a piece of cardboard, leaving me feeling utterly disillusioned and disinclined to ever consider returning to this restaurant again in the future.

"It is imperative that you seek assistance from a different establishment, as my experience at this particular Goodyear location was utterly unsatisfactory and, quite frankly, unacceptable. Upon arriving at 7:30 am to replace my tires and undergo an oil change, I was met with a service writer who attempted to sell me his personal tires, which he had stored in the back of the shop. This should have been an indication to vacate the premises immediately. Despite being informed that the process would take two hours, I elected to wait in the lounge area. However, after four hours had elapsed and my vehicle was still elevated, I became increasingly agitated. Eventually, I received a complimentary transportation home, which somewhat alleviated my frustration. To my astonishment, once the service was completed eight hours later, they delivered my automobile to my residence. Consequently, I expressed my gratitude and offered a gratuity. Unfortunately, two months subsequent to this encounter, I traded in my vehicle, and the dealership revealed that the oil dip stick handle had broken off entirely. It is evident that the individuals at Goodyear intentionally severed it, cognizant of the fact that I would not be inspecting beneath the hood for an extended period. One can only speculate regarding the extent of their meddling with my car. I shall divulge my experience to all acquaintances to prevent similar occurrences."

"Upon each visit to this establishment, I invariably depart with the self-assurance that the inferior quality of their garments, in conjunction with the exorbitant prices, shall serve as a sufficient deterrent against any future patronage. However, I find myself inexplicably drawn to return, only to be met with an equally underwhelming experience. During my most recent excursion, Scott, the cashier who attended to me, displayed a striking lack of enthusiasm in his greeting, which was further compounded by his inability to accurately dispense change, opting instead to unload an assortment of coins and bills haphazardly into my hand. It is truly regrettable that such a prominent retailer would fail to prioritize the recruitment of staff members possessing even a modicum of professionalism."

I have had the pleasure of visiting this establishment on multiple occasions due to its proximity to my workplace and the convenience it offers for a quick lunchtime visit; however, I have decided to cease patronizing this business as the experience has consistently failed to meet my expectations. Firstly, the cramped and overcrowded waiting area lacks adequate seating or standing space, resulting in an uncomfortable and stressful experience for patrons. Furthermore, the nail technicians have exhibited a tendency to aggressively promote additional services during pedicures, which I find annoying and intrusive. My personal experiences with their pedicures have been disappointing as well; specifically, my last pedicure resulted in an improperly done pinky toe and an unexplained discoloration of my toenails, which turned yellow after a couple of weeks despite my lack of exposure to the sun. Moreover, my friend's gel manicure chiped shortly after leaving the salon, which raises concerns about the quality of their products and services. Considering these factors, I have decided to discontinue my patronage of this establishment and explore alternative options for my beauty needs.

Firstly, this establishment exuded sluggishness, wherein my takeout order, placed twenty-five minutes prior, was followed by an additional fifteen-minute wait. It was a Wednesday evening at seven o'clock, and the atmosphere did not convey the impression of being busy. Upon entering, I immediately approached the counter, where three individuals stoodâtwo elderly men and one woman operating the cash register. The two men were meticulously examining the orders, while the woman appeared preoccupied with an unidentified task. Not a single acknowledgment of my presence was offered, leaving me with an extended wait that felt excruciatingly prolonged, much like awaiting the completion of a microwaved popcorn bag.

Regarding the culinary offerings, I can condone subpar service if the food delivers an exceptional experience. In this instance, I requested six garlic knots and a large pepperoni and mushroom pizza. The garlic knots, measuring slightly larger than a quarter, were priced at two dollars and fifty cents, which seemed exorbitant. Their quality was average, at best.

The pizza itself elicited disappointment upon presentation. Its uniform, cookie-cutter appearance did not impress me, and its resemblance to frozen pizza raised concerns about its authenticity. A truly exceptional pizza would exhibit unique characteristics such as varied crust texture, visible bubbles, and distinct color variations. Alas, these qualities were conspicuously absent.

Furthermore, the flavors failed to impress. The crust lacked appeal, the sauce was nearly nonexistent, and the cheese and toppings seemed deliberately scant, as if profits took precedence over quality.

In conclusion, I feel utterly disillusioned and robbed of a satisfying dining experience. My disappointment is compounded by the fact that I will not be returning to this establishment, and I shall continue to drive past it without hesitation. Moreover, I will refrain from spending even a quarter, let alone another dime, at this restaurant, as the accompanying photographs demonstrate.

If I had the option to award them a rating of zero stars, I undoubtedly would, but in order to adhere to the parameters of the rating system, I shall confer upon them a solitary star. While I did appreciate their assortment of spectacles, the quality of service provided by their staff was subpar at best. My experience during the doctor's visit was satisfactory, however, I was merely seeking an answer to a straightforward inquiry: whether my prescription required an adjustment. Unfortunately, the final tally included charges for services beyond what I deemed necessary, resulting in my payment exceeding what I had anticipated. Furthermore, the spectacles I acquired were transition polycarbonate lenses, which functioned adequately for approximately a year before the transition film became riddled with minuscule fissures encompassing the entirety of both lenses. It is worth noting that the guarantee for their work only extended for a period of one year. Therefore, I caution prospective patrons against investing in transition lenses from this establishment. Prior to making a purchase, it is imperative to conduct thorough research. Transitions Optical, the creators of these lenses that darken in response to sunlight, emphasize the importance of obtaining a certificate of authenticity at the time of purchase, which serves as proof of the two-year warranty offered by Transitions Optical. Regrettably, I did not receive such a document. The numerous microscopic cracks that permeate my transition lenses create a blurred appearance, giving the impression that I am not wearing corrective eyewear at all. In light of these circumstances, I would strongly advise against conducting business at this location. Despite my continued fondness for the frames, I shall seek alternative sources for the replacement of my lenses and ensure that the level of customer service is superior, should any issues arise in the future.

"It is with profound dismay that I must recount the utterly unpleasant sushi experience I recently endured, characterized by a multitude of unfortunate events, including, but not limited to, the discourteous behavior of the hostess, the breakage of both toilet seats in the restroom, and the application of adult prices for my 10-year-old son, who, due to his advanced height, appeared to the staff to be of a more mature age, despite their failure to disclose the policy until prompted, and further exacerbated by the unjustified imposition of an 18% gratuity charge, which, upon subsequent investigation, proved to be illegal; thus, I strongly advise potential patrons to exercise extreme caution and vigilance when dining at this establishment."

Despite the plethora of unfavorable evaluations proffered on this platform, my proximity to the establishment and yearning for poultry-based culinary delights prompted me to indulge in a visit. Opting for the combination platter featuring both winged and tendered fare, my expectations were regrettably left unfulfilled, as the former exhibited an unfortunate resemblance in taste and texture to pulped paper products, while the latter possessed an unpleasant flavor reminiscent of footwear that had been exposed to an extended period of time in close proximity to a moist environment. Furthermore, the menu item designated as "fries" proved to be merely mediocre in quality. The entire dining experience was utterly disappointing and detrimental to my cardiovascular health due to the excessive quantity of grease employed in its preparation.
By far the slowest Jiffy Lube I have ever stopped at. Thought I would be in and out in a few minutes because no one was in front if me but it took over an hour.

I made the decision to patronize this establishment based on the favorable evaluations it had received on the popular review platform, Yelp; however, my expectations were not met, as the dining experience turned out to be a considerable letdown. Upon entering the premises, my initial reaction was one of utter disbelief and bewilderment, as the ambiance and aesthetic appeal of the interior design were glaringly deficient. Furthermore, the culinary offerings that were presented before me and my significant other were equally unimpressive and lackluster, rendering our meal an unremarkable and unappetizing experience. Consequently, I would not consider returning to this restaurant in the future.

My friends & I have been to the San Diego location & have been raving about Hash House A Go Go ever since.

Unfortunately, the Las Vegas (Quad) location sucked. It was pretty boring. Staff seemed rather blah. You would think that being in Vegas the staff would be more lively. 

When we got there we sat for almost a good 20 minutes before anyone approached our table. The only saving grace was that our waiter who was an older gentleman was super nice. Other than that..this place is boring & even the food isn't the same. What a shame! San Diego location is MUCH BETTER.

Mittagspause gemacht. Essen und Trinken waren flott am Platz. Bedienung nett. Zum Abkassieren war dann aber irgendwie keiner zust\u00e4ndig. Am Ende hab' ich das Geld auf den Tisch gelegt und bin gegangen. Trotzdem den Bus verpasst. Nochmal 20 Minuten warten. Mist!

Upon initial entry, the ambiance suggested an impending pleasant encounter; regrettably, my expectations were not fulfilled. Firstly, I was subjected to unhygienic instrumentation, followed by an unwarranted glitter application and an additional fee. Furthermore, the gel nail polish exhibited an unacceptable fragility, flaking off mere hours subsequent to its application. My dissatisfaction was further compounded by the fact that I had paid sixty dollars for a gel manicure and a standard pedicure that failed to endure for even twenty-four hours. Notwithstanding the aforementioned grievances, I must admit that the staff demonstrated remarkable cordiality.

(Bald) Bartender, manifestly discourteous. This review would be excessively protracted if I itemized our dialogue. I interacted with a manager, regarding his "conduct" toward us. The manager offered an apology and purchased us a beverage. That was considerate of him, but I aspire for the bartender to refine his "interpersonal" proficiencies.

The establishment was not overly crowded, approximately an hour subsequent to a Dbacks match. We did not consume any culinary offerings. I have been apprised of the superior quality of their fare. Baldy Bartender generated a negative ambiance, precluding us from prolonging our visit. I possessed minimal inclination to request the bartender alter the television station, laugh out loud.

Was unable to procure a last-minute booking at Craftsteak, which I hold in high esteem, during my sojourn in Las Vegas, thereby necessitating a reluctant visit to Delmonico.

The level of service provided was satisfactory, as anticipated, yet lacked the warmth and cordiality that fosters a genuine connection between patron and server, leaving me with an unfulfilled desire for a more convivial dining experience.

My culinary preferences lean towards the tenderer side, and unfortunately, the rib eye failed to meet my expectations in terms of marbling and overall tenderness, rendering it difficult to fully appreciate its flavor profile.

Given the abundance of alternative steakhouses in the vicinity, Delmonico's shortcomings are further highlighted, thus making it unlikely that I shall return in the future.

This particular buffet was one of the more costly dining experiences I had the pleasure of indulging in during my stay in Las Vegas, with a price point of $21 per individual for a Monday evening meal, which unfortunately did not meet my expectations in terms of quality and value. In contrast, a comparable dining establishment located in close proximity, specifically the 4 Queens, offered a superior culinary experience for a significantly lower price point of $9.

"Expressing my sentiments regarding the quantity of comestibles presented, I must aver that, upon my initial visit as a customer, I was not particularly enthralled by the culinary offerings. While the fare was palatable, it lacked a certain je ne sais quoi, a quality that would have elevated it to the realm of the truly exceptional. Instead, it seemed rather unremarkable, evoking a sense of familiarity akin to dining at an establishment akin to Olive Garden, but with a certain amplified quality that detracted from the overall experience."

"It is indeed perplexing that TK, who purports to embody the quintessential American spirit, would choose to affiliate himself with an eatery that openly professes its affection for an amorous relationship with anyone, regardless of their background or inclinations. My recent visit to this establishment, specifically to attend a live performance by the illustrious Reverend Horton Heat, served as the impetus for my decision to confer upon it a second star. However, I must admit that I was taken aback by the exorbitant prices charged for certain beverages, including a remarkably pricey well rum and diet, which amounted to a staggering $8, and Pabst Blue Ribbon cans, which were offered at a premium of $5 apiece. As I did not sample the culinary offerings, I cannot provide an assessment of their quality. Nevertheless, my brief encounter with the bartender led me to form an unfavorable impression of the service, and the constant fluctuation in prices throughout the evening only served to reinforce my conviction that this establishment is not worthy of future visits. In summary, while the entertainment provided that night was undoubtedly enjoyable, the excessive cost of drinks and the inconsistent pricing policy adopted by the management make it a decidedly unappealing destination for those seeking a satisfying dining experience."

I genuinely aspired to thoroughly enjoy this establishment, however, my experiences during my two visits were underwhelming. Upon requesting a beverage, specifically water, the server's insistence on adding a lemon was perplexing, as the water's quality was subpar. Moreover, my enthusiasm for their Kreplach soup was short-lived due to its mass-produced, uniform appearance, lacking the authenticity of handmade pasta. The portion size of the accompanying cole slaw with a half sandwich was minuscule, rendering it nearly invisible, which was disappointing given its commendable taste. The corned beef sandwiches were satisfactory but lacked exceptional quality, despite their substantial size, which seemed to be the primary focus. The restaurant's entrance presented a chaotic atmosphere, with various sections including check-in, registration, takeout, and merchandise display, while the seating area appeared unremarkable. In summary, this establishment fails to meet the standards of a genuine Jewish deli, despite its attempts to emulate one, and falls short in both appearance and flavor, although it does have an advantage over other places outside of the coastal regions. However, my overall satisfaction was compromised by the disparity between its self-proclaimed identity and the actual experience.
"Subpar service experience with prolonged waiting periods for both food and server assistance, despite satisfactory culinary quality."

This theater does not evoke the fear that people tend to associate with it; rather, it can be perceived as an antiquated remnant from the early 1990s when Mills malls were prevalent throughout the nation. Its aged appearance and outdated ambiance may deter some individuals, but it primarily attracts a distinct clientele.  
I was reluctantly accompanying my companion to this cinema on a Thursday evening, anticipating a lackluster comedic experience in front of a meager audience. Unfortunately, my expectations were met, as there were merely five other individuals scattered throughout the theater. The time spent there seemed irretrievable, and the possibility of obtaining a refund appeared unlikely, given the theater's policy of directing customers to a self-service machine that might potentially malfunction.  
During the process of purchasing tickets, Melinda encountered difficulties with her card at one of the machines, necessitating our migration to an alternative device. Although the transaction was successfully completed, the tickets and receipt failed to print. Consequently, we were compelled to visit the box office, which the automated machines were intended to circumvent. Surprisingly, the manager displayed leniency and allowed us entry without requesting any evidence. It is conceivable that we could have fabricated this narrative, and perhaps we shall attempt to do so in the future.

"My affinity towards this establishment was once considerable when it was situated at Von's Shopping Center, as I frequented it with great enthusiasm. Subsequently, upon their relocation to Food4Less Shopping Center, my fondness for it remained undiminished. However, a prolonged period of closure ensued, the reasons for which remain unknown to me. Nevertheless, now that they have resumed operations, my excitement has been rekindled. Today, I returned in pursuit of my culinary craving for Pad Thai, only to discover that its quality had diminished and the lunch special was no longer available, much to my dismay."

"The website's inventory management system does not accurately mirror the availability of stock, and the organization neglects to notify clients of out-of-stock items while processing orders incompletely, which leads to an unsatisfactory customer service experience when attempting to address the issue via telephone, as the representatives tend to dominate the conversation and abruptly terminate it. I interpret this behavior as an indication that the company is not interested in retaining my patronage, and I shall be more than content to comply with their implicit desire."

They have experienced a precipitous decline in quality, a stark contrast to their previous excellence. Their descent has been so profound that it would be injudicious to consider returning, especially given the proximity of superior Chinese cuisine.

"Positives: The waitstaff member exhibited a pleasant demeanor and accommodating attitude, while the establishment remained operational on December 24th, albeit with limited hours of operation. Negatives: The waitstaff member lacked proficiency in her duties, as evidenced by an extended delay in serving our party, during which time we were forced to consume beverages that had been subjected to an unacceptable degree of oxidation, rendering them undrinkable; furthermore, the fries, which required an unreasonable amount of time to prepare, arrived lacking the customary golden-brown hue and crispy texture associated with this staple side dish, their deficient temperature rendering them unpalatable."

Do you want to die shortly after being slapped in the face with a cover charge that shouldn't be charged and then having your girlfriend gang raped on the dance floor?

It receives two stars simply because I used to like the place.  Pool, good music, dancing, reasonable drink prices.  But, after a couple of tense situations, witnessing fights on a near weekly basis, and a parking lot shooting....I'll pass these days.

I don't do karaoke so that side of the establishment might be okay.
"Inconspicuous and unremarkable, this establishment offers pedestrian tacos and subpar hospitality. However, if you find yourself inebriated and ravenous, this venue may suffice, albeit barely."

After indulging in an extensive exploration of South Phoenix's culinary landscape for an hour on a Sunday, in pursuit of a delectable breakfast burrito from a quaint Mexican eatery, and experiencing the unfortunate symptoms of a hangover and exhaustion, I inadvertently arrived at Fili B's.

Their breakfast menu boasts an impressive array of options, available throughout the day, which is indeed a remarkable feature.

However, had I not been subject to such an extended and arduous quest for a suitable establishment, and had I not been overcome by an insatiable hunger, I might have opted for a more familiar Mexican drive-thru, such as the ones located at 5th Avenue and Camelback Road or 40th Street and Indian School Road, all of which offer a satisfying variety of breakfast burritos.

Regrettably, my experience at Fili B's fell short of my expectations, as the dish did not provide the satisfaction I had hoped for. The excessive amount of cheese and undercooked, fatty bacon detracted from the flavor, while my companions' chorizo burritos lacked zest and were excessively oily. Generally, I tend to avoid Fili B's and instead prefer to visit its sister establishments or similar eateries, such as Rollberto's, Eriberto's, Armando's, and so forth.

"Indifferent sentiment permeates my demeanor in response to the culinary offerings presented at this establishment, despite the ambiance and setting being quite satisfactory; however, my appreciation for the beverages served here is unwavering and genuine, particularly with regard to their inventive nature."

"I placed an order for a lasagna, a dinner salad, and a bowl of soup, specifically the Italian wedding variety, which, to my utter dismay, bore a striking resemblance in taste to Italian dressing, thereby diminishing its erstwhile appeal. Previously, this particular soup had been a hallmark of excellence, but unfortunately, it seems that either a change in culinary approach or a lackadaisical cooking attitude has resulted in an unfortunate transformation. Despite my initial enthusiasm, I opted to reserve the remaining portion for a subsequent meal, in the hopes of securing a refund from the establishment, as opposed to merely receiving a replacement product. Alas, the anticipated refund proved elusive, and I was ultimately compelled to consume the soup at a later time, albeit with a lingering sense of disappointment. Notwithstanding this setback, the lasagna itself was quite satisfactory, although its sweetness quotient was somewhat excessive. Furthermore, the cost-to-portion ratio left much to be desired, prompting me to consider preparing a comparable dish at home, with the added benefit of being able to portion and store it for future consumption. In contrast, the dinner salad was truly exceptional, boasting an abundance of fresh, crisp vegetables that more than compensated for the slightly soggy lettuce. However, the dressing, which appeared to be straight from a bottle, contained an excessive amount of sugar that bordered on being nauseating. Were the establishment to address these issues by improving the dressing and draining the lettuce more effectively, I would eagerly partake of this salad on a biweekly basis. Unfortunately, my future patronage will be limited solely to this particular menu item, provided that I can supply my own dressing. This experience has proven to be a regrettable update indeed."

"I commissioned the alteration of my pantaloons at this establishment, and although the artisan executed the task with moderate proficiency, the finished product remained excessively lengthy, despite his assiduous efforts to ensure a precise fit by pinning them while I wore them. Furthermore, the cost of the service was exorbitant and the completion time was unacceptably prolonged, exceeding the duration of a week. My incredulity at such an unsatisfactory experience compels me to express my discontent."

"The culinary offerings were merely adequate, akin to those available at a standard Italian eatery, whereas the hospitality was truly exceptional, characterized by an extraordinary level of cordiality. My spouse and I were commemorating our first anniversary, and while the ambiance was not optimal for such a momentous occasion, the staff's eagerness to expedite our departure was manifestly evident, as they removed our plates before we had completed our meals. The establishment was not particularly crowded on this Sunday evening, yet the sense of urgency they conveyed was palpable, making for an unfortunate dining experience that precludes any future visits."

I ordered a mozzarella and tomato sandwich, a small order of pasta salad, and a drink and it came out to $13. For $13 I could of gone to a restaurant. Paradise Bakery has some of the best cookies around but the food is a rip off.

"While the establishment offers an extensive array of beverages at reasonable prices, the culinary offerings are subpar and not commensurate with the quality of the libations. The fried macaroni and cheese dish, in particular, was unremarkable and quickly forgotten. However, the ambiance is enhanced by the presence of numerous large flat-screen televisions strategically positioned throughout the venue."

We visited this establishment and our experience was utterly underwhelming.  My spouse had the vegetarian skillet, which was unimpressive, to say the least, as the vegetables were unpleasantly chilled and were crowned with a lackluster melted cheese.  I opted for pancakes, which, quite frankly, were subpar in both taste and texture, and failed to surpass the quality of those produced by Bisquick, a widely available pre-mixed baking solution.  Needless to say, we shall not be patronizing this establishment again in the future, particularly given its proximity to our place of residence.  Indeed, the whole experience was a profound disappointment.

I was getting my nails done here on Tuesday night, and while my nail lady was fabulous, the ambiance was not. There apparently who is a hairdresser there, Barbara, and she lets her kids run around the entire salon as she works. I think it is highly unprofessional. I was in a complete opposite area of the hair salon, and I could hear the kids. Not to mention, the same lady, was on the phone screaming at someone...also very unprofessional. My nail lady said that was pretty normal and the kids were always at the salon being loud and the mother is very loud herself. I just wanted to relax for an hour or so, and could not do so in that atmosphere. I will not go back, just because I don't want to be bothered with an employees children running around....again....highly unprofessional.

"Complimentary carbonated beverages were provided, a pleasant gesture, albeit, the sole notable attribute encountered during my visit. Pervasive fumigation permeated the interior (even by casino standards), resulting in an unpleasant experience upon returning home, enshrouded in pungent smoke. Furthermore, participation in the rewards program proved somewhat vexatious, as the complimentary $10 slot play was restricted to specific, sparsely dispersed, crown-marked machines, often occupied by individuals with no apparent intention of relinquishing their seats in the near future. Overall, this establishment ranks among my least preferred gaming venues in the greater Phoenix area, thereby rendering it unlikely that I shall revisit in the forthcoming days."

We indulged in a delectable brunch at this establishment this morning; however, our culinary satisfaction was significantly diminished by the subpar service we received. Furthermore, we were taken aback by the presence of a steak knife perched atop the toilet paper dispenser in the ladies' restroom, an unsettling discovery that elicited relief that no young child had accidentally encountered it. Consequently, we are left feeling disillusioned and compelled to seek an alternative venue for our future brunch endeavors. This establishment must expedite efforts to ameliorate their organizational proficiency and rectify the issues that hamper their ability to provide optimal service to patrons.

"Rating: 2.5 stars, albeit subjective, yet rounded down deliberately for pragmatic reasons, as my expectations, admittedly elevated due to online reviews proclaiming this particular buffet as one of Las Vegas' finest, were not entirely fulfilled, despite its novel concept of a globally-inspired smorgasbord featuring an array of culinary outposts showcasing diverse regional specialties such as Chinese, American, Mexican, Mediterranean, and possibly Japanese fare, unfortunately limited by the meager offerings at each station, ultimately leading to a sense of underwhelment; specifically, my spouse expressed disappointment regarding the crab legs, deeming them undercooked, and their seafood selection unimpressive, though it must be acknowledged that this establishment does not purport to be a seafood-centric buffet, while my personal experience involved a succulent roast pork, yet lacking that extra je ne sais quoi to render it truly remarkable, leading me to suggest that patrons consider dining at an independent restaurant instead."

The lunchtime smorgasbord offers a subpar culinary experience, at best, with superior gastronomic options available elsewhere. My personal preference for this eatery is restricted to their delectable chaat, which, regrettably, was unavailable on the day in question due to an alleged surfeit of tasks in the kitchen, much to the dismay of my dining companion and myself, despite the fact that certain privileged patrons managed to procure takeout containers of the coveted delicacy, presumably via prior arrangements.

Very disappointed!Heard so much about this place so we were very surprised! Walked in and immediately greeted... Very good service.\nThe place was dead!!! It was after 9 so drinks weren't on special.. But 8 for a corona!? No thanks!

I have fond memories of the 'wichcraft in Bryant Park from a few years ago.  Maybe it was the sitting-outside-and-actually-being-outside that made the experience so enjoyable... but no, I really think it was the fresh, hot sandwiches that made it such a memorable lunch spot.  It's too bad Vegas has Vegas-ized it into mediocrity.

The line was to the door at 4pm on a Saturday.  I was surprised, but I guess I shouldn't be - I forgot how time means nothing when you're in a casino.  Considering the sandwiches were pre-made and just needed to be plopped onto the panini-griller, it seemed to take a while - but I wasn't in a hurry, so I can deal.  

I ordered the ham/cheddar/apple on pumpernickel and got it to go.  I was so excited to savor the awesomeness remembered from Bryant Park that I ripped it open in the car to take a few bites.  

Oooh, messy!  I don't know what happened - maybe the water content of the apples was too much? - but half of the sandwich was so soggy, it was like it had just been bathed.  The other half was just fine - so strange.  I think cheddar was the wrong cheese choice on their part - it made the whole thing so bland, like it zapped out any flavor the apples and ham had brought to the table.  I hate to say it, but I've had a Subway sandwich or two more exciting than this.  Maybe their other creations are better?

The sentiment of disillusionment permeated the atmosphere, as the culinary experience failed to meet expectations, prompting a reevaluation of the establishment's quality control protocols. The visual presentation of the dishes appeared to be satisfactory, yet the flavors did not live up to the promised standards, with the meat dishes being particularly unimpressive, boasting an unpleasant dryness and toughness that bordered on the inedible. The Asian-inspired options proved to be particularly problematic, as they induced gastronomic discomfort, leaving only the pizza and ice cream as palatable choices. In light of these findings, it is unlikely that a return visit will be forthcoming.

It was indeed one of the initial pleasant weekends in Montreal, and we had become cognizant of the fact that certain rooftop restaurants within the vicinity were offering brunch services. Subsequently, we arrived at the establishment and took a seat, only to be taken aback by the revelation that brunch was not being offered, with lunch being the sole available option. The elevator's signage suggested that brunch was served between the hours of 11 am and 3:30 pm, yet this was seemingly applicable to the restaurant situated below us. Frankly, I remain uncertain about the veracity of this claim. Notwithstanding, we opted to partake in the culinary offerings, as our hunger was quite pronounced. 

We procured some beverages and placed an order for an appetizer, which, upon its arrival, proved to be exceptionally delectable. Unfortunately, this was the sole highlight of the repast, apart from the favorable weather conditions and panoramic view. My vegetarian burger, in particular, bore a strong resemblance to a mass-produced patty, both in terms of its appearance and taste, which was rather unfortunate. 

Following the consumption of our meals, we waited for what seemed like an interminable period of time, amounting to at least thirty minutes, before our bills were presented to us. The establishment was bustling with activity, and our server appeared to be overwhelmed, leading to our table being neglected, much to our dismay. Eventually, our server returned, exhibiting remorse, which was, to some extent, reassuring. In conclusion, I would not advocate for a revisit to this establishment, owing to the subpar quality of the cuisine and the unsatisfactory nature of the service provided.

Most crowded bar I've ever been to on a Sunday. My experience there left me feeling very overwhelmed.. We started with margaritas at the Hefe on Mill and then Uber'd our way on up to the one in Old Town Scottsdale. \nI think if this bar was in a smaller city it would be more fun; just too many people for such a small spot. Or management might want to think about having a limit on how many people at one time.... It was ridiculous.

"I am utterly disinclined to visit this DMV, and I am adamant about never setting foot inside again, except in cases of extreme necessity. Moreover, I managed to renew the registration of my vehicle at the outdoor kiosk during an ungodly hour- 2:00 AM to be precise- without having to engage with any of the workers inside, who often display visible disdain towards their occupation. The process was surprisingly efficient, taking only two minutes, and the machine promptly dispensed my registration. It was indeed a welcome convenience! Given the increasing prevalence of these kiosks throughout the city, I hope to rely solely on them for future renewals. 

It is deplorable how the staff members interact with their clientele, considering that they are well aware that patrons have no alternative service provider and are thus compelled to utilize the DMV's services. 

The facility in question customarily teems with throngs of people, resulting in serpentine queues that sometimes extend beyond the building's exterior. Incongruously, a snack bar is available on the premises, offering sustenance such as hot dogs and nachos to those who wish to partake while awaiting their turn."

"Upon entering the expansive eatery for an evening repast, it was conspicuously devoid of patrons, a circumstance that did not augur well for an establishment purporting to serve culinary delights. Furthermore, the menu, a tome of gastronomical proportions rivalling that of the fabled Cheesecake Factory, only served to heighten my skepticism. In light of the overwhelming array of options, I opted for the relatively unremarkable chicken tender plate, while my companion selected a Thai-inspired dish and her maternal figure chose a salad. It is worth noting that the dearth of clientele did not abate the prolonged duration between our order and the receipt of our meals, which exceeded three quarters of an hour. My poultry, though hardly exceptional, was not as unpalatable as I had anticipated, yet it fell short of the mark set by other establishments specializing in fried avian cuisine, such as Bojangles. Lastly, the selection of beverages available at this establishment was woefully inadequate, a fact that only served to further diminish my overall satisfaction with the dining experience."

"We patronized this establishment on an evening when they featured multiple musical acts, yet encountered considerable difficulty in procuring the attention of the waiting staff. After several unsuccessful attempts to hail a server, we opted to approach the bar and placed an order for two draft beers, which amounted to nearly ten dollars. Numerous patrons, including ourselves, endeavored to signal a server, and ultimately, our orders were fulfilled after approximately forty minutes had elapsed. The initial course, an Italian-inspired burrito, was presented to us while still partially frozen within. The soups were unremarkable, whereas the ribs were fairly satisfying, although excessive sauce was applied; it is recommended to request it on the side, lest one prefers a plethora of sauce. The musical performances were quite enjoyable on this particular night, alas, my alcoholic beverage consumption was limited to three drinks, as it appeared to be the maximum quantity they desired to sell me; attempts to acquire additional drinks proved futile, suggesting that if a business chooses to engage live music, it would be wise to optimize both food and beverage sales."

We walked in for happy hour... took a look around... smelled like a funeral home...

Walked out....

Maybe this place is good if you are retired....

"The personnel were amicable and hospitable, facilitating an arrangement for my grandmother. Subsequent to my departure, I scrutinized the floral arrangement and noticed that certain rose petals exhibited desiccation and necrosis. Considering the cost, I surmised that the flower arrangement was overpriced in relation to the quality and quantity of blooms provided."

This was our first experience at this location.  We had been to other place and the pizza was amazing but service was beyond horrible.  Had some friends in town and good pizza seemed like the common thought, we came here to get a good pizza that wasn't a 'normal chain' type place.  We ordered two pizza's and they were both just ok, and the staff here was not as bad as the other location but it amazes me in such a small place such as this that your drinks being empty for extended periods of time as well as the one waitress not being seen in the dining room for extended periods of time.  I will order to go from the other location before I do this stop again.  I'm assuming the drinking and the proximity to UNLV is what keeps this location open.

"What in the name of culinary excellence has transpired at this establishment?!? The pace of service is sluggish, the fare served is unremarkable, the quality has diminished significantly, the dining area is unkempt and appears to have been neglected for an extended period of time... This venue was previously considered an affordable substitute for the illustrious PF Changs; however, it now pales in comparison to even the most middling of dining experiences offered by Denny's. It would appear that the management of this eatery has strayed considerably from its erstwhile commitment to providing a satisfactory dining experience for its clientele."

In today's stringent economic climate, I am reluctant to express dissatisfaction with an eatery unless it truly merits censure. However, my recent dining experience at this establishment left much to be desired, despite the fact that I was the sole patron present. Not only did I have to procure my own condiments, but I also waited an inordinate amount of time for a water refill while consuming my meal. On a positive note, the baba ganoush was palatable and reasonably priced, while the salad was fresh and crisp. Unfortunately, the kafta kabob was somewhat arid and could have benefited from the addition of a tangy tahini sauce to enhance its flavor. Although the woman who served me was polite, her attention to detail was lacking, as she failed to ensure that I had all the necessities required for a satisfying dining experience. Based on my assessment, three stars seems rather generous; nevertheless, I may consider returning in the future, particularly given the presence of appealing lunch specials available between 11 am and 3 pm.

Not terrible but nowhere worth the price.

Went there with some friends. Our server was borderline creepy--- when we asked for more time to view the menu he sarcastically asked if we'd be ready by tomorrow. uhhh, k?

The food was alright. I split 3 dishes with 3 friends. Eggplant parmesan from the appetizer menu, Caprese, and the formaggio raviolis (I forgot whatever fancy name they slapped on them). The eggplant parm was boring and very greasy... I've had better from coffee shops. The raviolis were good, but lacked any stuffing. They were seriously flat. The sauce that accompanied them was a little thick I thought, but tasted fine. Best part of the meal was the Caprese. Very fresh and presented nicely. Only thing worth the money that we tried. 

Also after eating there we asked if we could see the collection of cars they have next to the restaurant, as it is one of the "draws" of this place. Nope, cover charge. Forget that.

In short, skip this place. Overpriced tourist trap.

"A severely confined parking area is associated with this Walgreens location, and it is emphatically advisable to exercise vigilant surveillance of your surroundings while traversing the distance between the store and your vehicle. The parking lot is indeed remarkably compact, presenting a significant challenge for maneuverability. \n\nDuring my most recent visit, I opted to utilize the drive-through service, and I must say that the clerical staff member who attended to our prescription was truly exceptional. Her proficiency and dedication were thoroughly impressive, warranting a singular accolade. Notwithstanding, the overall experience would have been significantly less satisfactory without her diligent efforts, thereby necessitating a rating of only one star."

"Eagerly anticipating an excruciatingly prolonged experience, I opted for a steaming hot chocolate beverage, specifically one that had been advertised as 'black chocolate 56% blablabla,' but unfortunately, my order was marred by an error in one of the commands. My cassolette, sadly, did not possess sufficient quality to compensate for the entire ordeal."

I visited this establishment in the company of some colleagues for a post-work social gathering and was left feeling underwhelmed. Despite its advantageous location overlooking Market Square, the eatery's culinary offerings and hospitality fell short of expectations. We capitalized on the happy hour special featuring margaritas and found them to be satisfactory. Everyone partook in these potent potables and relished them. 
  During this promotional period, appetizers were available at a reduced price, prompting us to order multiple dishes to share among ourselves. My sampling of sopecitos consisted of four substantial corn tortillas, each topped with a distinct protein - chicken, steak, carnitas, and chorizo, respectively. While the meat was passable, the tortillas lacked freshness and arrived at our table merely lukewarm. 
  My attempt at the empanadas yielded a mediocre experience, as the beef filling failed to impress. This dish was unremarkable and forgettable. A few other items we ordered were similarly unimpressive. However, the flautas proved to be the exception, as they were the only dishes that garnered universal acclaim from our group. If only we had opted for multiple orders of these delectable treats instead! 
  Our experience was further marred by subpar service. It took nearly an hour for our appetizers to arrive, and one dish was incorrectly prepared upon its eventual arrival. Following my request for a correction, the mistake was rectified, yet the faulty dish remained listed on my bill. After having it removed, the entire ordeal proved bothersome.

"My sentiments regarding my recent culinary excursion to this establishment can be encapsulated in a single phrase: 'underwhelming experience.' Neither appalling nor exceptional, my dining adventure fell somewhere in between, prompting an unenthusiastic response. Opting to sample their al pastor and lengua tacos, my expectations were unfortunately not met. Specifically, the former suffered from an absence of succulence and a conspicuous dearth of that saccharine quality so characteristic of well-executed al pastor. As for the latter, although tender, it lacked sufficient seasoning, resulting in an uninspired flavor profile that failed to leave a lasting impression. In conclusion, my visit did not justify a special trip, and I would not recommend going out of one's way to partake in the fare offered by this particular eatery."

"The staff member's comportment was adequate, with the exception of a singular individual. During the lunchtime hours, as we were preparing to assemble our meals, one of the establishment's employees vociferously exclaimed, 'You can't be back here!' The staff member's remark was uttered in a discourteous manner, and it pertained to the spatial area situated between the dual self-service vegetable and meat stations. Notwithstanding the fact that one of the bars was temporarily inaccessible, it was somewhat arduous to extend my reach to procure an item positioned at the rear of the counter. Consequently, I opted to traverse to the opposing side, thereby facilitating my accessibility to the desired item. However, the aforementioned staff member chose to vocally reprimand me from a distance, rather than approaching me and issuing a warning in a more civil manner. Such behavior was utterly disrespectful and unbecoming! It is pertinent to ponder the underlying purpose and aspirations of this particular eatery. Should they not strive for excellence and grandeur, rather than settling for mediocrity?"

Following my companion's effusive endorsement and ardent enthusiasm regarding this establishment, I was disillusioned to discover that it fails to cater adequately to the dietary restrictions of vegetarians and vegans. The culinary offering I selected, specifically the burger, lacked a palatable flavor profile, characterized by an unpleasant combination of acidity and an overpowering sweetness. My dissatisfaction with the dish was so profound that I abandoned consumption of it, an occurrence that rarely transpires.

Veggie omelette was way over cooked,  hard and dry ... Not good at all ... Very disappointing since I had had better food there a couple of years ago. My companion experienced the same with her omelette. So my advice ... At the very least ... Don't order an omelette ... Especially given the price.

I must confess that my predilection for Mexican cuisine has rendered me somewhat fastidious when it comes to indulging in such culinary delights. My penchant is for diminutive, unpretentious eateries that serve authentic fare, the kind of places that are often overlooked by those who prefer more ostentatious establishments.

In this particular instance, I opted for the quintet of miniature chimichangas, accompanied by a serving of both beans and rice. While the total cost of ten dollars may strike some as rather exorbitant for a meal of this caliber, I must admit that the quality of the ingredients utilized did justify the expense to a certain extent.

The aforementioned chimichangas were stuffed with an amalgamation of cream cheese and shredded beef, the former being slightly more prevalent than the latter. Furthermore, the pastries themselves seemed to possess a subtle sweetness, almost as if they had been crafted from a flaky pastry dough. Although the rice was relatively unremarkable, the refried beans served alongside them were truly delectable. It is worth mentioning that I would have greatly preferred the option of procuring chicken-based chimichangas instead.

My exploration of their salsa bar revealed that the assortment of condiments available failed to impress my palate, striking me as rather bland and lacking in flavor. However, the combination of avocado and salsa verde did manage to capture my attention, boasting a singular uniqueness and tantalizing taste that set it apart from its counterparts.

Upon entering the establishment, I was immediately struck by its pristine state of cleanliness. The staff's enthusiasm for ensuring a warm welcome was undeniably commendable, yet I couldn't help but feel that their repeated expressions of hospitality throughout my dining experience bordered on excessive. As a native of the southern United States, I find that a simple acknowledgement or courteous greeting suffices in most situations.

One item that did pique my interest was their fried ice cream milkshake, which I would love to sample on a future visit. Unfortunately, the aforementioned dessert constitutes the sole reason for my potential return, as I do not foresee myself frequenting this establishment with sufficient regularity to warrant further exploration of its menu. In conclusion, I must assert that this restaurant falls short of the standards set by similar eateries that I hold in high esteem, such as Carolina's or Los Dos Melinos.

"Flying into this location is exceptional. It embodies the essence of Las Vegas. Upon arrival, one experiences an unparalleled sense of excitement, eager to indulge in frivolous pursuits...

However, one's financial resources are rapidly depleted due to excessive gambling, rendering it impossible to cover the cost of an evening meal, gain entry into exclusive nightclubs, and ultimately leading to feelings of disappointment and the desire to return home forthwith.

Upon arriving at the airport, one is met with an extensive queue, stretching back to the walls, which would typically remain unoccupied. Following a prolonged waiting period of approximately one to two hours, one finally clears security protocols, albeit with considerable relief...

Subsequently, one becomes cognizant of the necessity to proceed to the D gates. Unfortunately, the sole means of conveyance, the tram, is nonoperational. Thus, one must undertake a brisk, mile-long trek while burdened with cumbersome luggage exceeding the recommended weight limit for checked baggage (a consequence of excessive purchases during one's stay in Las Vegas). 

Upon reaching the designated gate, one discovers a two-hour delay, further exacerbating the already trying circumstances...

In summary, this airport experience has been particularly unsatisfactory, marred by an interminable security line, the malfunctioning of the tram, and a protracted delay prior to departure."
Enjoyed my veggie burger with fries. Service sucked the last 2 times. We had to flag down a waitress to get our refills. Next time we'll do take out to avoid tipping poor service

"A pleasant ambiance and hospitable personnel notwithstanding, my experience at this establishment fell short of my expectations, as the therapeutic session itself left much to be desired. Despite the therapist's cordial demeanor and willingness to address specific areas of discomfort, they inadvertently created an additional knot that has persisted since the massage, which I had not experienced prior to the treatment. While the facilities were clean and well-maintained, and the front desk staff exhibited a welcoming attitude, the cost of services rendered was somewhat prohibitive and may deter potential patrons seeking comparable quality massages at more reasonable prices elsewhere. Although I was referred to this spa by a satisfied acquaintance and harbored elevated expectations, my experience did not live up to my standards, leaving me uninspired and unlikely to return. In essence, nothing extraordinary or remarkable distinguished this spa from others in its class, which is precisely what I seek when investing such sums of money."

Okay, unfortately SW Airllines needs to train their employees better.\nSW Airlines can only issue to a passenger two (2) boarding passes in a travel day. Example: Travel day 12/1; traveing from PHX to GEG with connecting flight in OKL (changing airplanes), got two boarding passes; got to GEG did my business and got an boarding pass at GEG with stop in LAS (no change of planes). It's frustrating because GEG was a full (over booked) flight.

The individual had the pleasure of consuming a slow-cooked pork dish, specifically cochinito pibil, which was advertised as a specialty of the establishment and cost $20. Unfortunately, the dish did not live up to its billing, as it was found to be lacking in both flavor and presentation. Specifically, the pork was over-salted and slightly dry, with an abundance of spices that overpowered the palate. Furthermore, the sauce that accompanied the dish was carelessly drizzled around the rim of the plate, creating an unappealing appearance that detracted from the overall dining experience. In contrast, the $7 Modelo beer was quite satisfying and provided a welcome respite from the disappointing meal.

I must confess that my contributions to Yelp are minimal, however, my dissatisfaction with The Haymaker warrants an expression of discontent. Previously, I held this establishment in high regard, frequently indulging in their culinary offerings and introducing them to my acquaintances visiting from afar. Unfortunately, my recent experiences have been marred by a discernible decline in quality. It appears that my glass is no longer replenished with the same alacrity as in times past, and the once-present garnish of lettuce has metamorphosed into an unappealing shredded form. Moreover, the complimentary to-go iced coffee, formerly imbued with a rich, toasted almond flavor, has vanished from their repertoire. Furthermore, during a recent Saturday afternoon visit, I was dismayed to discover the absence of marinara sauce for the mozzarella sticks. In spite of these shortcomings, the Happy Hour special featuring $2 Bud Light drafts remains a notable highlight. However, my "medium" burger arrived with a solitary tomato slice, which, regrettably, was positioned at the terminal end of the patty. Additionally, my request for an onion slice was fulfilled with a singular, somewhat limp ring of onion.
