Upon discovering Chino Bandino, I enthusiastically shared my desire to visit this restaurant with my fellow coworkers, who were equally eager to partake in this culinary adventure. \n\nUpon arriving at the eatery during the peak lunch hour, we were immediately struck by the bustling atmosphere and diverse clientele. However, our confusion quickly dissipated as a friendly staff member approached us and offered assistance, prompting us to explain our status as newcomers. In response, he graciously escorted us to a cozy side bar, where we were treated to samples of various delectable dishes, including the signature Jade Chicken, savory Carnitas, flavorful black beans, and expertly prepared fried rice. Needless to say, we were thoroughly impressed and eagerly placed our orders, settling in for a satisfying feast. As the afternoon progressed, we found ourselves suitably satiated, with the delightful Snickerdoodle serving as a welcome complement to our late-day snack. Unanimously, we agreed that this excursion was a resounding success, and we look forward to revisiting this culinary gem in the future."

Viv B. is a fun boutique with a sophisticated but youthful aesthetic. I'm a real fan of their jewelry and art pieces, as well as their scent items, and though their clothing selection is small, it's very sharply curated. The owner named the shop after her grandmother, whose portrait presides over the shop like some kind of stylish saint.

(New patient)Got here at 545, waited til 6 when they opened. Got put into a room right away, waited 20ish mins to see the vet. Told her the issue, she took her back for a full exam. Exam costs $42 (she's a chihuahua so it might vary by size). Clipped her nails (I'm a horrible parent, they were very long, $10).\nShe ended up needing a ton more done (xrays, blood tests, went home w/2 meds) bill was $700 and no diagnosis.. no broken paw or anything abnormal in tests, she's just in horrible pain and can barely use her left front paw/leg.Sent home with pain meds and anti inflammatory. Back a month later for same thing. Super nice doctors, staff can seem a bit in a hurry/rushed/not concerned. but all in all good =] we're back a few times a month for nail clipping
This place is fun and the food is delicious, great service and location! Try it before or after catching a movie!

Wow this is a really nice place. I've never visited this cinema before, but I was surprised. The restrooms are clean and modern, the theatre is a great size and they have a great selection at the snack bar. I will go back to this theatre for sure.

Firstly, permit me to express my utter satisfaction with the culinary experience offered by this esteemed eatery! The gastronomical delights presented before us boasted an impressive array of flavors, undoubtedly tantalizing our taste buds. Nonetheless, a caveat emerges in the form of a pecuniary concern, prompting a natural inclination to draw comparisons with other establishments offering similar fare at a relatively more reasonable cost. To elucidate, the delectable appetizers proffered by Halcyon, while unquestionably delightful, carried a price tag that some might consider exorbitant, amounting to a whopping fourteen dollars! This observation compels me to juxtapose the former with the Harvest Moon Grille, a dining destination renowned for its superior quality and comparatively greater value. Indeed, a cursory examination of their menu reveals a striking discrepancy in pricing, with the latter offering arguably more generous portions at a lower cost. Furthermore, my personal experience with the Ribeye Spackle served as a prime exemplar of this phenomenon; although the dish itself proved satisfying, the cooking method employed by the chef deviated somewhat from my expectations, specifically regarding the degree of doneness. Admittedly, such inconsistencies may be attributable to isolated incidents or momentary lapses in execution. Be that as it may, the desserts, though undeniably delectable, seemed to carry an inflated price tag, exceeding twenty dollars apiece! In light of these observations, I feel compelled to recommend that ardent devotees of Halcyon consider a comparative analysis between this establishment and its neighboring counterpart, Harvest Moon Grille, in pursuit of a more comprehensive and satisfying dining experience.

After hearing several people Rave about Pho Kim Long, I decided to check it out; and I can say I was not disappointed.

The place is fairly big and we were seated immediatley (there can be a wait but they burn and turn pretty fast). The staff was attentive and we had several people swing by the table to make sure we were doing OK.

The menu is impressive, I was just expecting your average Pho place, but they menu covers much more, apps, Pho, entrees, smoothies, and much much more.

I decided on the #11 Rare Steak and Brisket Pho. I also got an order of the Chinese Doughnuts to start.

My only complaint is that the doughnuts were plain, when I usually order them they're covered in sugar, but a little quick thinking and I was using the remaining Peanut Sauce from my companion's spring rolls for a great dish.

The Food came out insanely fast, the apps were good, but the Pho stole the show. The Steak and Brisket were both tender and delicious. The noodles were plentiful, and the broth was rich.

I will be going back without a doubt!

True to the City of Sin ... this airport is dirty and seedy ... Love it!\n\nGot through security pretty quick ... nothing out of the ordinary.  I don't know what people expect from airport security personnel ... they hear people bitch & moan all day long ... so it's expected that they'd be pissed off all the time, too.  Grab your crap and move on ... cause it just doesn't matter in the grand scheme of life!!!

Been here twice now. Excellent service each time.
Also this is a great hotel for a convention since
that is what I came for. Very spacious convention
area. The room I had was very luxurious and very
relaxing after a day of training, schmoozing, and
cocktails. It's the type of room you can always
completely relax in - so much space. Can't really
comment on the price as I wasn't paying - but a
big thank you to my employer for footing the bill.
Would definitely do it all over again. Love the 
whole Venice theme. I like the casino here and the
restaurants as well. This is also just the right
part of the Strip to be in. Viva Las Vegas!

very solid. great cocktails, especially if you like tequila (i do). tasty nuevo latino treats. duck empenadas (if i remember right) were ridiculously good. casual but upscale, with attentive bar service. fun.

Overall i thought that this buffet was one of the best buffets that i have ever been to. They had many different variety of meats such as lamb and primb rib (which were cooked really well). I am usually very picky with slider but the one at this buffet was amazing. The ramen was decent and so were the crab legs. This buffet had a giant variety of many different types of food and they all hit a good level of satisfaction. Not a big fan of buffets but this one is an exception for me.
Great work day gym to hit during lunch.  Just wish they would stop playing teeny bopper estrogen music in the men's locker room. ... Damn!!!

My go to cheap Chinese lunch spot on Harris Blvd.  The price is right.

Its a great cheap lunch special($5-6 with eggroll) but sometimes the free tea tastes a little funky, so I don't drink it a lot of the time.  The chicken is real meat, the sauces aren't too salty and, there plenty of veggies with every dish.

That said, don't expect to be wowed by some 100% traditional Cantonese or Szechuan food.  This is Americanized Chinese and it gets the 4 stars because of food per $.

This is a cool bar. It's relatively small inside, but it's a cool environment and there's a variety of places to sit - high top tables, bar seating, cushy chairs and couches, etc. \n\nI can only speak for the beverage selection, and it's pretty solid. Typical impressive beer selection evident in most Madison bars and decent drinks. I've heard great things about the food, especially the sandwiches and wraps... looking forward to eating here sometime soon!

Came here for the first time and loved it! For a lunch price of around $9, it was definitely worth it. Downsides include the semi-long wait and the crowded walkways with kids frantically running around. But hey, it adds to the buffet environment! With a chocolate fountain bar and a cotton candy machine, I would recommend anyone with a sweet tooth to stop by. Not to mention, there was a variety of food. Nothing fancy but nothing nasty either. For the price, why not give it a try?

Good find in the North! 

Fried Chicken - best tasting fried chicken I've ever had! Nice size portion for 2.

Catfish - very good, just wish they gave a little more.

Burgers - ok. tasted like a regular ol' hamburger to me. Which brings me to my next question, why is it called Hamburger Hut when they're burgers are mediocre as hell? Haha

It's a convenient store/restaurant. But more of a restaurant. It seems busy all the time and I hear people always ordering the fried chicken.  That's all imma get here too. 

Parking is limited. Like, only 7 spaces limited.

Darren it cracked me up to see you reviewed this Eat'n Park, but then I wasn't surprised a bit. I used to live blocks away from this place, and the location was ideal, for my favorite bar ever (Wilkie's Inn, now closed) was diagonally across the street from it. I actually have mostly bad memories of drunken friends fighting and/or confrontations here, but still this place beats all after a night at the bar. I can close my eyes and picture scrambled eggs and french toast, not to mention their delicious burgers with a side of pickles. And of course the obligatory Eat'n Park smiley face cookies, ah how I love them! Message to non-Pittsburghers, go to this (or any) Eat'n Park at least once! You'll be back!

Fun hotel that has a great theme park on the top of the building! LOVED IT!

My family got a room for a great deal (under $100) It was fairly family-friendly with all the amenities it offered. It wasn't a five star hotel by any means, but its was nice! There were places to eat and also a topless pool at the top! (well, when I was there) 

The swimming pool was nice because you could play water volleyball and it was so high up. Seeing the amusement park ride on the top of the building is pretty neat.  As a guest at the hotel, you get to go up to that area for FREE!  The location is great because you're close to the Las Vegas Strip.

This is a nice clean place. I always look for places I can take both family and friends and this once fits the bill. Surprisingly the pizza is really good! Not spinatos or grimaldi's quality but best of the bar food I've had. Thin crust and they have ground hamburger as a topping, yummy! They also have a lot of games, pools tables, shuffle board and TONS of tvs.  Besides the pizza, I'm a fan of the focaccias. Good place to come during a weekend for sports games.

Took a ipad 2 from work here for repair, ipad was repaired in the same day about 6hrs. Needed a new glass and cost about $129 plus tax. Overall happy w the service and repair they do give a 90 day warranty which is nice. Wish it was a little more professional but overall they did the job i needed. The shop is right off Mill ave so you can park in the meter and run in and drop off and pick up

If you have been to some of the Asian buffets in AZ, and you've liked them, I'd say you must try Jasmine Tokyo. 

I'm 6'4" and I get "Do you play for the Cardinals?" a lot, so I'm sure that when the proprietors see me darken the door of their establishment they're all like "ohsh*t." Fear not, lil Asian lady, for I am not a glutton. I'm here for the seafood and the sushi and some green tea.

As far as the sushi selection goes, it beats anything AYCE in the Valley that I've seen. There were at least 20 types of rolls and it wasn't just surimi crab and tempura, either. The tuna and salmon and snapper nigiri were really good, too.

If you have room for some fried rice, this one is delicious and so are the Chinese sausages and grilled chicken. Even the raw oysters were good, and that has never happened to me in AZ before.

Service was pleasant, and from the way it's decorated, I'm guessing this was once a Claim Jumper. Anyhow, it's a huge restaurant with a huge selection of items and if you're a vegetarian, you will be in heaven here with more vegetarian offerings than I've ever seen at a buffet. 

Seaweed is a vegetable, isn't it?

"Indubitably, Bouchon presents itself as a rather enigmatic venue, shrouded in an air of obscurity due to its seemingly deliberate placement in a rather unorthodox location within the labyrinthine confines of the Venetian. Perchance, the notion of incorporating a compass into the casino's layout would alleviate some of the confusion encountered by patrons attempting to navigate their way to this culinary establishment; alas, such an implement remains conspicuously absent. Instead, one must rely upon the meager guidance proffered by preceding reviewers, whose directions often prove as convoluted as the layout itself. Suffice it to say, Bouchon lies adjacent to the registration lobby, accessible via elevators that ascend to the second floor.  
Upon arriving at the eatery, a brief delay ensued before we were seated for brunch, during which time we perused the menu, finding it to be largely synonymous with the breakfast selection, save for a few supplementary offerings. Thus, our expectations were suitably tempered, yet we remained optimistic regarding the impending culinary experience.  
The chicken and waffles proved to be an unmitigated delight, as the latter boasted an ingenious inclusion of bacon bits, imbuing each bite with a sublime smokiness that complemented the juicy, roasted poultry perfectly. Arguably, this dish reigns supreme among its peers, rendering superfluous any attempts at comparison. In short, it is an absolute must-try.  
Conversely, the French toast, while visually appealing, failed to elicit the same level of enthusiasm as its predecessor. Perhaps, it was the underwhelming presentation or the palpable lack of innovation that contributed to our relative indifference toward this particular item.  
The ambiance of the restaurant, unfortunately, did not escape our scrutiny unscathed. With its outdated decor and cramped, haphazardly arranged tables, Bouchon suffered a slight diminution in esteem. Furthermore, the presence of solitary elderly gentlemen, their coughs echoing through the space, only served to enhance our awareness of the potential health risks associated with such proximity. Notwithstanding these drawbacks, we persist in wholeheartedly recommending Bouchon, if only for the unparalleled excellence of its chicken and waffles."

Best coffee in the area! I had their red velvet latte today and nothing else even compares. Friendly employees and cozy atmosphere inside too! My only complaint is it's a little pricey. I'm also a little surprised they don't have any high chairs, but overall I'm happy to give them my business and I will definitely be back!

"A symposium of culinary indulgence ensued at this esteemed eatery, whereupon we partook in a delectable morning repast, characterized by an ambiance of refined sophistication and unwavering attention to detail. Strategically positioned near a panoramic window, our table afforded a picturesque view of the surrounding landscape, further enhancing the gastronomical experience. A thoughtful touch, indeed, was the presence of a diminutive stool designed specifically for housing feminine accessories, its charm and whimsy serving as a testament to the establishment's commitment to excellence in all aspects of hospitality. My gustatory inclinations leaned toward the savory duck hash and eggs, a dish that did not disappoint in terms of flavor or presentation, although the fluffy pancakes beckoned seductively from their nearby perch. In essence, Tableau epitomizes a harmonious blend of elegance, sophistication, and relaxed conviviality, fostering an atmosphere conducive to both formal and informal gatherings alike."

"While indulging in the extravagance of a Las Vegas sojourn, I opted to immerse myself in the opulent ambiance of the NY NY hotel, whereupon I discovered that the establishment boasted an impressive array of amenities and facilities that rivaled those of a mini metropolis. The casino, being one of the more spacious and well-appointed in the city, offered an abundance of gaming options, ranging from traditional table games to state-of-the-art slot machines. Furthermore, the culinary offerings at NY NY were nothing short of exceptional, catering to a wide range of tastes and budgets, from modestly priced fare to exquisite gourmet experiences.  

During my stay, I had the pleasure of occupying a luxurious room on the 32nd floor of the Century Tower, affording breathtaking panoramic views of the iconic Las Vegas Strip and surrounding mountains. The accommodations themselves were both commodious and stylish, providing ample space for three individuals to unwind without feeling encroached upon. Although certain aspects of the room's decor appeared slightly dated, the overall quality and cleanliness of the amenities left little to be desired. Notably, the bathroom featured a separate area for grooming, complete with dual sinks, and the shower boasted high-end fixtures that delivered an abundance of hot water in short order.  

In conclusion, my experience at NY NY was thoroughly enjoyable, and I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a unique blend of luxury, convenience, and entertainment in the heart of Las Vegas."

"It is utterly inconceivable to encounter an unsatisfactory culinary experience at Cheba Hut, as the victuals served are invariably scrumptious and the sandwiches are meticulously grilled to a golden brown perfection, thereby eliciting an unwavering craving for a repeat visit, particularly among novice patrons who have yet to partake in the establishment's gastronomical offerings."

first spot me and my gf decided to go when we arrived in vegas.  i was really dressed down, as a matter of fact the only person in the place dressed down.  But still, did the hostess have to look at me like i was a scrub?  cmon, you're a hostess in vegas, probably hoping some rich guy knocks you up.  anyways, the place was crackin, like most spots in vegas.  very nice, upscale place.  the food was great, the best salmon sashimi ive ever had.  i couldnt stop thinking about it 2 days later.  they set a new standard for myself when it comes to salmon.  id also reccomend the baked lobster.  prices are really steep, so if your taking someone here, i hope you get some action afterwards.  minus the snobby hostess, and i would have gave this place 5 stars.

"In terms of culinary offerings within the confines of the aforementioned eatery, it is our considered opinion that the so-called 'blueplate specials' merit unreserved endorsement, particularly when considering their pecuniary appeal; these delectable delights are available at a most reasonable tariff of eight dollars per person, an amount which includes access to both the soup and salad bar, the latter of which boasts an array of fresh fruits, thereby rendering it a veritable cornucopia of gastronomic delight; furthermore, we have found it advisable to partake of the soup and salad bar in moderation, given the generous proportions thereof, and subsequently transport the entree to one's domicile for consumption at a later juncture; it is important to note, however, that the ambiance of the establishment in question does not necessarily conform to the standards of high-end resorts such as the Wynn, owing to its status as a humble, albeit well-frequented, locals' casino with somewhat dated decor; nevertheless, the staff maintains a warm and welcoming demeanor, and patrons may rest assured that the quality of the comestibles served will remain consistently high, while the prices remain refreshingly affordable; incidentally, it is worth mentioning that a diverse selection of desserts is offered at a special price of two dollars per portion on a monthly basis."

Food was great but service was a little strange. You don't order your food from the sushi chef you have to order from the waitress. Also we ordered 3 rolls and some sushi, you would think the sushi comes out first? But they brought out all the rolls and forgot about the sushi until we mentioned we never got it. Overall they're fish quality was great, everything tasted fresh and not fishy :) will be back and they're AYCE is a great deal with a lot of selection :)

When it's free, everything seems that much better. We got in on one of the LMFAO nights and it was awesome. What a way to end your vegas trip. I like the unique feel of each room, especially the library where you're not bumping elbows to get a drink. I still prefer the layout of XS, but it's always cool to see the designers of these super clubs push the boundaries of creativity and above all else, giving people a great party atmosphere.

If you have an inclination towards seafood, then an excursion to Boardwalk Billy's is imperative. My preference from their extensive menu is the steampot, which boasts a delectable broth, and I request additional shrimp in lieu of oysters. The portion is generous and includes potatoes and corn, rendering it a comprehensive meal. Additionally, I have sampled their clam chowder, which is utterly delightful! We opt to visit on Thursday evenings, as it coincides with their trivia night and offers a plethora of beverages at a mere $2. Even the most exceptional local drafts are available for this nominal price. The service at the Galleria location is consistently efficient and cordial. However, I must deduct a star due to the subpar quality of their burgers. It is advisable to adhere to their seafood and wing offerings to avoid disappointment.
Tasty food and friendly staff. Been coming here a few years. The prices have risen lately, but still within my budget for Indian food.

We serendipitously stumbled upon this diminutive eatery, nestled within the confines of a nondescript edifice, while perambulating in pursuit of a delectable repast. The establishment, ostensibly operated by a tight-knit family unit, boasted an unpretentious facade, which belied the culinary treasures that lay within. My gastronomic curiosity piqued, I opted for their signature offering, a Gyro, accompanied by a side of fries. The latter, though unremarkable in appearance, delighted my taste buds with their crispy texture and satisfying warmth. However, it was the former that truly captured my attention, its generous proportions bursting with savory fillings, satiating my hunger in a manner that few other establishments have managed to achieve. The proprietor, along with what appeared to be his kin, exhibited a warm and welcoming demeanor, expeditiously facilitating our orders with a cordiality that fostered a sense of belonging. Furthermore, the speed at which our victuals were delivered and the precise temperature at which they were served only further enhanced the overall dining experience. As an ardent supporter of local entrepreneurship, I take great pleasure in patronizing such enterprises, and this particular venue has secured a place among my favorites, ensuring that future visits are all but inevitable.

I was surprised by the generous portions of lettuce with that came with my order of spring rolls.  Attentive and quick service.  Never had a problem flagging down one of the 4 servers on duty.  An all around good experience.  The first pho I've had in Vegas.  While not the best broth I've ever tasted, it wasn't disappointing.

I use to be a regular at this place when it was a Starbucks. To see it reopened as a bakery had my curiousity running wild. I tried to visit this place numerous times, but they have strange hours. They are closed certain days, and then open at noon on certain days. I'd call first, regardless of what yelp says before taking a drive here. 
We went in on my nieces birthday. As soon as I seen "stuffed cookies" I was SOLD! 
Then to find out they are stuffed with things like oreos and cheesecake, snickers, and butterscotch. OMG HEAVEN!! 
They also had a huge selection of cake pops. Cool unique flavors like Nerds Rainbow, orange cream, cheesecake, and red velvet. 
There were a few carmel and candy apples, as well as HUGE chocolate dipped marshmallows.  The service was good and so were the prices. 
My only complaint was their odd schedule. Can't wait to return!

I know this is a chain, and I normally abhor and avoid chains, but I really liked this place.  The beer was excellent, the servers were very polite and attentive (Everybody speaks English) and the food was way above average.  First time we went I had a flammekuchen with Gruyere and smoked meat with a slice of dill pickle on every quarter.  Excellent!  My wife had the vegetable version which was great as well.  Second visit I had a meat dish with ham, pork knuckle, sausage and an excellent sauerkraut.  Very, very good.  We had a great time watching the Canadiens at the bar after the meal.  Overall I would highly recommend this place, at least one visit to sample their beers which are a cut above your average brew pub.
Low key atmosphere, on Mondays they have $5 burgers when you buy a $3 beer, great deal and great food.

I'm not really masterfully adept at recognising a good Indian: my weak British mouth can't handle the chilli and often leaves an unshakeable burning sensation for the rest my meal, ultimately ensuring I can't make head or foot of what I'm eating.

Deciding to man up and re-kindle my Indian food knowledge I opted for the BBC's kashmiri curry with a liberal dose of Cobra beer.  Much to my surprise I found I could recognise each flavour rather than  sweating the spices away and subsequently had an enjoyable meal.

Reasonably priced and with a cool name, I'll be back again.

Good sashimi and plenty of rolls with spice.  I've a big fan of rolls with heat and Sushi Fever has a solid selection that feature some sort of tuna/salmon combo.\n\nSat in the room to the left after you enter which featured a massive HD TV.  Comes in handy if you are like me and enjoy a distraction besides porcelain cats and other Japanese decor.

"Aaron, your proficiency in customer service is truly commendable, and I must say that the brunette bartender also demonstrated an impressive level of hospitality. Although the colossal portion of nachos presented a formidable challenge that momentarily undermined my confidence, I shall assuredly bring reinforcements on my subsequent visit. Furthermore, I had the pleasure of encountering a few friendly individuals, including Greg and Mariam from California, and Mark from New Mexico. I sincerely hope that you will reciprocate by bestowing a favorable evaluation upon this establishment."

Yummo!

Very good authentic Cuban sandwiches and pastries.  Fantastic breakfast and really liked that the omelet was not greasy.  It was so tasty, filling, and budget friendly as well.  

It's hard to find Ironbeer and Materva unless you're at a Cuban place and it was so exciting to get some. Om nom nom.

Since we were driving back to LA we picked up some great pastries for the ride home.  

They do compare themselves to Portos (they even have a sign out front that says it), however they are not Portos.  Don't expect the crazy lines (yay).  The selection of pastries is not as large but they are just as good!

I've lived here for 3 years and continue to call this my home.  Yes, there are noise issues, a less than ideal parking situation on some nights, and higher rent ...BUT, the reason I continue to call this place home is because it is so inspiring, rich and pleasing to the eyes to view and is straight up BEAUTIFUL!  I have met many good friends from this complex and expanded my contact list and network by living here.  I gave this review 4 stars because even though Optima is a beautiful place to live, there are a few things that make it just under 5 STAR.  Having said that, if you are looking to rent or purchase a condo or APT then this is the first place you better check out.  Everyone must live here for at least a year to understand the true beauty of the Optima.  I'm very excited and looking forward to the new Optima Sonoran Village to be completed, it's a similar complex that will be on the other side of Fashion Sqr mall.

I attended a meeting at Caesars in May.  I had been to Caesars many, many times, but have never stayed at the hotel.  They put us up in the Octavius Tower...very nice!  Big rooms, comfy beds, nice bathrooms and great views!

Only on a singular occasion have I had the privilege of partaking in a culinary excursion to this esteemed establishment, yet it is safe to assert that my experience was indeed superior to the average patron's. My order consisted of a half pound JalapeÃ±o Jack burger, complemented by a side of onion rings. The burger itself boasted a flawless synergy of spices, utilizing premium quality meat sourced from Midwestern pastures, and a flavorful cheese that harmonized seamlessly with the other ingredients. The onion rings, though perhaps not the primary focus of my repast, were equally impressive in both texture and taste. While the portion sizes were generous, leaving me thoroughly satiated, I must admit that the total cost of my meal, amounting to $11 and change, seemed somewhat excessive for an unpretentious, no-frills eatery catering primarily to those seeking a hasty, post-work or post-event nourishment. This minor drawback, however, did not detract significantly from my overall satisfaction with the burger, which I would unhesitatingly recommend to others.

This establishment evokes memories of the Italian eatery, Pompeii, located in Chicago, where my roommate and I frequently partook in their culinary offerings via carry-out orders. Interestingly, my visit to Phoenix coincided with my acquaintance's inclination to procure sustenance from this very venue, prompting me to diverge from our customary selections and sample their Salami, Turkey, Ham, and Mozzarella panini, which was complemented by a delectable red wine vinaigrette that greatly enhanced its flavor profile. A cursory examination of the ingredients revealed an emphasis on freshness and meticulous preparation, while the prices, though comparable to those in Chicago, remained uncertain in relation to local standards. My curiosity piqued, I would eagerly explore additional menu options at this venue.
Great build your own burgers, crazy servings of fries. Always hot and fresh and cooked and topped to your order.
I won't lie, I've been here once or twice.  Not on par with Canadian clubs but much better than the other clubs in the valley.

This eatery boasts an array of delectable Asian delights, with their Thai Spicy Noodles being a particular standout dish that never fails to satiate my gastronomical cravings. Despite its unassuming name, this culinary masterpiece consists of an amalgamation of flavorsome ingredients, including tender woked chicken and succulent shrimp, complemented by the subtle crunch of scallions and the satisfying texture of egg, all nestled atop a bed of Thai spice-infused noodles. Furthermore, the judicious application of a generous lemon wedge serves to elevate the dish to new heights of gustatory pleasure. Such is the versatility of this establishment that it caters to a diverse clientele, offering an assortment of appetizers that cater to varying dietary preferences and inclinations. Moreover, the welcoming ambiance and warm demeanor of the staff only serve to enhance the overall dining experience, making it an excellent choice for families seeking a casual yet satisfying repast.

Hyde lives up by its name, nice Hyde out if you want to be intimate 
with your date, but be careful you might get distracted with gorgeous 
model looking wait stuff. Food or should say appetizers were really 
delicious, one of the best calamari in Vegas, so crispy that it almost 
explode in your mouth and well seasoned, Wines are on the high side
but of good quality. Soda warning price $6 per order, no free refill highest
soda price, I ever paid in Vegas.

Wow... Huge... I don't even think i've seen every corner of this place... 

Several stages...

Upstairs rooms...

Girls are super nice... but... maybe cuz i'm a girl... actually... no... it's cuz they're strippers...

Strippers are nice... and they smell nice...

I just stayed two nights at Aria. It is a great hotel...my company paid for it, which is great because I would never spend that kind of money...and the rooms aren't even the worse of it!! ONE drink at the pool will set you back a hefty sum...which I can't repeat here...just know, it's probably the most expensive on the strip.
We didn't get the chocolates or a turn down service that some other reviewers have mentioned, that's ok..most everything was wonderful.  I was dismayed a bit  at the bath products...a lower end brand, and of definitely lower end quality. 
The restaurants were all really good that we ate at...the Thai place was as good, if not better, than any I've been to in the US.  The casino was nice, not too smokey, and the servers were pretty quick. 
The pool was nice, a few good choices...one that was more adult orientated, so not a bunch of kids having a great time...not something I look for in a relaxing pool day. As usual...I always wish there was more shade and/or umbrellas..but all in all..a great pool experience. 
All in all, a great place, although pricey..that's expected.

This being one of the new hotels on the strip of Las Vegas, it has a modern theme to it. 

PROS -
+ a chill, classy, relaxing resort.
+ clean pool, clean rooms, clean hallways, clean everything.
+ The rooms are extremely modern, with an electric mini-stove, refridgerator, microwave, dinner table, super soft bed, etc.
+Extremly friendly staffs


CONS -
- This wasn't the ideal place to stay when you're in Vegas celebrating your 21st with your girls. (IE - little black dresses + alcohol + stumbling to the room = hard stares)

food wise it would be a 2.5 - 3 at the most, but the place and the coffee made it up for the 4th star.

Let me start with the food. If you've never eaten authentic Spanish dishes, you'll be pleased. Otherwise you'll be disappointed. 

The olives were good. 

The shrimp dish (gambas al pil pil) was also decent.

The traditional paella was good but more a risotto than a paella. Too creamy, different kind of rice (at least the texture is different) but the saffron hint and the chorizo were tasteful.

The tortilla was ok. A little burn and dry but pretty decent.

The wine selection is limited and most of the wines are NOT Spanish, AYFKM? They had one Rivera del Duero and one Rioja. Come on, you have a Spanish themed place and no Spanish wine?

Now the coffee. I tried the cold brew and the kopi luwak. Both pretty good. The coffee paraphernalia is also worth the visit! If you are caffeine sensitive, this might not be for you.

I didn't check if in the menu they include "cafe bombon", a Spanish classic. I'll go back to verify that and if not, at least to get good coffee!

Cheers

When I think of Richardson's, I feel warm and cozy inside.  I've been on several occasions and I love the atmosphere... I always have a good time at this hidden little gem of the city.

The 'Cuisine of New Mexico' is unique... they are known for their green chile potato as well as several other pork dishes.  I usually go for the fish or seafood specials... they have a standard menu and then specials posted on chalk boards around the restaurant.

Most recently I enjoyed the blackened scallop appetizer as my entree along with a huge house salad.  The scallops were a little bit salty but cooked just right.  They were served on a tortilla with rice, beans, and a yummy spicy sauce.  Their salads are really tasty, and many of the entree specials come with a starter salad.  I went with a group of 4 and we had a couple of bottles of wine and a plain pizza as an appetizer to share.  Needless to say, none of us had room for dessert!

Be prepared for a crowd whenever you go, but enjoy your company and the people around you.  Call ahead and make a reservation if you can...  if you do have to wait, sit at the bar or by the fireplace; you can't complain once you have a drink in hand and the scent of the fire mixed with hot food and good energy.  I'll be back again soon, Richardson's!

If you're not looking for this place, you just might miss it. It's tucked away in a strip mall and worth the hunt. I went with Elite Emily as we explored Henderson more, and we were practically the only people in the spot. The orders were HUGE. It takes a lot for me to wave the white flag, but I had to ask for a box. All the food is fresh and pretty dern tasty. There's really nothing you can go wrong with here, so I'm looking forward to my next trip to try something else!

Normally the boy does not enjoy museums, but he had a lot of fun in this one.

Lots of historic sex toys and insane sex toys. Video clips, films, demonstrations. Lots and lots of sexually intense items here!

Bondage and pictures, and a relatively in depth visual view of sexual evolution. Incredibly interesting. I would actually come again. Everyone that works there is also sweet and unobtrusive.

I came here on a Sunday so I didn't need a reservation. And I must say, this place is the bee's knees.

Awesome aromas, lovely decor and atmosphere, and incredibly helpful waitstaff.

Once I mentioned I was vegan, the chef pointed out what was readily vegan and what could be altered. Way more sauces have fish/oyster sauce in them than I had originally thought! 

Definitely check this place out. I look forward to the next time I come back. Green curry with tofu... mmmmmm.

I have had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by this esteemed establishment on multiple occasions, and I must say that each visit has been a truly gratifying experience. Most recently, I had the privilege of dining here in the company of some visiting family and friends, and suffice it to say that everyone in attendance left feeling thoroughly satiated. 
  For those seeking uniquely crafted, expertly mixed beverages, this venue is an absolute must-visit destination. The drinks menu boasts an impressive array of libations, each one thoughtfully categorized by historical era and accompanied by a brief description elucidating the origins of its name. 
  During our visit, nearly all members of our party opted to take advantage of the happy hour special, which featured steaks at half price. While one of the filets was unfortunately slightly undercooked, the remainder of the dishes were cooked to perfection. Furthermore, the assortment of side dishes we ordered were, without exception, utterly delectable, with the truffle macaroni and cheese emerging as a clear favorite among our group. I would be remiss if I did not give special mention to the "Farmer" flatbread pizza, whose ingredients included bacon, spinach, and a perfectly cooked egg; this dish is nothing short of a gastronomic masterpiece, and I implore you to sample it for yourself in order to fully appreciate its splendor. 
  As for dessert, while we initially harbored doubts about our ability to consume anything further, our server's vivid descriptions quickly dispelled such concerns. We opted to try both the pizooki (a delightful, crispy flatbread confection) and the homemade doughnuts, and I am pleased to report that both offerings met and indeed surpassed our loftiest expectations. The word "heavenly" does not even begin to do justice to the sublime experience that these desserts provided. In conclusion, I must reiterate my unwavering endorsement of this superlative eatery, whose ambiance, culinary prowess, and expertly crafted potions make it a true gem, tucked away from the frenetic activity of the Las Vegas Strip.
Nice, big patio to enjoy a conversation and catch up with friends. The inside was clean and service was nice. All the pastries looked especially tasty at this location. Nice job.

During one hot spring day in Chinatown I was STARVING (as always, my metabolism  is ridiculous). Tired of my usual Thai Food fix and wanting to seek something new I find HSP on Yelp. 

Initial reaction: HOLYSH!T did this just open!? 

Turns out its located towards the end of the Chinatown Plaza extension on Wynn Rd and Spring Mountain. The lady working told me they've actually been opened for 5 years! I seriously felt like I have been living in a pineapple on the bottom of the sea. I bear crawl my hunger self to there and in front of me was a small shop with smallish quantities of various poke! it must be a good sign that there are small quantities of the poke to maintain the fish freshness. No old poke, yay! I'm not from Hawaii, an islander, or have lived anywhere with fresh off the coast fish, BUT usually I can taste fish funk. In my Shoyu Limu Tuna bowl I had no funk, only delicious fresh poke and warm rice sprinkled with black sesame seeds and only $8ish!

Excited to come back and try more.

My 10 year old boys had fun.  A little pricey but it is clean, well lit and not too loud.  For the adults....the wifi blows, the food is not very good and expensive.  A small iced latte was just under $5.  Can't bring anything in either....(and Pepsi products..ick).\n\nAll attractions/games were in good working condition.

I have been coming to this place since the mid-80s and it is definitely consistent. At face value this is a local curry house, no pretensions of fine dining but good, reasonably priced food with attentive service. There is little better on a winter's night with the freezing wind howling up Bruntsfield Place, than to battle through the double doors into a warm and inviting aroma of indian spices.  Beware when ordering the naan: they only do these in \"feed the 5,000\" size!

"It is imperative that I deduct a star due to the prolonged waiting period for the outdoor seating area, despite our repeated visits to this establishment, which has led me to infer that the patio does not accept reservations. A delay of one and a half hours at 5:30 PM is somewhat absurd, considering the reputation of this restaurant. However, it is worth noting that the culinary offerings are consistently exceptional, with my personal preference being a succulent steak, while my spouse favors either the skate or a hearty portion of slow-cooked short ribs. It is also worth mentioning that we have never encountered an unpleasant server or subpar dish during our visits. In conclusion, if you wish to partake in the ambiance of the patio, which offers unparalleled people-watching opportunities, it is advisable to anticipate a delay. Unfortunately, the current system in place does not allow for timely notification via text message when a table becomes available, which can be inconvenient given the limited range of the sensors within the casino. Nonetheless, the quality of the cuisine makes the wait worthwhile."

I have never seen a Cirque de Soleil Show before, nor any show in Vegas, for that matter. I really enjoyed it. The musicians were top-notch, the dancers were enegetic and exciting, the acrobats were breathtaking. We had a wonderful time. Of course, our tickets were free, so that makes it all that much better!

We placed an order for the delectable lobster and shrimp dip, but unfortunately, we were compelled to return it on two separate occasions due to an excessive amount of cheese, which rendered the dish unpleasantly rich and overpowering. The texture of the chips was compromised by the copious amount of cheese, causing them to break apart easily when submerged in the accompanying sauce. Consequently, the establishment graciously decided to remove the item from our bill. Subsequent to this, we opted to sample the parmesan chicken and baked potato, which proved to be a satisfying culinary experience, sufficient for two individuals to share.
Great find!  Visiting from DC and loved the unique take on menu!  Witty and original.  The food was excellent! Can't say enough about the pierogi sliders and the eggplant lasagna!!

This gastronomical establishment boasts an extensive culinary repertoire, featuring an array of delectable items on its vast bill of fare, including a breakfast menu that deviates from the customary offerings typically associated with such an eatery, encompassing an assortment of scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, and hash browns, et cetera, which, though perhaps not entirely genuine, is undoubtedly a unique attribute of this particular venue. Furthermore, the presence of piping hot pastrami and corned beef underscores the superior quality of the comestibles served here. The hospitable and accommodating nature of the staff serves as a significant factor in determining my intentions to revisit this delightful deli, rendering it a veritable haven for epicureans seeking a satisfying repast.

My husband and I went on date night and had a blast! Our instructor was Melissa and she was friendly and full of energy. However, Melissa was a little fast and slightly vague in her instructions, but gave us plenty of time to paint each step. A finished painting was hanging that we could refer back too. Drinks are average price, $5 for beer and $7 for wine. Last call drinks are half price! We ate before going so I did not have a chance to try any of the food, but there is a 20 minute dinner break half way through for everyone to eat. There were a lot of people munching on appetizers throughout the painting class. This is something I will absolutely do again, and highly recommend it for anyone looking for something fun and different.
If u come here on grave until 7am ask for Joy...great server....having saimin and Portuguese Sausage and scramble eggs....of course with rice... ono after a night out.
Very good food. Authentic. Spicy as indicated by name. We went there for dinner twice during our short visit to Vegas and we were happy both times.

It's about time Summerlin had a decent pub/bar/hang-out/tavern, whatever the hell you want to call it, it's good they have one. 
Super friendly staff, not overbearingly so, but attentive. Food was quite tasty, chicken sandwich is da bomb! The waitress said you can get it as a wrap (off the menu) , nice tip, thanks.
Few things:
1) For yelpers, if you check in you get a free shot of their house whisky. Bad thing is, it's horrible. Cinnamon / orange infused. Pretty much tasted like Triaminic cold and cough. Pass on it, trust me.
2) The bathroom sinks...I can't stand these things. Whoever thought a slightly tilted slab of tile would work as a sink...dude, you were waaaay wrong. Give me a basin and save my clothing from the splash back and the whopping 2 inches of space to place my hands under, please. 

Bottom line: Great place to hang, plenty of room to move, cool staff, great food. Just beware of the bathroom sinks....

Been here three times now and will keep coming back. One of the best buffet values for locals and with coupons a good value for visitors.
The prime rib is perfect every time, ask for a thicker cut and they are happy to give it to you. The crab legs are fresh every time I have been there and they have several types of shrimp. Something for every seafood lover.
The Mexican food could use a little work, the enchiladas have been hard but they have lots of Asian choices and the American part of the buffet has always been delicious.
And the deserts? Oh yeah! lots of choices with plenty of no sugar added ones for those who need it.
The servers are not only professional but personal.

This is a wonderful family owned restaurant with amazing service. Bagels are the best! Both the breakfast and lunch menus are extensive and the kitchen is very willing to make any dietary exceptions you have.

With moving to the other side of town, it was nice to find a new sushi spot near by. Service and rolls are great. Plus, they have a great happy hour that has options of 4-8 pieces. It gives you the option to try a lot of different rolls. All in all, it's a nice little spot and I've loved everything I've tried. Nice place as my last one was I Love Sushi.

Great wine and bruschetta, especially the apple one. Good live music when I went. They need a fire pit outside though! There is not much out there and they need to liven it up some. But great wine bar

They always take the time with my kids and are very good.  Sometimes they have a waiting list and often are booked up....so I recommend calling ahead to make an appointment.  But it is very worth it as the results speak for themselves.

"My sentiments regarding this pizza are ones of profound admiration, specifically pertaining to the judicious blend of mozzarella and provolone cheese, wherein the latter is incorporated in a manner that enhances, rather than overpowers, the former, thereby creating a culinary experience that is truly exceptional; additionally, the service we received was of an impressively high quality, such that it served to further elevate our dining experience; it is worth noting, however, that my previous experiences at this establishment have been somewhat inconsistent, with periods of disappointment interspersed among moments of satisfaction, but on this particular occasion, they demonstrated a commendable level of competence and dedication to their craft."

Great place to go for family horseback rides. I  really liked the set up and the ease with which they do paperwork, riding prep etc. They desert in north Scottsdale is beautiful this time aof year and the grounds are lovely for a spring ride. The staff was very helpful , courteous and knowledgeable.  I would go there again in a heart beat.

I was utterly thrilled to have the chance to experience the exhilaration of a roller coaster ride within the confines of a casino/hotel, despite the fact that I am perhaps approaching an age where such activities may be deemed unsuitable and, furthermore, have been known to cause a considerable amount of discomfort; however, I firmly believe that one is only young once and should seize every opportunity to indulge in youthful pursuits. The queues to purchase tickets were somewhat inefficient, which I attribute to the sudden influx of patrons eager to partake in the attraction before its closure at midnight on weekends.

The ride itself was simultaneously terrifying and humorous, as I failed to carefully consider my attire and my companion and I couldn't help but burst into fits of laughter upon viewing our photographs. The cost of each picture was $15, with the option to purchase two for $22, which we opted for and split the cost. The employee assisting us gave me a look of utter incredulity when I requested that he charge two separate cards, leading me to wonder if he truly understood the concept of customer satisfaction and the importance of fostering a positive experience for patrons. Nonetheless, this minor inconvenience did not detract from the overall enjoyment of the ride.

"Despite its unfavorable geographical positioning, Whiskey Dicks revels in its capacity to proffer an enjoyable drinking experience, courtesy of its impressive array of artfully-crafted brews and hospitable staff. Upon entering the establishment, we were warmly received by a congenial hostess clad in abbreviated attire, who expedited our seating process with alacrity. I opted for a Ranger IPA from their diverse selection of tap beverages, which, in my opinion, constitutes a commendable choice. The assortment of beers available at this everyday drinkery is indeed satisfactory. My culinary excursion began with an order of philly cheese accompanied by mesquite seasoned fries. The latter proved to be a gastronomic highlight, as the flavorful seasoning augmented the inherent deliciousness of the potatoes. However, the philly itself was not without its flaws, as the steak exhibited a tendency towards dryness and an excess of bread hindered the overall enjoyment of the dish. Nonetheless, the freshness of the onions and peppers provided a welcome contrast. Considering the aforementioned factors, I chose to elevate Whiskey Dicks by a star in my rating, primarily due to the establishment's commitment to offering a variety of palatable craft beers alongside its hospitable atmosphere. Although alternative pubs within close proximity may boast superior offerings, Whiskey Dicks' collection of New Belgian beers and Sam Adams seasonal brews renders it a worthy destination for those seeking a satisfying drinking experience."

"Having partaken of sustenance at this establishment on multiple occasions in the past, I must say that the culinary offerings have been consistently satisfactory. In fact, I have been fortunate enough to have had the pleasure of savoring their delectable dishes both via delivery and in-person, with the latter instance occurring in close proximity to my place of employment. My customary order consists of the Chicken Pita, which boasts an impressive array of flavors thanks to the grilled poultry, complemented by the nutritious whole wheat pita bread. Furthermore, I take great delight in augmenting my meal with a tangy cucumber sauce and a spicy hot garlic chili sauce, thus creating a veritable symphony of taste sensations. It is my conviction that this eatery merits unreserved endorsement, particularly given the reasonable price point of $8 for a complete pita."

Been here a few times and I must say I like this place!


Staff: A+ (Very Friendly and prompt) 

Vibe: B+ (Like a Toby Keith's JR.)

Entertainment: A+ (Awesome live music)

Bar :A ( Its got everything except Norm)

Prices: Average

Food: B ( Pass on the steak) go for the burgers and fries.

Overall I give this place a SOLID A!

Check this place out your gonna love the people and the atmosphere. We will be back for sure!






burgers.

I came here first time with an educated shooter that already had guns i could use. This was my second time ever shooting but first at a range. They sold us the bullets and targets gave us protective geer and off we went to an enclosed room to shoot very simple short breefing. Place is nicely set up central location, staff was nice. The other two people went to get certified not the paper test but shooting test i decided i needed more time to practice. The only thing i really did not like was how many tourist were there. I really hope they open another location more for locals. The prices are to high because its geared toward tourism. I like the fact classes are free though. I went on a monday around 9am not to busy but as the day progressed the place got packed so go during the week early otherwise you will be waiting. I will be back to practice more and test taking but i think im going to save some money and look for a cheaper place for bullets and targets.

The food is amazing.  If you've eaten at another Bianco restaurant, imagine that.... only better, with more options.

The service is not great.  Slow, they forget things, etc.

The portions are SMALL.

We went on a Saturday night and had our choice of inside or outside table with no waiting... so I think that issue is sort of hit or miss.

Vietnamese Sandwiches: The only thing I go here for, To be honest this is the best Vietnamese sandwiches in Las Vegas, trust me. Not like Lee's Sandwiches. Hue Thai bakes their bread fresh so when you get your sandwiches the breads soft and a little bit crunchy but still a little warm. I've tried a couple places and this place has to be the best. 

Other foods: They have a variety of Vietnamese dishes, Chinese, and even Thai. But nothing taste super Authentic. So that's why I never order anything there except the Vietnamese sandwiches and their boba (which is decent). Not a fan of their Pho

Price: Vietnamese Sandwiches here are dirt cheap, $3.50 a sandwich I believe. Only sucky thing is they require a minimum of $20 to charge a debit card. Which you should know by now, I'm a yelper who doesn't like to carry cash.

take out/eat there: To be honest dining there isn't so bad, other than the odd smell of cleaning products and food mixed together and the eye sore hallway to the bathroom the place is pretty alright. The design I guess is some kind of under the sea theme? I have no idea why its under the sea that has nothing to do with Vietnamese food. 

4/5 Stars for Price/Vietnamese Sandwiches/ Decent Boba
The barbecue was good but not great. They do have a nice selection of barbecue sauces. The complimentary kettle chips were a nice touch. On the plus side, the food came lightning fast.

Fantastic!  The Farm burger was fabulous and the sweet potato fries with powder sugar were great. Huge fan of food.  Service on the hand was slow. They forgot our fries and we had to ask for them and did not get them until we were 3/4 done with our burgers.

I have been a loyal patron of this establishment for in excess of a decade, and despite my occasional forays into alternative venues, I invariably find myself returning to Nancy's salon, primarily due to the warm and welcoming ambiance, but also because of the exceptional quality of their nail care services and pedicures, which have consistently met, and indeed surpassed, my expectations.

This establishment offers an exceptional experience, as evidenced by the abundance of items I acquired for my son upon his birth, primarily consisting of gently used articles of clothing from my husband's extensive family and several of my close acquaintances, which rendered it impossible for him to don them all, even if I altered his attire five times daily. Consequently, I undertook a quest to locate a reputable consignment venue where I could procure novel apparel for him as he developed. Fortunately, numerous such establishments exist in my vicinity (specifically, central Phoenix), and after visiting two other locations prior to arriving at Smarty Pants (with the caveat being not to frequent Urban Baby, as it proved unsatisfactory), I encountered a warm and hospitable reception from the mother-daughter ownership duo. They accepted the majority of the items I presented and, despite my initial intention to merely deposit my goods, I found myself indulging in a shopping spree, resulting in the acquisition of three superior tops for a mere $15 in total. The shop boasted an incredible inventory, maintained a spotless environment, and offered amiable service, thereby rendering it a veritable haven for customers. Additionally, I learned of their impending expansion into the adjacent space, destined to accommodate furniture, while the current location would feature an increased selection of adult attire (although, it's possible that the new space would be designated for clothing, with the existing one being upgraded to accommodate more adult fashion). Consequently, I shall return shortly to invest my consignment funds. My gratitude extends to Smarty Pants.

After seeing Paul put his review up...I had to join in! This venue is almost perfect in design and the acoustics are amazing. I love outdoor concerts and yet the amphitheater gives you a club feel while being outside.

That being said...like my review of the Fillmore...you will see that catching a buzz will require a credit card or a well hidden flask (leave your bongs at home). The whole Music Factory complex begs for a keg party straight out of high school to explode in the parking lot. Wait...what? Oh...that's right...we DO tailgate before shows. Ten dollars can get you a 12 pack of PBR and a sammy...or one 24 ounce beer inside...and that's without a tip. My tip? Lower your freakin drink prices!

Like others have said though...this place is great and they're attracting better and more obscure acts all the time. I'm just happy to have some reputable venues around.

This place had such high reviews on Yelp that we drove all the way from Scottsdale on our vacation to Tempe to visit this place. And it was worth it! From the front doorman asking me for my ID (knowing I'm well over 30) to saying my name right and telling us to have a great time, to the bartenders asking every few minutes if we were OK, to the delicious blue cheese burger, we were happy campers the entire time. I'm not a beer drinker, but my boyfriend tried all 3 beers and loved all of them. It's a fun, casual, sports bar environment and a great place for bar food.

I drove by and there was a blank storefront with no signage or notice. Turns out it moved across the street and is now near the other furniture stores (At Home, Creative Leather, Spencer's Appliance) at 2711 S. San Tan Village Pkwy, Gilbert. The new store is brighter and has floor-to-ceiling windows on 2 sides.

"As I previously mentioned in my initial posting regarding Princess Nails, the ambiance leaves much to be desired, bordering on squalor, and can aptly be described as a veritable hole in the wall. However, allow me to reiterate that Michelle, the individual responsible for administering the eyebrow waxing treatment, is truly exceptional. My second visit proved to be just as satisfying as the initial encounter. It is imperative that you request her services explicitly. While I refrain from bestowing a perfect five-star rating due to the establishment's conspicuous lack of cleanliness, I cannot help but wonder how they would fare without Michelle's expertise. It is essential to note that my assessment is founded solely on my experiences with eyebrow waxing and does not take into account any other services offered at this location, such as nail care, which I have never availed myself of and have no intention of doing so in the future."

It is a older hotel so you don't think of going there for the buffet right of the bat.  We somehow ended up here and the buffet was pretty good.  Not the largest selection but of what they offered everything was good quality (that's what really matters).  I was pleasantly surprised.  Would definitely go back.

After spending a few summers in Phoenix you learn to locate and love certain watering holes.  One of the best treats to cool off the perspiration of a long Phoenix afternoon is the date shake at Sphinx.  This place has a long history with Scottsdale and its shakes have been hydrating sweaty residents for several decades now.

We have been anxiously awaiting the opening of this  new restaurant.  We went on the second night it was open and we were very pleased!  Service, chips and salsa, food, and drinks were very good!  They have done a wonderful job with the remodel of the interior.  Nice to have another choice in  this area to enjoy - a nice complement to our other excellent Mexican restaurants!

We finally got a Jimmy John's and I had heard so much about it being great.  We tried two different sandwiches (the No 9 Italian Night Club on their great french roll and the No 12 Beach Club on  thick sliced 7 grain bread).  Great quality product, great bread, very competitive pricing.  It is a little noisy with the music and hard surfaces in this location thou.  They are a brand new location so that will probably change (hope) over time.

"It is rather amusing, to say the least, that we initially opted to dine at a burger establishment situated at Mandalay, only to be met with an utter lack of acknowledgement from the staff for a duration of five minutes, which, might I add, felt more like an eternity considering we had previously indulged in a ninety-minute extravaganza at the MJ One show and were thus ravenous beyond belief. Therefore, we decided to abandon our endeavors at said burger joint and venture forth to this esteemed eatery instead. Verily, the contrast was nothing short of stark. The service we received here was indeed impeccable, albeit not in the least bit haughty or pretentious. My companion and I elected to partake in distinct tasting menus, with mine being the Alain Ducasse four-course variety, sans wine, of course. The culinary journey began with a refreshing amuse-bouche of cold broccoli soup, followed by an absolutely delectable lobster curry, succeeded by a heavenly portion of foie gras atop a tender filet, and ultimately concluded with a sublime Armagnac dessert. I must confess that the presentation and flavors of each dish were, for the most part, truly captivating. In fact, the sole exception to this rule was the uninspired mashed potatoes that accompanied the filet, which, quite frankly, paled in comparison to the rest of the meal. Nonetheless, the ambiance of the establishment exuded an air of romance, while the breathtaking view from its vantage point only added to the overall experience, making it, in my opinion, an occasion worth every penny spent."

"A remarkably excellent minor coffee establishment, strategically positioned for an invigorating mid-shopping spree rejuvenation. Albeit slightly arduous to locate, diligent patrons can uncover this hidden gem by traversing the passageway nestled between Centre Eaton and Place Ville-Marie. It must be noted that this venue more closely resembles a counter than a traditional coffeehouse, as seating is scarce and the atmosphere is reminiscent of a hasty "fast food" establishment. However, rest assured that your order will be fulfilled with remarkable efficiency, taking no more than 5-10 minutes of your time, and the attentive customer service you receive will leave a lasting positive impression."

HUGE PORTIONS! 

Came here for lunch with my employers while I was attending a Seminar at the Hilton which is close-by. We came in and was seated promptly. Our waitress always had a smile and was quite the busy bee going from table to table. Impressive. 

I ordered a cheeseburger with fries. Markus and Miyoko ordered salads. When the salads came.. it really looked like 3 salads combined into one serving. Miyoko ordered the steak and mushroom salad that looked tasty.. Markus's salad was the same size but had an array of fruit on it. All of us were shocked of how big the portions were. I ordered my cheeseburger well done.. but it came back a bit burnt. I still ate it, but was a bit sad that it had been charred. 

All in all a good place to grab food. Especially since I heard the Riviera had crappy food joints to eat at. Would I eat here again? Only if I were in the general vicinity of the area. Its good to be back home in SF.

So after our hell of a boring time at PURE we walked our drunk asses over to Poetry. The sound of hip hop was like a breath of fresh air. Our first appearance was Thursday night around 1:30 am (or should I say Friday morning?) No cover (worked some magic) I think ladies were $20?? Anyways...we had sssooo much fun here....we danced all night....I had the best time here. Drinks came fast...everyone had a blast! If you like hip hop music this is the spot to be. \n\nWe actually came back for round two the next night and it was just as fun! I will mos def be stopping by every time I'm in Vegas....

Fish and Chips anyone? Had that and the quesadilla last night, both were delicious, but i'll admit I feel a little sluggish today. Place was clean, well kept, nice waitress. We went on a quiz or trivia night, so the mood was pretty mello. Tap beers seemed pretty standard for a pub. I will definitely go back for a nightcap as it is an easy walk from my house.
I had the smoked salmon on a egg white omelet.  Staff nice, ambiance fantastic, easy parking, prices comparable to downtown Scottsdale.  My drink was kinda week, but I would return for sure.

My review will strictly be on what I ordered:

White Pizza - Fantastic and straight to the point.  Cheesy without being overwhelming and heavy.  1 slice is all you really need to reach contentment unless you're someone with an over-sized appetite.  Pizza is always coming out fresh.  Huge globs of ricotta, total score.  I prefer my white pizzas a little on the creamier side, but this was good enough.  Can't complaint about a $5 slice if you're in Vegas.  Great for late night eats especially if you're staying at the hotel.

OVERALL:  Great people, love the man behind the counter.  Quick service as well.

Like I always say, YOU WON'T KNOW UNLESS YOU TRY IT FOR YOURSELF!

Summer's proficiency in haircutting and her exceptional customer service skills rendered an unforgettably satisfactory encounter, which left me reluctant to entrust my tresses to any other stylist. Her meticulous approach and commitment to catering to my preferences were evident throughout the process, ensuring a look that not only surpassed my expectations but also fostered a sense of loyalty towards her services. Such a remarkable experience has secured her a permanent client in me, and I shall unhesitatingly return to her expertise in the future.

This is my second visit to Victoria and was for a Yelp event so obviously the atmosphere was great, but you could tell from the attitude of the bar staff that this is a great place to visit when there isn't a nice organised event (Thanks Jody B)

The mulled cider is really something you should try with options of either Lingonberry or Pear - the former is my favourite and reminds me of visits to a certain Swedish furniture store where they serve meatballs. Victoria's is, of course, part of the group of Swedish themed bars around Edinburgh including Hemma, Sofi's and Joseph Pearce which is where the link becomes pertinent.

Will definitely use this bar in the future as a meeting place when I'm around Leith Walk.

Day two of the restaurant being open so all the staff were on their toes.  Tried the Buddy's Salumi & Cheese Board (olives, pickled vegetables, grilled Italian bread, genoa salami, spicy capicola, proscuitto di parma, grana padano, tuscan pecorino, and gorgonzola).  The capicola and proscuitto were the best I've ever had and the gorgonzola was epic - bleu cheese flavor with the texture of brie.  Cheeseburger at an Italian restaurant?  You bet because the Pat Lafrieda Burger (brioche bun, tomato aioli, provolone cheese, tuscan fries) was really tasty.  The tiramisu was the best I've had anywhere.\n\nAsk for a table bordering the outside perimeter windows for great views of The Strip.  Bring your camera to take pictures of the incredible entree cakes Buddy and his team made.

I love independent/art/documentary/not-mainstream movies, so consequently, Camelview is one of my favorite spots as they are one of the few theaters here in the valley that gets these films.

Positive things about the theater: 
*Great movies! 
*Friendly employees
*Reasonably sized drinks (movie theater "bucket-o-cola" drinks are a pet peeve of mine and their small is equivalent to a medium soda from a fast food restaurant, which is just perfect) 
*Yummy cinnamon almonds for sale at the concession stand
*A retro-y feel 

Negatives
*Older theater that feels a bit rundown
*No stadium seating
*Seats that are not particularly comfortable

Point of note (not positive or negative)
*because of the type of movies they show, it seems like it is often popular with an older crowd of moviegoers. This can make for a sortof unique moviegoing experience if you come from a different demographic.

It is a fun spot that we manage to visit every couple of months. I wish that there were more options for Art films here in the Valley, but for the moment I do love Camelview, because I don't really have a choice in the matter ;)

Thanks to Yelp reviews I found these guys.  I live alone and was nervous about hiring a moving company.  The first thing they did was send me a picture and biography of the estimator who would be contacting me which made me feel secure.  They arrived exactly on time and worked quickly.  I would have given them 5 stars except they re-assembled my trundle bed incorrectly and I am still trying to get it fixed.  Otherwise the move was perfect and I would totally recommend these guys.

I don't have a whole lot of experience with liquor stores, but have always been pleased here.  The staff are always nice, helpful, and non-intrusive.\n\nI once went with my boyfriend, who expressed a desire for a certain beer that they didn't have.  The dude behind the counter immediately said that they would order it.  Lo and behold, the next time we went, there it was.  We proceeded to buy lots of it.  Everything after that is kind of a blur.

The show was good! But not a spectacular show as what you'd expect from their ABCD competition. However, I did put into consideration that they perform two shows in one night that is 90 minutes long each. Putting that into consideration, it would make sense of the JBWKZ to not push themselves to the limit. SO, it wasn't a mind  blowing show, but they did add sparks to the show with the electrifying technology to make it look fun. Nice spin offs of different variation of music from... 40s, Disney's, Hip Hop, Punk, even some disco music haha. Fun.

Good bar for the location and size. This would be a good place to get started for the night. I ended up standing by the bar and getting carded when I asked for water. Blech. Drinks were yummy and there was a little room to dance. \n\nThe stage above the bar was AWESOME. It was especially nice that there was a hot chick on mic. Fun stuff when you've been drinking.
I loved the ice coffee and everything I've ordered here has been fantastic!\nIs my go to breakfast joint while in this area.

"Upon entering the establishment, I was taken aback by the revelation that DSW now carries an assortment of running shoes, a departure from their customary array of casual and formal footwear for men. Although it does not compare to the specialized inventory of a store such as Run for your Life or TrySports, it was gratifying to encounter a retailer that offers esteemed brands like Mizuno and Asics. My routine typically involves navigating the right-hand side of the store, where the male shoes are showcased, in addition to the rear clearance section. My sibling frequently visits this location, occasionally for extended periods, which is understandable given the extensive variety of options available on the women's side."

Instead of a long wait next door, I decided to try Waffallonia for the first time.  I ordered the waffle with Nutella, bananas, and strawberries.  At first the serving size of one waffle looked a bit small for my appetite.  However, joke was on me as I started digging more and more into this brunch.  The waffle was very filling and so good.  There were sugary bites that reminded me of a funnel cake.  The fruit was fresh and everything tasted great mixed together.  I am happy there was a wait next door which prompted me to try this as it was very worth it.  The atmosphere was cozy as well as the few seats inside were pressed up against a tiny counter.  Waffallonia was a cool place with fantastic waffles.

Great experience!!! I hadn't tried the Mesa location yet and I went in for a yummy bowl of pasta and left not only satisfied, but incredibly grateful for my wonderful bartender/server! If you make it into this location make sure you ask for Ashley! She is fun and spunky and fast on her feet. She knew all the regulars and her smile was contagious! Best experience at  Oregano's by far. I will be back for the Big Rig and Ashley.

I stopped in here with the owner's girlfriend after she cut my hair. She kindly treated me to anything I wanted to eat and drink. wooo hoo! I ordered a Grey Goose and cranberry and a Las Vegas roll (my all time favorite sushi- even if it is fried). Both were delicious. Thank you!!

Last week, on the way from the Airport to the Convention Center, me and my buddies decided it was time for some breakfast.   Fortunately, we came across this IHOP.   The place was pretty empty, I believe there were only two other parties there besides us.   The service was fast and friendly.   Our hostess / waitress (Shee was her name) was awesome.   The food was average for an IHOP.   You know what you will get.   As a bonus, this IHOP is close to the Pinball Hall of Fame.   \nThis is a good place for breakfast.   \nWill I be back?   Yeah, maybe.

This review is only for the Chippery, not the daiquiris. (Though I bet they are delicious!) 

I was wandering around the Forum Shops and I wanted just a little snack before heading home. My friends were getting daiquiris and I saw they have food in the back so I shoved my way through all those wanting frozen drinks and went back. I was pleasantly surprised at the chip selection. They had 6-8 flavored of homemade chips for really reasonable prices, $3 or $5 per bag depending on size. 

The only reason that it gets less than 5 stars is that the service wasn't great. Not cheery people this afternoon at Caesars! It is definitely a hidden gem for a cheap little snack.

It's a maze of toys that you won't find at most department stores. 

I like the organization. It makes it easy to go the the area you want. All toys in their proper spot, divided into Toddler toys, board games, stuffed animals, learning toys, dolls, sports toys, action figured, cars, etc. 

I was serious about the maze thing, lol. There is 1 entrance and 1 exit and they are not interchangeable :) When you first walk in, because they know children so well and their ability to walk in a door and then break out into an all out sprint in all directions, you are guided through a few isles that curve around (they are chalk full of toys, of course) and THEN you get to the main isle. 

My check out experience was awesome. The lady actually noticed that I was hiding something my nieces view and she made sure to scan it when she wasn't looking and to double bag it :D I love her. 

Prices range, but the toys here do seem to be pricier in general compared to most department stores, but like it said, they have a much wider variety.

"The diminutive dimensions of the eatery do not detract from its ambiance, which exudes a convivial and welcoming aura, while the judicious deployment of embellishments and accoutrements contributes to an overall sense of refinement and sophistication; the attentive and proficient service further enhances the culinary experience. The Pad See Ew, a stir-fried rice noodle dish imbued with a rich, complex flavor profile replete with a variety of spices, is somewhat let down by a modest serving size, which, though perhaps understandable given its placement on the lunch menu, leaves a tad bit to be desired. In contrast, the Pad Thai, a dish consisting of stir-fried rice noodles, chicken, and a flavorsome sauce, boasts an impressive quantity that complements its commendable quality, with each component displaying a satisfying texture and taste; indeed, the dish elicits unreserved praise and ensures that future visits to this establishment will be forthcoming."

This place is very very tasty. The drive thru is still there so you can enjoy that, it was fast and the person who took my order was very peppy and helpful which was awesome!

The wings were perfectly cooked and very large. The only draw-back is the sides. We got french-fries and potato salad. The fries were great (according to my girlfriend) the potato salad although good the portion was incredibly small. It came in a 2 oz little plastic cup and was definitely not what I expected for $1.89 worth of potato salad which is why only 4 stars.

Other than that this place is a smash hit, avoid the sides get the wings you can mix and match the flavors as well and you won't be disappointed at all.

Watch out other wing places this is a serious contender in my opinion!
